title: An Act Concerning The Display Of The Constitution Of The United States For Students In Public Schools Throughout The State.
description: To ensure that students are able to learn about the foundation of the rights and liberties of all citizens of the United States of America.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring The State To Pay For The Costs Of Any Survey Or Other Maintenance Of Wyassup Lake That Is Required Or Conducted By The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To require the state, rather than residents of Wyassup Lake, to pay for any survey costs required by the state or the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Authorizing Sunday Hunting On Public And Private Property By Shotgun Or Rifle.
description: To authorize hunting on Sunday on private and public lands by shotgun or rifle.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Food Scrap Recycling Programs.
description: To establish a grant program to assist towns with diverting food scraps from the waste stream.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Commissioner Of Agriculture's Responsibilities For Rabbit Processing In The State.
description: To provide a way for rabbits to be processed in the state for consumption by consumers and retail food establishments.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/03

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Glyphosate On State And Municipal Owned Properties.
description: To reduce the use of glyphosate in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Establishing An Extended Producer Responsibility Program For Solar Panels.
description: To provide for the safe and responsible disposal of solar panels.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Exemption Of Certain Persons From The Passport To The Parks Motor Vehicle Registration Fee.
description: To exempt senior citizens from the Passport to the Parks fee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Sale Of Cats, Dogs And Rabbits In Pet Shops.
description: To prohibit the sale of animals in pet shops that originate from puppy mills and other inhumane commercial breeding facilities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Registration Fees For Diagnostic And Therapeutic X-ray Devices .
description: To reduce operating costs for medical and dental providers in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Authorizing The Use Of A Single-shot Handgun To Hunt Deer On Certain Private Property.
description: To allow the use of a single-shot handgun for the hunting of deer on private land.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Exempting Senior Citizens, Veterans And Active Duty Members Of The Armed Forces From The Passport To The Parks Motor Vehicle Registration Fee.
description: To exempt seniors, veterans and active duty members of the armed forces from the Passport to the Parks motor vehicle registration fee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Installation Of Certain Solar Photovoltaic Generating Systems Near Residences.
description: To prohibit the Connecticut Siting Council from approving the installation of any solar photovoltaic generating facility within five hundred feet of any residence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring The Appointment Of The Attorney General And Consumer Counsel To The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
description: To require that the Attorney General and the Consumer Counsel, or their respective designees, be appointed to the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Establishing A Personal Income Tax Deduction For Certain Payments Received From An Insurance Company.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction for the portion of any payment from an insurance company received by a taxpayer (1) in exchange for a buyout or cancellation of a long-term care insurance policy, and (2) that is properly includable in gross income for federal income tax purposes.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

title: An Act Increasing The Amount Of The Personal Income Tax Deduction For Contributions To State-established 529 Qualified State Tuition Programs.
description: To increase the amount of the personal income tax deduction for contributions to accounts for 529 qualified state tuition programs established and maintained by the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning A Personal Income Tax Credit For Certain College Graduates With Stem Degrees.
description: To reestablish a credit against the personal income tax for certain college graduates who receive a degree in a science, technology, engineering or math-related field.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Cap On Research And Development Tax Credits.
description: To increase the amount of research and development tax credits a taxpayer may utilize in an income year.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Deduction And Withholding Of Personal Income Tax From Pension Payments And Annuity Distributions.
description: To eliminate the requirement that payers deduct and withhold personal income tax from lump-sum payments of pension payments and annuity distributions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Personal Income Tax Deduction For Military Funeral Honor Guard Detail Compensation.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction for any compensation received by a taxpayer for attending a funeral as a member of an honor guard detail pursuant to section 27-76 of the general statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Design And Construction Of A Train Station In The Town Of Newington.
description: To provide funding for the design and construction of a train station in the town of Newington.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Methodology Used To Adjust The Volatility Cap Transfer Threshold.
description: To amend the methodology used to calculate the annual adjustment to the threshold amount of the revenue transfer under section 4-30a of the general statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Estate And Gift Taxes And The Use Of The Revenue Generated From Such Taxes.
description: To reduce the estate tax exemption threshold to three million six hundred thousand dollars and eliminate the caps on estate and gift taxes, and deposit the revenue from such taxes in the Early Childhood Education Fund.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Capital Gains Surcharge And Concerning The Use Of The Revenue Generated From Such Surcharge.
description: To establish a capital gains surcharge on certain taxpayers, to be deposited in the Early Childhood Education Fund.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Personal Income Tax Deductions For Social Security Benefits, Pension And Annuity Income And Distributions From Certain Individual Retirement Accounts.
description: To replace the current personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits, pension and annuity income and distributions from certain individual retirement accounts and eliminate the marriage penalty.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Dedicating The Sales And Use Taxes Revenue Generated From Alcohol Sales To Certain Purposes.
description: To dedicate all sales and use taxes revenue generated from the sale, acceptance or receipt in this state of alcohol to rehabilitation and treatment programs, drunk driving prevention efforts and the establishment of a recovery school.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Selection Of The Presiding Officer For An Agency Proceeding Hearing.
description: To prevent conflicts of interest in agency proceedings by prohibiting the presiding officer in an agency proceeding hearing from being a member or employee of the agency.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring Presentation Of Photo Identification To Vote.
description: To require presentation of photo identification to vote.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Withdrawing Connecticut From The National Popular Vote Interstate Compact.
description: To withdraw the state from the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating The Spring Peeper As The State Amphibian.
description: To designate the spring peeper as the state amphibian.
last_action: Vote to Draft

title: An Act Concerning Connecticut Craft Cafe Liquor Permittees.
description: To enable Connecticut craft cafe permittees to apply to expand their permit premises to include premises with separate addresses.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Building Trade Occupational Licenses.
description: To consolidate building trade occupational licenses.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Motor Vehicle Data Privacy And Victims Of Domestic Violence.
description: To provide for the termination of, and require disclosure regarding the use of, remote vehicle technology.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/10

title: An Act Concerning Motor Vehicle Data Privacy.
description: To prohibit motor vehicle manufacturers and certain technology platforms from collecting or selling certain motor vehicle data without motor vehicle owners' consent.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Business Entities To Provide Itemized Receipts To Certain Consumers.
description: To require business entities to, upon request, provide itemized receipts to certain consumers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Payment Of Certain Personal Property Taxes As A Precondition To Professional And Occupational License Renewals.
description: To require an applicant seeking renewal of a professional or occupational license to demonstrate that the applicant does not owe any taxes assessed against the personal property that such applicant uses in the course of such applicant's profession or occupation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Cannabis Consumption At Locations Where Tobacco Use Is Prohibited.
description: To prohibit cannabis consumption at locations where tobacco use is prohibited.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Cannabis Consumption At Locations Where Alcohol Consumption Is Prohibited.
description: To prohibit cannabis consumption at locations where alcohol consumption is prohibited.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Retailers To Disclose Health Risks Posed By Contact Lenses.
description: To require retailers that sell, fit or otherwise provide contact lenses to consumers to disclose to consumers, at the point of sale, that wearing contact lenses while engaging in certain activities poses certain health risks.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Expanding The Debt-free Community College Program To Include Connecticut State University Students.
description: To expand the debt-free community college program to include students enrolled at a state university within the Connecticut State University System.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Concerning Fees Charged By Institutions Of Higher Education.
description: To (1) prohibit institutions of higher education from charging fees to students that are not part of tuition and room and board costs, and not disclosed prior to requiring an enrollment deposit; and (2) require institutions of higher education to return unexpended meal plan funds.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Public Hearing 02/20

title: An Act Concerning Loans Made By The Connecticut Housing Finance Authority.
description: To require the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority to prioritize issuing loans for properties purchased in a municipality containing seven thousand five hundred or fewer residents.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prohibiting Health Care Providers And Clinical Laboratories From Imposing Out-of-pocket Expenses Based On Estimates Of Charges.
description: To prohibit any health care provider or clinical laboratory from imposing, for health care services or treatment rendered to an insured, a coinsurance, copayment, deductible or other out-of-pocket expense at the time of such service or treatment based on an estimate of charges, rather than an amount identified in the medical bill for such service or treatment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Prohibiting Residential Real Property Transactions That Condition The Sale Of Property On Home Inspection Limitations.
description: To prohibit a seller of residential real property from (1) conditioning the sale of such property on the prospective buyer waiving or limiting a home inspection of such property, or (2) accepting an offer from such prospective buyer if such seller has been informed in advance that such prospective buyer intends to waive or limit such prospective buyer's right to a home inspection of such property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Diagnostic And Screening Colonoscopies.
description: To require individual and group health insurance policies to provide full health insurance coverage, without any out-of-pocket expense, for (1) diagnostic and screening colonoscopies, and (2) any necessary medical procedure preparation when recommended by a health care provider within such provider's scope of practice.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Prescription Drug Costs.
description: To (1) apply all available discounts or coupons for any prescription drug, and (2) notify customers, before presenting any prescription drug to such customer, of any available prescription drug discount programs and generic prescription drug alternatives that may lower the price of such prescription drug.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning A Police Officer's Ability To Request Consent To Search A Motor Vehicle.
description: To allow police officers the ability to request consent to search a motor vehicle in order to take illegal weapons and drugs off the street, as well as assist in collecting evidence of a crime.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Use Of Deadly Force.
description: To ensure that peace officers are properly evaluated for the use of force.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Increasing The Penalty For Possession Of Child Pornography.
description: To increase the penalty for possession of child pornography.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Qualified Immunity For Law Enforcement Officers.
description: To reduce ambiguity related to qualified immunity for law enforcement officers and provide guidance for such officers regarding lawful actions in the field.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Reducing The Filing Fee For Annual Reports Filed By Limited Partnerships, Limited Liability Companies And Limited Liability Partnerships.
description: To reduce the filing fee for annual reports filed by limited partnerships, limited liability companies and limited liability partnerships from eighty dollars to twenty dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Adopting The Uniform Real Property Transfer On Death Act.
description: To allow an owner of real property to pass the property simply and directly by operation of law to a beneficiary upon the owner's death.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Habeas Corpus Proceedings.
description: To revise habeas corpus proceedings in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Legal Liability For Agricultural Operations That Are Engaged In Agritourism.
description: To limit the liability of agricultural operators engaged in agritourism in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Creating The Option To Not Participate In The Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program.
description: To allow an employee to opt out of both making contributions to and filing a claim for benefits from the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning A Public Employee's Right To Be A Member Of A Union.
description: To provide clear disclosures on state and municipal collective bargaining agreements of an employee's right to opt out of membership in a union.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Public Employees' Selection Of An Exclusive Bargaining Unit.
description: To protect public employees' right to elect a union of their choice to represent their interests.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Notice Of Taxes Due To Municipal Tax Collectors.
description: To allow municipal tax collectors to publish notice of due taxes in newspapers of general circulation not published in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Certificates Of Occupancy.
description: To ensure developer compliance with site plans approved by municipal zoning commissions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Tax Assessment Of Common Interest Community Units Upon The Reduction Of Municipal Services.
description: To allow a municipality to reduce the assessed value of any unit located in a common interest community when such unit no longer receives certain municipal services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Municipal Regulation Of Street Takeovers.
description: To authorize municipalities to adopt ordinances that penalize street takeovers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Authorizing The Online Publication Of Municipal Legal Notices.
description: To authorize municipalities to post legal notices on municipal Internet web sites in lieu of publication in a newspaper.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Regulations For Nonresidential Solar Photovoltaic Systems.
description: To require solar farms to comply with local planning and zoning laws.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Approval For Certain Nonresidential Solar Photovoltaic Facilities.
description: To allow any municipality with two or more existing nonresidential solar photovoltaic facilities located within such municipality to (1) approve or reject subsequent nonresidential solar photovoltaic facilities proposed for construction or installation in such municipality, and (2) impose a moratorium on the construction or installation of such facilities within such municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Lending Practices By Health Care Providers.
description: To prohibit health care providers from engaging in certain lending practices.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on General Law

title: An Act Eliminating The Requirements To Obtain A Certificate Of Need To Establish New Health Care Facilities Or Services And Transfer Ownership Of Existing Health Care Facilities.
description: To promote the expansion of and access to health care services in the state by requiring certificate of need approval only for the termination of existing facilities and services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning Death Certificates.
description: To require registrars of vital statistics to issue standard death certificates and short form death certificates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Prohibiting Licensure Of Acute Care Hospitals That Lease Property Owned By Real Estate Investment Trusts.
description: To prohibit ownership of hospitals by real estate investment trusts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Permitting A Moral Or Philosophical Objection As An Exemption From School Immunization Requirements.
description: To allow a moral or philosophical objection as an exemption from school immunization requirements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning The Termination Of Inpatient Or Outpatient Services Offered By A Hospital.
description: To (1) prohibit the termination of inpatient or outpatient services provided by a hospital without clear and convincing evidence that such termination would not decrease health care accessibility or affordability in the affected area, (2) require the notification of the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to public health regarding the need for termination of any inpatient or outpatient services offered by a hospital, and (3) prohibit the overturning of a decision made by the Office of Health Strategy denying an application for a certificate of need for termination of inpatient or outpatient services offered by a hospital absent new evidence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring Written Notice Regarding Medical Records.
description: To provide transparency to patients regarding the storage and maintenance of their medical records by health care providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Redefining "large Capacity Magazine".
description: To allow the possession of a firearm magazine that has the capacity of not more than fifteen rounds of ammunition.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Allowing The Purchase, Possession And Importation Of Large Capacity Magazines By Certain Persons.
description: To allow the purchase, possession and importation of large capacity magazines by (1) a licensed security guard while in the performance of such licensed security guard's duties, and (2) a holder of a photographic identification issued under the federal Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Restoring Qualified Immunity To Law Enforcement Officers.
description: To reduce ambiguity and provide guidance for police officers regarding proper actions in the field.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Requiring The Revision Of The Model Pursuit Policy To Allow Police Officers To Pursue Individuals Suspected Of Committing Certain Property Crimes.
description: To better protect the public by allowing police officers to pursue individuals suspected of committing certain property crimes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Authorizing The Sale Of Consumer Fireworks.
description: To authorize the sale of consumer fireworks in this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Drug Recognition Expert Training For Law Enforcement Officers.
description: To provide funding for drug recognition expert training so that law enforcement officers can identify motor vehicle operators who are operating under the influence of cannabis or a substance other than alcohol.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Allowing Off-duty Law Enforcement Officers To Carry Firearms On School Grounds.
description: To allow off-duty law enforcement officers to carry firearms on school grounds.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning The Authority Of A Police Officer To Transport A Person To An Emergency Room Or A Substance Abuse Facility.
description: To allow a police officer to take a person into protective custody and transport such person to an emergency room or a substance abuse facility if the officer has administered an opioid antagonist to such person or taken other lifesaving measures.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Limiting Orders Related To Firearms And Ammunition During A Civil Preparedness Or Public Health Emergency.
description: To prohibit the Governor or any municipality from restricting lawful possession of a firearm or ammunition during a civil preparedness or public health emergency.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of Ammunition At Gun Clubs And Firearm Ranges.
description: To allow a gun club or firearm range to sell ammunition for use at such club or range to any person without requiring such person to hold a valid ammunition certificate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning Compliance With A Requirement That Certain Information Regarding Firearms Be Publicly Posted.
description: To determine the level of compliance with the requirement to publicly post information about firearm permitting rights specified in section 29-32c of the general statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning Police Officer Discretion To Pursue A Motor Vehicle.
description: To provide discretion to a police officer to pursue a motor vehicle if such officer can articulate a public safety need for such pursuit.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning The Mailing Of A Motor Vehicle Registration Application.
description: To require the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles to mail a motor vehicle registration application to a registrant.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Requiring Towing Companies To Accept Alternative Forms Of Payment.
description: To require towing companies to accept alternative forms of payment for towing and storage charges.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Authorizing Wreckers To Use Blue Lights While Preparing To Tow Motor Vehicles.
description: To provide wrecker operators with greater safety while clearing the state's roads of damaged or disabled motor vehicles.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Installation Of Six-inch-wide Edge Lines On Limited Access Highways.
description: To decrease fatal traffic crashes in the state by installing six-inch-wide edge lines on limited access highways.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Naming An Overpass In The Town Of Southington In Honor Of Trooper First Class Aaron Pelletier.
description: To name an overpass in the town of Southington in honor of Trooper First Class Aaron Pelletier, who tragically died in the line of duty.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Naming An Overpass In The Town Of Berlin In Honor Of Gold Star Families.
description: To name an overpass in the town of Berlin in honor of the families of military members who were killed in action while performing active military duty with the armed forces of the United States.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Exempting Veterans From The Passport To The Parks Fee.
description: To exempt veterans from the Passport to the Parks fee.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Environment

title: An Act Eliminating Service In Time Of War As An Eligibility Criterion For Certain State And Municipal Veterans' Benefits.
description: To eliminate service in time of war as an eligibility criterion for certain state and municipal veterans' benefits.
last_action: Incorporated In SB-376

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Girls For Technology.
description: To support Girls for Technology activities to address systemic inequities affecting underrepresented and low-income communities across the state, particularly in Hartford, New Haven and New London counties and ensure measurable outcomes in financial literacy, workforce readiness and technological proficiency.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of "donate Life" Number Plates.
description: To create a special license plate to enhance public awareness of the importance of organ and tissue donations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Farmers' Market Nutrition Program.
description: To increase funds for the farmers' market nutrition program to expand access to fresh, locally grown produce for low-income individuals and families.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Ct Grown For Ct Kids Grant Program.
description: To increase funding for the CT Grown for CT Kids grant program, promote the purchase of locally grown food and provide healthier food options for school students.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Increased Access To Free School Meals.
description: To ensure that all students, regardless of which school they are enrolled, have access to free school meals in order to support the health and well-being of children from low-income families.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Calculation Of Minimum Budget Requirements.
description: To exclude one-time, nonrecurring, non-General Fund revenues from counting toward the budgeted appropriation for education.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Minimum Budget Requirement During A School Construction Project.
description: To waive the minimum budget requirement when a school is closed due to a school construction project.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Newspaper Delivery To Non-subscribers.
description: To reduce the environmental impacts from unsolicited newspapers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Composition Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, Communications By Public Utility Companies And The Administration Of Energy Efficiency Programs.
description: To (1) prohibit any public service company from charging a fee to any customer of such company in connection with a communication from such company to such customer, (2) provide that any legislator or the chief executive officer of any municipality may intervene and be granted party status in any proceeding before the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, (3) specify minimum education requirements for each person appointed to the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority with a preference for individuals who are accountants, auditors and engineers with infrastructure estimating experience, (4) make any communication by a public utility company subject to the Freedom of Information Act, (5) require a minimum notification period and standards for notices to customers of any public utility company concerning rate changes, (6) require that any energy efficiency programs in the state be administered by a not-for-profit entity, and (7) require that any vacancy on the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority be promptly filled by appointment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Establishing A Grid-enhancing Technology Task Force.
description: To establish a task force to study transmission infrastructure and the potential use of grid-enhancing technologies, including dynamic line rating and advanced power flow control, in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For Certain Renewable Energy Systems.
description: To create property tax exemptions for certain renewable energy systems, including solar, geothermal and hydropower systems, and other Class I renewable energy sources, based on the installation date, generation capacity and location of such systems.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Tax Incentives For The Installation Of Renewable Energy Systems.
description: To clarify criteria for property tax exemptions for renewable energy systems and to simplify the application process for such exemptions.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Expediting Contract Execution For State Purchase Of Service Contracts.
description: To require the expediting the execution of state purchase of service contracts to help organizations that rely on state funding avoid delays in receiving reimbursements and payments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Early Voting For Singular, Uncontested Special Elections.
description: To allow municipalities to opt out of conducting early voting for singular, uncontested special elections.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Prohibiting The Sale Of Small Bottles Of Alcoholic Liquor.
description: To prohibit the sale of any bottle of alcoholic liquor that is fifty milliliters or less in volume.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Child Care Providers Under The State Employee Health Plan.
description: To allow any child care provider, including, but not limited to, any home child care provider, to participate in the state employee health plan.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Cryptocurrency, Pig Butchering Scams And Asset Forfeiture.
description: To establish specific penal code and procedural provisions concerning crimes related to cryptocurrency and pig butchering scams.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Capital Region Development Authority.
description: To add a member representing the town of East Windsor to the board of directors of the Capital Region Development Authority.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Classifying First Responders As Essential Services Providers.
description: To classify first responders as essential services providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Requiring The Placement Of Traffic Cones Around Certain Landscaping Vehicles When Parked On A Public Highway.
description: To require the placement of traffic cones around certain landscaping vehicles when parked on a public highway.
last_action: File Number 390

title: An Act Implementing Weigh-in-motion Systems For Commercial Motor Vehicle Enforcement Activities.
description: To require the Departments of Motor Vehicles, Transportation and Emergency Services and Public Protection to expand the use of weigh-in-motion systems for commercial motor vehicle enforcement activities.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/10

title: An Act Concerning Surviving Spouses' Eligibility For A Certain Veterans' Property Tax Exemption.
description: To expand eligibility for a certain veterans' property tax exemption to the surviving spouses of veterans who passed away prior to the effective date of such exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Including The Land On Which A Dwelling Sits In The Property Tax Exemption For Veterans With A Service-connected Permanent And Total Disability Rating.
description: To include the land on which a dwelling sits, in addition to the dwelling itself, in a certain veterans property tax exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Concerning Real Property Tax Abatements For Certain First-time Homebuyers.
description: To establish a municipal option for a property tax abatement for certain first-time homebuyers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Reducing Interest Due On Certain Unpaid Municipal Property Taxes.
description: To reduce from eighteen per cent to twelve per cent the annual interest due on unpaid municipal property taxes when a municipal tax collector files a lien on a property and such lien is assigned to a third party.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Blue Lights On Motor Vehicles Operated By Environmental Service Companies.

description: To allow sponsoring associations to create multiple employer welfare arrangements for purposes of providing health insurance coverage to such sponsoring association's members.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of Automobile Liability Insurance Laws In Neighboring States.
description: To require that the Insurance Department (1) conduct a study evaluating automobile liability insurance laws in neighboring states, including, but not limited to, issues relating to coverage and practices to lower automobile liability insurance premiums, and (2) submit a report of the findings of such study to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Authorizing State Agencies To Require Employees To Work In Person.
description: To allow state agencies to establish a work policy that requires employees of such agency to work in person.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/20

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Treatment Practices And Promoting Psychotherapy For Minors Experiencing Gender Dysphoria Or Incongruence.
description: To ensure that the best interests of minors are protected when experiencing gender dysphoria or incongruence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning Health Care Accessibility For Persons With A Disability.
description: To require that the inventories and action plans mandated by section 19a-490dd of the general statutes are submitted to the Commissioner of Public Health in a timely fashion.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning Definitions And Eligibility Criteria Pertaining To Services For Persons With Intellectual Disability.
description: To modify the definition of "intellectual disability" and to remove IQ scores as a component of eligibility for state-funded services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Repealing The State Motor Vehicle Fleet Electrification Mandate.
description: To reduce the demand on the electric grid by repealing the state motor vehicle fleet electrification mandate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of A Hold Harmless Provision In The Education Cost-sharing Grant Formula.
description: To revise the education cost-sharing grant formula to hold towns harmless and ensure that no town receives less funding than the total amount the town received for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2025.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Police Animals And Dogs.
description: To protect police animals.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Vfw Post 10004 In The Borough Of Jewett City To Make Property Improvements.
description: To provide funding for Jewett City VFW Post 10004 to make critical and necessary property improvements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Vfw Post 9452 In The Town Of Preston To Make Property Improvements.
description: To provide funding for Preston VFW Post 9452 to make critical and necessary property improvements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Next Generation Science Standards And The Climate Change Curriculum Taught To Students.
description: To amend the portion of the Next Generation Science Standards as it relates to the climate change curriculum requirement.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Delaying Implementation Of Early Start Ct.
description: To delay implementation of Early Start CT until July 1, 2026, to allow local and regional boards of education an additional year to address issues relating to teacher contracts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Reading Proficiency As A High School Graduation Requirement.
description: To require high school graduates to be able to read at a minimum of an eighth-grade reading level.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Funding Of The Special Education Excess Cost Grant.
description: To ensure full funding of the special education excess cost grants for all towns.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Free Bus Passes For High School Students.
description: To provide free bus transportation to high school students in Connecticut.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing The School Accountability Review Board.
description: To establish the School Accountability Review Board.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A Pilot Program For At-risk Youth.
description: To establish a pilot program for at-risk youth in grades six to eight, inclusive, to engage in hands-on, project-based learning programs that align academic content with practical applications, including vocational and community experience.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing The Mystic Aquarium Animal Rescue Fund.
description: To provide resources to the Mystic Aquarium Animal Rescue Program that enable it to rescue, rehabilitate and release marine animals in distress while advancing conservation educational and scientific research.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning The Zero-emission Aftermarket Conversion Project.
description: To establish the Zero-Emission Aftermarket Conversion Project.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing The Use Of Terramation.
description: To provide residents of the state with an environmentally sustainable alternative to cremation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Fishing And Hunting Rights Of Certain Native American Tribes.
description: To affirm and expand fishing, hunting and aquaculture rights of federal and state-recognized Native American tribes.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Notification Of Sewage Discharges Into The Connecticut River That Occur In The State Of Massachusetts.
description: To provide notice of sewage discharges into the Connecticut River that occur in the state of Massachusetts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A New Classification Of Real Property.
description: To authorize a new classification of real property for inland wetland purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Effects Of Aircraft Engine Exhaust Particles.
description: To study the effects of aircraft engine exhaust on air quality in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Classification Of Nonprofit Organizations Regarding Energy Consumption.
description: To establish a working group to evaluate the energy consumption classification procedure for nonprofit organizations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Removal Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To separate the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Creating A Department Of Energy.
description: To create a Department of Energy and transfer energy-related functions from the current Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to the new Department of Energy.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Removing Reference To California Law In Energy Conservation, Air Pollution Or Emission Standards In The State.
description: To eliminate the use of any California state law, code or regulation to set energy utilization and conservation, air pollution control or emission standards in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Requirements For Legislative Approval Of The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To repeal any component of the Combined Public Benefits Charge not approved by the General Assembly and require future charges be approved by the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring Legislative Approval For Components Of The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To repeal any component of the Combined Public Benefits Charge not approved by the General Assembly and require future charges be approved by the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring An Explanation Of The Combined Public Benefits Charge On Utility Bills.
description: To require transparency concerning the origin and cost of any individual public benefits charges on each ratepayer's bill.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Separation Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To remove the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Power Purchase Agreements And Requiring Joint Solicitations For Certain Clean Energy Projects.
description: To (1) prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection or any electric distribution company from entering into a power purchase agreement that provides for the purchase of electricity at a rate exceeding one hundred fifty per cent above the wholesale price of electricity, and (2) require the commissioner to solicit any clean energy project with a capacity exceeding twenty megawatts with two or more other states.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Plans For Decommissioning Solar Photovoltaic Systems Approved By The Connecticut Siting Council.
description: To ensure that owner or operator of any solar photovoltaic project be responsible for the decommissioning, removal and disposal of said project at the end of its useful life.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Environment

title: An Act Repealing The Combined Public Benefits Charge And Requiring Legislative Approval For Any Future Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To remove charges collectively called the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" from electric bills and require that any such future charge be implemented only upon the affirmative vote of the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting State Agencies And Municipalities From Purchasing Or Operating Certain Unmanned Aircraft Systems.
description: To prohibit any state agency or municipality from purchasing or operating unmanned aircraft systems manufactured or assembled in the People's Republic of China or the Russian Federation to protect national security and prevent reliance on foreign adversaries.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Composition And Conduct Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
description: To require full and bipartisan membership on the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, restructure the role of said authority and make said authority independent from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Construction Of A Water Line On Jackson Street In The Town Of Thomaston.
description: To construct a water line on Jackson Street in Thomaston.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Highway Use Tax.
description: To eliminate the highway use tax.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Sales And Use Taxes Imposed On Meals Sold By An Eating Establishment, Caterer Or Grocery Store.
description: To eliminate the additional one per cent sales and use taxes imposed on meals sold by an eating establishment, caterer or grocery store.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Qualifying Income Thresholds For The Personal Income Tax Deductions For Social Security Benefits.
description: To eliminate the qualifying income thresholds for the personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Reducing Fees For Small Business Filings With The Secretary Of The State.
description: To reduce fees for small business filings with the Secretary of the State.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Sales And Use Taxes Imposed On Meals Sold By An Eating Establishment, Caterer Or Grocery Store.
description: To eliminate the additional one per cent sales and use taxes imposed on meals sold by an eating establishment, caterer or grocery store.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Child Personal Income Tax Deduction.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction of two thousand dollars per child.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Collection Costs Of State Taxes And Fees.
description: To require each state agency to evaluate the collection costs of taxes and fees administered and to eliminate any tax or fee for which the cost of collection exceeds the revenue received by the state from the imposition of such tax or fee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Qualifying Income Thresholds For The Personal Income Tax Deductions For Social Security Benefits.
description: To eliminate the qualifying income thresholds for the personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Exempting Certain Articles Of Children's Clothing From The Sales And Use Taxes.
description: To exempt articles of children's clothing costing under one hundred dollars from the sales and use taxes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Purchasers Exempt From Use Tax For The Casual Sale Of A Motor Vehicle.
description: To add a grandchild of the seller to the list of family member purchasers exempt from use tax for the casual sale of a motor vehicle.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Regulation And Taxation Of Short-term Rental Properties And The Dedication Of A Portion Of The Room Occupancy Tax From Such Rentals.
description: To (1) establish a state-wide short-term rentals registry and registration fee, (2) specify safety standards for such rentals and liability insurance requirements for the owners of such rentals, (3) dedicate fifty per cent of the room occupancy tax received by the state from such rentals to municipalities and twenty-five per cent of such revenue to the Tourism Fund, and (4) authorize municipalities to impose a supplemental room occupancy tax.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Combining The Petroleum Products Gross Earnings Tax And The Motor Vehicle Fuels Tax.
description: To combine the petroleum products gross earnings tax and the motor vehicle fuels tax and impose one tax on a per-gallon basis.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Child Personal Income Tax Deduction.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction of two thousand dollars per child.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Earned Income Tax Credit.
description: To increase the applicable percentage of the earned income tax credit to forty-one and one-half per cent of the federal earned income tax credit and allow households earning less than three hundred per cent of the federal poverty levels to claim such credit.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Withdrawing Connecticut From The Agreement Among The States To Elect The President Of The United States By National Popular Vote.
description: To withdraw the state from the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring Minority Representation On Certain Municipal Legislative Bodies And Boards Of Education.
description: To require minority representation among members elected at large on municipal legislative bodies and boards of education.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Reestablishing The Legislative Program Review And Investigations Committee.
description: To reestablish the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Designating Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day.
description: To designate February fourteenth of each year as Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Medical Debt.
description: To (1) provide that (A) no medical debt shall be sold more than twice, (B) no action to collect any medical debt shall be commenced later than three years after the date on which such debt was incurred, (C) no owner of any medical debt shall recover any sum that exceeds the actual cost incurred in providing the health care for which such debt was incurred, and (D) no credit rating agency shall consider medical debt in calculating a consumer's credit score, and (2) establish additional transparency requirements applicable to purchasers of medical debt.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Heritage Railways And Alcoholic Liquor.
description: To amend the Liquor Control Act by (1) defining "heritage railway", (2) establishing a short-term heritage railway cafe permit, and (3) establishing a reduced fee for cafe permits issued to heritage railways.
last_action: File Number 300

title: An Act Concerning Solar Leasing And Finance Companies.
description: To require each solar leasing or finance company doing business in this state to (1) provide payoff or transfer paperwork to a consumer not later than seven days after the consumer requests such paperwork, and (2) provide to the consumer a rebate in the amount of two- hundred fifty dollars if such company fails to timely provide such paperwork to the consumer.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Sales Of Kratom Products To Individuals Under Twenty-one Years Of Age.
description: To prohibit sales of kratom products to individuals under twenty-one years of age.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Mobile Manufactured Home Parks.
description: To (1) cap rent increases and ancillary fees imposed by mobile manufactured home park owners, (2) establish additional enforcement measures and penalties concerning mobile manufactured home park owners, (3) subject certain files to the Freedom of Information Act, (4) modify the method by which mobile manufactured homes are appraised, (5) modify the amount of relocation expenses paid to mobile manufactured home park residents, and (6) require mobile manufactured home park owners to submit reports to the Department of Consumer protection concerning fire hydrant water capacity and flow.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Caregivers, Qualifying Patients And The Palliative Use Of Cannabis.
description: To, for purposes of the state's palliative-use cannabis market, (1) define and redefine certain terms, (2) authorize qualifying patients and medical cannabis caregivers to engage in additional cultivation activities, (3) cap certain cannabis testing laboratory fees, (4) provide additional anti-discrimination protections to qualifying patients and caregivers, (5) modify the Department of Consumer Protection's enforcement powers and the duration and terms of qualifying patient registration certificates, and (6) modify, and establish new, penalties.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/14

title: An Act Expanding Husky Health Coverage To Income-eligible Children And Young Adults Regardless Of Immigration Status.
description: To provide state-funded HUSKY health care coverage for income-eligible children and young adults up to age twenty-six regardless of their immigration status.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Requiring Able-bodied Recipients Of Public Assistance To Work Or Volunteer.
description: To require able-bodied public assistance beneficiaries to work or volunteer to receive benefits unless they are exempt under federal law.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Requiring Able-bodied Medicaid Recipients To Work Or Volunteer.
description: To require able-bodied Medicaid recipients to work or volunteer to receive or maintain Medicaid benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Including Non-deed Restricted Accessory Apartments In The Calculation Of The Threshold For The Affordable Housing Appeals Procedure Exemption.
description: To include all accessory apartments in the calculation of the ten per cent threshold for the affordable housing appeals procedure exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Including Workforce Housing In The Calculation Of The Threshold For The Affordable Housing Appeals Procedure Exemption.
description: To include workforce housing in the calculation of the ten per cent threshold for the affordable housing appeals procedure exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Including Dwelling Units For Purchasers That Meet Certain Income Requirements In The Calculation Of The Threshold For The Affordable Housing Appeals Procedure Exemption.
description: To include dwelling units able to be purchased by persons that meet certain income requirements in the calculation of the threshold for the affordable appeals procedure exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring That One Housing Unit-equivalent Point Be Awarded For Construction Of Certain Elderly Units.
description: To increase the award of housing unit-equivalent points for elderly units from one-half to one housing unit-equivalent point to incentivize the construction of such units.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring A Feasibility Study Of Insurance Pooling For Nonprofit Entities.
description: To require that the Insurance Commissioner study the feasibility of allowing one or more nonprofit entities to pool such nonprofit entities' liability insurance policies, including general liability insurance and automobile liability insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Public Options For Health Care In Connecticut.
description: To: (1) Establish the ConnectHealth Program, the ConnectHealth Trust account and the ConnectHealth Advisory Board; (2) require the Comptroller, in consultation with the ConnectHealth Advisory Board and the Office of Health Strategy, to establish the ConnectHealth Plan; (3) authorize the Comptroller to offer coverage to plan participants and beneficiaries in this state under a multiemployer plan, nonprofit employers and their employees and small employers and their employees; and (4) require the Commissioner of Social Services to seek to amend the federal waiver for the state-wide dental plan that provides for the administration of the dental services portion of the department's medical assistance to expand coverage to include additional individuals in this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Tax Credit For Premium Payments For Certain Long-term Care Insurance Policies.
description: To establish a tax credit up to twenty per cent of premiums paid to purchase an individual or group long-term care insurance policy during a taxable year, and allow long-term care policyholders to carry over to future taxable years any amount that is in excess of such policyholder's tax liability for a taxable year.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Qualified Immunity For Law Enforcement Officers.
description: To reduce ambiguity and provide guidance for police officers regarding proper actions in the field.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Sentence Modification Eligibility.
description: To establish a "second look" process for sentencing modification for eligible persons who are incarcerated by expanding the role of courts in sentence reduction and shifting responsibility away from the Board of Pardons and Paroles.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Authority Of The Probate Court To Order A Person With A Substance Use Disorder Or Psychiatric Disability To Submit To An Involuntary Medical Evaluation And Assisted Outpatient Medical Treatment.
description: To provide a Probate Court with the authority to order a person with a substance use disorder or psychiatric disability to submit to an involuntary medical evaluation and assisted outpatient medical treatment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Consent Searches Of Motor Vehicles.
description: To allow police officers the ability to request consent to search a motor vehicle in order to take illegal weapons and drugs off the street, as well as assist in collecting evidence of a crime.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Including Parole Officers In The Definition Of Peace Officers.
description: To redefine "peace officer" to include parole officers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Strip Searches And Use Of Chemical Restraints By The Department Of Correction.
description: To govern the use of strip searches and use of chemical restraints by the Department of Correction and improve transparency concerning the use of such methods.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Fees Paid For A Title Search In A Foreclosure Judgment.
description: To establish the fee permitted in conducting a title search in any foreclosure judgment when a lis pendens has been recorded after a title search of real property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Limits To Property Tax Increases.
description: To establish limits on property tax increases to support affordable home and business ownership.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/03

title: An Act Concerning The Summarization And Publication Of Municipal Legal Notices.
description: To permit any municipality required to publish legal notice in a newspaper to instead publish a summary of such notice along with a statement that the entire legal notice may be viewed (1) on the Internet web site of such municipality, and (2) in print at a municipal address provided.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Reducing The Motor Vehicle Mill Rate Cap.
description: To reduce the mill rate cap for motor vehicles and adjust the grants payable from the Municipal Revenue Sharing Fund to reimburse municipalities for the resulting revenue loss.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Prohibit Pet Shops From Selling Certain Animals.
description: To authorize municipalities to prohibit pet shops from selling dogs, cats and rabbits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Abatement For Certain First-time Homebuyers.
description: To authorize municipalities to abate up to five hundred dollars per assessment year of property taxes for certain first-time homebuyers who obtain a loan from the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring The Implementation Of A Reciprocal Food Truck Vendor Permit Or License.
description: To allow for more efficiency for food truck vendors by reducing paperwork and saving costs associated with obtaining a permit or license from every municipality in which a food truck vendor seeks to operate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring Parental Notification Prior To The Termination Of A Pregnancy By A Minor.
description: To ensure that the best interests of a minor are protected when facing an unplanned pregnancy.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Allowing Terminally Ill Patients To Make Decisions About End-of-life Care.
description: To allow terminally ill patients to make decisions about their end-of-life care that do not cause them to endure lengthy, painful deaths.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Prohibiting Food Service Establishments From Selling Food Prepared With Frying Oils Containing Artificial Trans Fats.
description: To prohibit the sale of any food containing artificial trans fats by food service establishments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Allowing The Use Of Psilocybin For Medicinal And Therapeutic Purposes.
description: To allow the use of psilocybin for medicinal and therapeutic purposes, including, but not limited to, the provision of physical, mental or behavioral health care.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Redefining "peace Officer" To Include Local Fire Marshals, Deputy Fire Marshals And Fire Inspectors.
description: To recognize local fire marshals, deputy fire marshals and fire inspectors as peace officers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Restoring Qualified Immunity For Law Enforcement Officers.
description: To reduce ambiguity and provide guidance for police officers regarding proper actions in the field.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Eliminating The Weight Limitation On Electric Foot Scooters.
description: To redefine "electric foot scooter" by eliminating the weight limitation of seventy-five pounds.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Free Bus Public Transportation For High School Students.
description: To provide free bus public transportation for high school students before and after the regular school day in order for students to access extracurricular activities and employment opportunities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Reserved Seating On Public Transportation For Persons With Disabilities.
description: To increase the availability of reserved seating on public transportation for persons with disabilities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Registration Fee For Pontoon Boats.
description: To charge a fair registration fee for pontoon boats.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Suspension Of Motor Vehicle Operators' Licenses For Failure To Pay Fines Or Fees Or Failure To Appear For A Scheduled Court Appearance.
description: To end the suspension of motor vehicle operators' licenses solely for failure to pay fines or fees or failure to appear for a scheduled court appearance in order to help low-income persons who need transportation for their livelihood.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Parole Eligibility For An Individual Serving A Lengthy Sentence For A Crime Committed Before The Individual Reached The Age Of Twenty-five.
description: To broaden eligibility for parole to include those individuals serving long sentences for crimes committed before the individual was twenty-five years of age, under certain circumstances.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Confinement Of Persons With A Psychiatric Disability By The Psychiatric Security Review Board.
description: To clarify the reasons for which a person with a psychiatric disability and determined to be gravely disabled may be confined by the Psychiatric Security Review Board.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Authorizing The State Board Of Education To Grant Final Certificates Of Approval For Charter Schools.
description: To update and streamline the charter school approval process while maintaining legislative budgetary oversight.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Child Care Center In The Fair Haven Neighborhood Of The City Of New Haven.
description: To provide funding for a child care center in the Fair Haven neighborhood of the city of New Haven.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Affordable Housing Projects Located In The City Of New Haven.
description: To provide funding for the construction of certain affordable housing projects located in the city of New Haven.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Purchase Of Real Property Located In The City Of New Haven.
description: To provide funding for the city of New Haven to acquire, remediate and develop certain real property located in the city of New Haven.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Building Facade And Site Improvements In New Haven.
description: To provide funding to the city of New Haven for renovations to building facades and other site improvements in the Hill and Fair Haven neighborhoods.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Increasing Access To The Husky Health Program To Immigrants Without Legal Status Up To Age Twenty-six And Over Age Sixty-five.
description: To provide state-funded health benefits to otherwise eligible immigrants without legal status up to age twenty-six and over age sixty-five.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Child Care Educators.
description: To expand health insurance coverage for child care educators in this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Accountability For Juvenile Offenders And Their Parents.
description: To enhance accountability for juvenile offenders and their parents by increasing parental liability for property damage, require community service for juvenile offenders and impose stricter penalties in the case of repeat offenders for offenses related to motor vehicle theft and related property damage.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Social Media Platforms And Minors.
description: To (1) require the owner of a social media platform to incorporate an online safety center into, and establish a cyberbullying policy for, the owner's social media platform, (2) redefine "heightened risk of harm to minors" to include processing minors' personal data in a manner that presents any reasonably foreseeable risk of harm to minors' physical or mental health, and (3) require the controller of an online service, product or feature that is offered to minors to (A) include a default setting in such service, product or feature to prevent adults from sending unsolicited communications to minors, (B) not use any system design feature to significantly increase, sustain or extend minors' use of such service, product or feature, and (C) disclose to the Attorney General a plan established and implemented to mitigate or eliminate any heightened risk of harm to minors.
last_action: File Number 184

title: An Act Concerning Fertility Fraud By Physicians.
description: To protect patients undergoing fertility treatments from physician misconduct.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Grandparent Visitation With A Minor Child.
description: To revise court processes relating to the ability of a grandparent to petition for visitation with a grandchild.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Retired Teachers' Health Insurance Benefits.
description: To restore the full state subsidy of one-third of the full cost of the premium for teachers' retirement health insurance benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Choice Of Law Provisions.
description: To enhance the ability of commercial parties to choose Connecticut law to govern their transaction.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Encompass Transportation Program Serving The Elderly And Disabled Population.
description: To provide continued funding for the operation and administration of the transportation program serving the elderly and persons with disabilities in the Capitol region.

title: An Act Eliminating The Use Of Incineration For Solid Waste Processing.
description: To eliminate the use of incineration for solid waste processing and utilize new technologies that create jobs and reduce municipal costs.

description: To protect cats and dogs from abandonment and displacement.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

description: To have cats and dogs properly vaccinated by entities that earn income from the sale or adoption of such animal.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Ranked-choice Voting In Primaries.
description: To allow a political party to use ranked-choice voting in primaries, as may be provided for in such party's rules.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Providing Incentives To Landlords Who Commit To Renting Residential Real Property For Time Periods Of More Than A Certain Specified Length Of Time.
description: To provide incentives to landlords who commit to renting residential real property for time periods of more than a certain specified length of time to promote the availability of long-term rental properties.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

description: To establish a captive insurance company, which shall be supported by the appropriation of the sum of ten million dollars to said captive insurance company, from the General Fund, for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, for the purpose of (1) bulk purchasing glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor antagonist prescription drugs from drug manufacturers, and (2) distributing such prescription drugs to covered persons in this state who satisfy a means-tested qualification process and demonstrate an inability to obtain such prescription drugs from such covered person's health insurer to treat obesity.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate
