title: An Act Concerning A State Subsidy For Retired Teachers' Health Insurance Benefits.
description: To restore the one-third state subsidy to retired teachers enrolled in the Teachers' Retirement Board Medicare supplement health insurance package.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Community Access Television Providers.
description: To provide support for nonprofit community access television providers and allow them to continue operations until a basic funding model can be revised.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning The Priority Of Claims To Financial Assets Of Securities Intermediaries.
description: To eliminate a statutory provision setting forth that a claim of a creditor of a securities intermediary who has a security interest in a financial asset held by a securities intermediary has priority over claims of the securities intermediary's entitlement holders who have security entitlements with respect to that financial asset if the creditor has control over the financial asset.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/27

title: An Act Equalizing The Reimbursement Percentage For New Construction And Renovation Projects Under The School Building Projects Grant Program.
description: To create parity between the reimbursement percentages for new school construction projects and renovation projects under the school building project grant program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring Vision Screenings For Students In Preschool And Grade Two.
description: To require vision screenings for students in preschool and grade two.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Farm To School And Enhancements To The Local Food For Schools Incentive Program.
description: To clarify agency roles and provide funds for the CT Grown for CT Kids Grant Program and administration of the local food for schools incentive program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Biological Males From Competing In Female Sports.
description: To prohibit biological males from competing on female athletic teams in interscholastic and intramural athletic events.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Certain Prohibitions On Construction Managers In School Construction Projects.
description: To prohibit construction managers from bidding on school construction projects.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing A Grant Program To Introduce The Building Trades To High School Students.
description: To incentivize high schools to offer introductory classes regarding the building trades and allow the credits earned from such classes to apply toward completion of an apprenticeship program in such trades.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring Classification Of Violations Found By The Office Of Early Childhood.
description: To require the Office of Early Childhood to create classifications for violations issued to child care facilities to differentiate between technical violations and safety or security violations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Maintaining Education Cost-sharing Grant Amounts For Former Alliance Districts.
description: To ensure that towns whose academic performance has improved and is no longer designated as an alliance district maintain the same levels of funding under the education cost-sharing grant.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing A School Libraries Task Force.
description: To establish a task force to create guidelines for school libraries in determining what literary materials are appropriate for inclusion in such libraries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Intelligence Quotient Tests In The Native Language Of The Test Taker.
description: To ensure that the results of a student's intelligence quotient test accurately reflect the level of learning and comprehension for developmental services eligibility.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Creation Of A Model Driver Education Curriculum.
description: To create a model driver education curriculum for high schools.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Full Funding Of The Special Education Excess Cost Grant.
description: To ensure full funding of the special education excess cost grants for all towns.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Public School Libraries.
description: To require the development of policies concerning public school libraries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Increasing The Reimbursement Percentage For School Building Projects That Implement Certain Energy-efficient And Energy-saving Measures.
description: To incentivize school districts to use energy-efficient materials and HVAC systems in new school building construction projects.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Safe And Healthy School Meals.
description: To require more school meal options for students with broader allergies and autoimmune diseases to address current nutritional gaps.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning School Libraries And Children.
description: To require adherence to established protocols when evaluating materials to be used in school libraries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Evaluating Funding For Public Libraries.
description: To study and identify funding gaps for public libraries and options for efficiency and sustainability.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Public School Libraries.
description: To require local and regional boards of education to adopt a policy concerning public school library collection of books and other educational media.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Allowing Patriotic And Civic Organizations To Conduct Presentations In Schools.
description: To provide students in public schools with opportunities to engage with patriotic and civic organizations, such as the Scouting America.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Food Products In School Cafeterias That Contain Certain Dyes And Colorants.
description: To prohibit public schools from offering food products that contain certain dyes and colorants.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Awarding A Pension Credit To Teachers Who Worked Full-time Through The Covid-19 Pandemic.
description: To award a one-year service credit under the teachers' retirement system to each teacher who worked full-time through the COVID-19 pandemic.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Allowing Public Schools To Serve Whole Milk From Any Source.
description: To allow public schools to serve whole milk from any source.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Rate Of Reimbursement For Special Education Costs.
description: To allow municipalities to predict the cost of special education by prohibiting reduction of the reimbursement rate for special education costs from the prior year's reimbursement rate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Indoor Air Quality In Public Schools.
description: To require measurements of volatile organic compounds and the effectiveness of high-quality air filtration be included in indoor air quality inspections of school buildings.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Capping Special Education Costs In The State.
description: To cap school district and state costs for special education services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Section 504 Plans.
description: To (1) specify the role of school counselors as facilitators in establishing Section 504 plans, (2) require the Department of Education to collect and share data related to Section 504 plans, and (3) establish a working group to study Section 504 plan.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Allowing Teachers To Communicate With Parents Concerning A Student's Gender Identity.
description: To allow a teacher to tell a parent that the gender identity of such parent's child differs from such child's sex assigned at birth.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Artificial Intelligence To Replace Teachers.
description: To prohibit the use of artificial intelligence to replace public school educators in providing instruction to and regular interaction with students.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring The Use Of The State Board Of Education's Health Assessment Record Form.
description: To require the form supplied by the State Board of Education be the only acceptable form for health assessment records for the purpose of school enrollment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning A Model Curriculum For Prevention Of Opioid Use And Related Disorders.
description: To require the Department of Education to develop (1) a model curriculum for prevention of opioid use and related disorders, and (2) guidelines for volunteer presentations related to substance abuse prevention.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring Students To Learn A Second Language In School.
description: To require all public school students to learn a second language.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Repealing The Requirement That Menstrual Products Be Available In Men's Restrooms In Each Public School.
description: To remove the requirement that schools provide menstrual products in men's restrooms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Biological Males From Participating In Female-only Sports.
description: To prohibit biological males from participating in girls' sports.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Implementation Of The Centers For Disease Control And Prevention's Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child Framework.
description: To implement the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Whole School, Whole Community, Whole Child framework.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of The Greek Genocide In The Holocaust And Genocide Education And Awareness Curriculum.
description: To provide an additional option for Holocaust education by including the Greek genocide.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Technical Support Services For Child Care Providers.
description: To support the technology and support needs of child care providers based on the guidance of the Office of Early Childhood and The University of Connecticut partnership.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A Pilot Program For A Common Chart Of Accounts And Financial System In School Districts.
description: To establish a pilot program for a common chart of accounts and financial system in school districts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The School Building Project At The Ashford School In Ashford.
description: To allow the town of Ashford to proceed with a school building project at Ashford School.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning A Trust Talk For Teens.
description: To review and distribute the "Trust Talk for Teens" as part of the required instruction under Ethan's Law.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Promotion Of Toy And Craft-based Celebrations In Schools.
description: To promote allergy awareness and allergen-friendly school celebrations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Predictability And Transparency In The Excess Cost Grant.
description: To make the excess cost grant process more predictable and transparent by reducing financial uncertainty for school districts, improving budgetary planning and ensuring students with special needs receive consistent support.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Connecticut Guidelines For Educator Evaluation.
description: To allow educators who are rated as exemplary or proficient to continue to use their teaching hours focused on classroom instruction and student development by not requiring annual evaluations for such high-achieving educators, and providing educators with continuing support who have not yet reached exemplary and proficient evaluation ratings.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Need For And Impact Of Standardized Examinations.
description: To establish a task force to study the impacts of standardized examinations on students and to develop recommendations to improve implementation of such examinations and for alternate methods to measure student achievement.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Funding Cardiac Emergency Response Plans.
description: To require the establishment of a grant program to assist schools, with a priority given to priority schools, with implementing cardiac emergency response plans and a procedure for monitoring adherence to cardiac emergency response plans and to allow local and regional boards of education to accept gifts, grants and donations for such purpose.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Students Who Are Biological Males From Competing On Female-only Athletic Teams And Using Female-only Locker Rooms And Facilities.
description: To limit participation within female-only college and high school sports to biological females.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Installation Of Security Camera Systems In Certain Special Education Classrooms.
description: To allow school districts to install security camera systems in self-contained special education classrooms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Authorizing Boards Of Education To Develop And Modify Their Own Standards And Curricula.
description: To provide boards of education the right to develop and modify curricula for their respective school districts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Increasing The Foundation Amount For The Education Cost Sharing Grant Formula.
description: To revise the education cost sharing grant formula by increasing the foundation amount and adding a provision that adjusts such foundation amount for inflation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting The Availability Of Sexually Explicit Material In Public School Libraries.
description: To prevent student access to sexually explicit material in public school libraries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing State-wide Start Times For Public Middle And High Schools.
description: To establish a state-wide later start time for public middle schools and high schools.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting The Cultivation Of Octopus For Human Consumption And The Use Of Octopus For Entertainment Purposes.
description: To prohibit the farming of octopus for human consumption and the use of octopus for entertainment purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Classification Of Beaver And The Protection Of Beaver And Their Habitat.
description: To provide protections for beaver and beaver habitat in the state .
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Breeding Of Animals In The State.
description: To regulate animal breeding in the state through the Department of Agriculture.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Reform Of The Use And Regulation Of Neonicotinoids.
description: To reform the use and regulation of neonicotinoids in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Information To Pet Owners During And Following An Investigation Of Alleged Wrongdoing By A Veterinarian Toward Such Pet.
description: To provide information to pet owners from the Department of Public Health during and following an agency investigation into allegations of wrongdoing by a veterinarian toward such pet.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/03

title: An Act Prohibiting The Trade Of Exotic Animals And Their Parts In The State.
description: To prohibit the trade of exotic animals and their parts in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Amending The Passport To The Parks Program To Apply To Residences Rather Than Vehicles.
description: To discontinue charging the Passport to the Parks fee to each vehicle owned by a person and replace such structure with a fee assessed to each residence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Application Of Pesticides To Organic Foods.
description: To prohibit the application of pesticides to organic foods.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Revision Of The Harbor Management Act.
description: To revise the Harbor Management Act to clarify the right of municipalities to determine uses authorized in areas covered by harbor management commissions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Care Of Pets Sold In Pet Stores.
description: To study the care provided to pets sold in pet stores in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Authorizing The Hunting Of Animals By Firearm On Private Property On All Days Of The Week During The Legal Hunting Season For Such Animal.
description: To allow the hunting of all animals on private property on all days of the week, including Sundays, during the legal hunting season for such animal.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Passport To The Parks Program.
description: To exempt senior citizens and veterans from the Passport to the Parks vehicle registration fee and to apply such vehicle registration fee to only one vehicle when a person registers more than one vehicle with the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Authorizing The Use Of Firearms Fitted With Sound Suppressors By Hunters.
description: To authorize the use of gun sound suppressors by hunters.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Regulation Of Pesticide Use By Municipalities.
description: To preempt municipalities from regulating the use of pesticides and leaving such regulation to the state and federal governments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Repealing The Prohibition On Single-use Plastic Bags And Prohibiting The Use Of Pfas In Paper Straws.
description: To repeal the single-use plastic bag ban and prohibit the use of PFAS in paper straws.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Establishing An Extended Producer Responsibility Program For Wind Turbine Blades And Solar Panels Manufactured, Sold Or Installed In The State.
description: To establish an extended producer responsibility program for wind turbine blades and solar panels.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Requiring Solar Developers To Provide Farmland Restoration Bonds For Both Petition And Application Projects Approved By The Siting Council.
description: To require solar developers to post a farmland restoration bond regardless of whether such project is pursuant to an application or petition before the Siting Council.
last_action: File Number 452

title: An Act Requiring The Recycling Of Food Scraps And The Development Of Food Donation Plans By Certain Commercial Food Wholesalers, Distributors, Supermarkets, Institutions, Resorts And Conference Centers.
description: To provide for the diversion of food scraps and surplus foods from the solid waste stream.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Requiring The Installation And Maintenance Of Sunscreen Dispensers At Visitor Centers In All State Parks And Beaches.
description: To protect the health and safety of visitors to state parks and beaches.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Second-generation Anticoagulant Rodenticides.
description: To prohibit the use of second-generation anticoagulant rodenticides.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Private Contractors Engaged In Snow And Ice Removal Involving Sodium Chloride.
description: To provide that no private contractor shall, for compensation, remove any snow or ice by using sodium chloride unless such contractor (1) is registered with the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection, and (2) has received training regarding the proper use of sodium chloride for purposes of snow and ice removal.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Connecticut Green Bank And Incentives For Solar Installations For Certain Communities And Households.
description: To (1) expand funding for the Connecticut Green Bank, (2) support income-based incentives for solar photovoltaic system installations for low and moderated income households, (3) provide tax credits for the installation of solar photovoltaic systems in economically distressed communities and environmental justice communities, (4) support community solar programs, (5) ensure net metering provides a fair economic benefit to end use electric customers utilizing such metering, (6) incentivize solar installation workforce expansion, (7) improve the electric distribution grid in underserved areas, and (8) provide for targeted incentives to increase the adoption of solar photovoltaic systems in underserved communities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Power Purchase Agreements Based On Wholesale Prices And Requiring Joint Solicitations For Certain Clean Energy Projects.
description: To (1) prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection or any electric distribution company from entering into a power purchase agreement that provides for the purchase of electricity at a rate exceeding one hundred fifty per cent above the wholesale price of electricity, and (2) require the commissioner to solicit any clean energy project with a capacity exceeding twenty megawatts with two or more other states.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study Electric Distribution Company Accountability And Electric Distribution Competition And Infrastructure.
description: To establish a task force to (1) study electric distribution companies and such companies' accountability and responsiveness to ratepayers, (2) study the introduction of competition in the electric transmission or distribution services industry in Connecticut, and (3) provide an evaluation concerning the costs of acquiring electric transmission or distribution services infrastructure from each electric distribution company and recommendations regarding whether acquisitions are necessary to maintain electric grid reliability in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Imposing An Excise Tax On Private Utility Companies.
description: To (1) impose an excise tax upon any private utility company for the purpose of funding energy assistance programs in the state and reducing the Combined Public Benefits Charge on end use customer utility bills, and (2) require that each public utility report the impact of such excise tax in the Combined Public Benefits Charge section of any utility bill sent to an end use customer of such utility.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting The Clearing Of Forest Land For Grid-scale Solar Photovoltaic Projects.
description: To (1) prohibit the clearing of such land for the purpose of developing grid-scale solar photovoltaic projects, and (2) encourage the siting of such projects on canopies, roofs, brownfields or on existing developed land uses.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Implementing A Surcharge On Electricity Consumed By Data Centers.
description: To (1) create a surcharge on electricity consumed by data centers in the state, and (2) use the proceeds of such surcharge to pay the Combined Public Benefits Charge reflected on electric utility bills for end use residential customers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Incentives For The Replacement Of Residential Electric Resistance Heating Systems.
description: To increase the rate of replacement of residential electric resistance heating systems by (1) identifying dwelling units that would benefit from such replacement, and (2) requiring additional marketing and incentives for the replacement of such systems.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Approval For Certain Grid Scale Nonresidential Solar Photovoltaic Facilities.
description: To allow any municipality with two or more existing nonresidential solar photovoltaic facilities located within such municipality to (1) approve or reject subsequent nonresidential solar photovoltaic facilities proposed for construction or installation in such municipality, and (2) impose a moratorium on the construction or installation of such facilities within such municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority To Make More Frequent Rate Adjustments.
description: To require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to make more frequent utility rate adjustments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Establishing The Connecticut Home Energy Label And Creating A Training Program For Energy-efficiency Professionals.
description: To (1) require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to develop a label that provides a score regarding a residence's energy efficiency, and (2) create a training program for professionals who evaluate energy efficiency in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Removing The Combined Public Benefit Charge From Utility Bills, Amending The Definition Of Class I Renewable Energy Sources, Limiting Rates Allowed Under Certain Power Purchase Agreements And Removing The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To (1) remove the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" from consumer electric bills, (2) redefine "Class I renewable energy source" to include electricity generated from any hydropower or nuclear power generating facility, (3) prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection or electric distribution companies from entering into a power purchase agreement if the price for electricity under such agreement exceeds one hundred fifty per cent above the wholesale price of electricity, and (4) remove the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Legislative Approval For Individual Components Of The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To repeal any component of the Combined Public Benefits Charge not approved by the General Assembly and require future charges be approved by the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring The Installation Of Advanced Conductors In New Or Existing Transmission Lines.
description: To require that electric distribution companies install advanced conductors with an efficiency rating not less than fifteen per cent higher than steel core conductors in any new or existing transmission line.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Incentives For The Adoption Of Heat Pump Water Heaters.
description: To establish a program to incentivize the replacement of electric resistance water heaters with heat pump water heaters.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Acquisition Of An Electric Distribution Company By The State.
description: To (1) create a committee to determine the value of an electric distribution company currently providing service in the state and the states of Massachusetts and New Hampshire, (2) empower the State Bond Commission to authorize the issuance of bonds of the state in accordance with section 3-20 of the general statutes, the proceeds of which shall be used to acquire such company by the state, and (3) empower said committee to sell any asset of such company located outside the state for the purpose of recovering financial expenditures in connection with the acquisition of such company.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Billing For Electricity At Customers' Former Premises.
description: To prevent former building owners and tenants from being billed for electric service they do not use because they sold or moved out of the property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Repealing The Authority To Impose A Public Benefits Charge Without Specific Legislative Approval.
description: To remove charges collectively called the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" from electric bills and require that any such future charge be implemented only upon the affirmative vote of the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring Certifications That Grid-scale Battery Systems Have Not Been Produced With Slave Or Child Labor.
description: To require the owner of any nonresidential grid-scale battery storage system to certify that each component of such system has been procured from a source that does not utilize slave or child labor.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Repeal Of The Combined Public Benefits Charge And Requiring Legislative Approval For Any Future Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To remove charges collectively called the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" from electric bills and require that any such future charge be implemented only upon the affirmative vote of the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Residential Energy Preparation Services Program.
description: To fund the Residential Energy Preparation Services program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring Notice Of Excavation By A Public Utility To Affected Property Owners.
description: To require a public utility to provide notice to affected property owners prior to engaging in excavation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Purchase Of Energy Credits From Out-of-state Providers.
description: To allow electric suppliers to purchase renewable energy credits from out-of-state providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Removing The Combined Public Benefits Charge From Electric Utility Bills And Requiring Legislative Approval For Any Future Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To remove charges collectively called the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" from electric bills and require that any such future charge be implemented only upon the affirmative vote of the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Regulations And Local Zoning Authority Participation In Certain Decisions Of The Connecticut Siting Council.
description: To (1) require the Connecticut Siting Council to consider the plan of conservation and development adopted by a municipality in which a commercial grid-scale solar photovoltaic system is proposed for development prior to approving any such development, (2) limit the land area in any municipality that may be used for commercial grid-scale solar photovoltaic system development to one-half of one per cent, (3) allow a local zoning authority to adopt minimum setback requirements for any commercial grid-scale solar photovoltaic system, (4) expand the jurisdiction of the Connecticut Siting Council to any commercial grid-scale solar photovoltaic system regardless of such system's generation capacity, and (5) require said council to work in collaboration with local zoning authorities prior to approving the development of any commercial grid-scale solar photovoltaic system in a municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Community Choice Aggregation.
description: To allow community choice aggregation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring Certain Public Utility Companies To Hold Annual Community Outreach Meetings And File Annual Community Impact Reports.
description: To require public utility companies that operate pipelines of a certain size to hold annual community outreach meetings and file annual reports on community impacts and performance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring The Creation Of Public Utilities Dashboards.
description: To require each public utility company to create a public facing dashboard for the purpose of increasing transparency and accountability in the provision of utility services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning A Program For Increased Adoption Of Heat Pump Water Heaters.
description: To require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to establish a program to increase the rate at which electrical resistance water heaters are replaced with heat pump water heaters.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Cable Television Service.
description: To (1) allow cable television subscribers to choose the programming included in their subscription, and (2) require increased transparency concerning each component of any consumer bill for cable television services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Appointment Of A Consumer Protection Advocate To The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
description: To require that not fewer than one member of the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority have experience in consumer protection and advocacy and that such member be appointed for the purpose of protecting consumers and ratepayers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Regional Water Authorities Established By Municipalities.
description: To allow a municipality to establish a regional water authority.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Expansion Of The Natural Gas Supply In The State And Removing Electric Vehicle Incentives From The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To (1) require the expansion of the natural gas supply in the state, and (2) remove any cost associated with any program that provides incentives for electric vehicles from the Combined Public Benefits Charge.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Members Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From Employment With Utility Companies For A Period Of Fifteen Years.
description: To prohibit any member of the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from employment with a utility company for a period of fifteen years after the term of such member ends.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Payment Arrangements For Electric Distribution Company Customers.
description: To require an electric distribution company to provide payment arrangements or budget billing agreements to cover any outstanding balance owed by an end use customer of such company, including balances owed for the Combined Public Benefits Charge.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring An Impact Evaluation Concerning Large Data Centers.
description: To require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to evaluate the impact of large data centers on grid reliability.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring Legislative Approval For The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To repeal any component of the Combined Public Benefits Charge not approved by the General Assembly and require future charges be approved by the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Combined Public Benefits Charge, The Restoration Of Electricity Service After System Service Outages, Promoting The Usage Of Smart Meters And Prohibiting Tax Assessment Increases Based On Residential Solar Installations.
description: To (1) require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to conduct a ratepayer impact review concerning the charges collectively called the "Combined Public Benefits Charge" on electric bills for end use customers of each electric distribution company, (2) require said authority to review whether the ninety-six-consecutive-hour standard in subsection (b) of section 16-32l of the general statutes imposes undue costs and whether such standard should be revised, (3) promote an increase in electricity generation through shared subscription solar or battery storage projects, (4) encourage the adoption of smart meter systems for ratepayers, (5) create a tax credit for ratepayers who have paid the Combined Public Benefits Charge, (6) prohibit municipal tax assessors from increasing the assessed value of any residential property based on the installation or use of a solar photovoltaic system at such property, (7) require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to conduct more frequent reviews of costs to ratepayers for storm damage remediation, and (8) require the reinvestment of certain funds paid to a nuclear power plant operation pursuant to power purchase agreements entered into or approved by the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Increasing The Supply Of Natural Gas And Hydrogen Power In The New England Region.
