description: To (1) prohibit the provision of energy drink samples and promotion of energy drinks to children under the age of sixteen, and (2) require identification for the purchase of energy drinks.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Children

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of The Term "camp" By Unlicensed Entities.
description: To prohibit any entity from using the term "camp" in its title or promotional materials unless such entity is a licensed youth camp.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Children

title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Transforming Children's Behavioral Health Policy And Planning Committee.
description: To adopt the recommendations of the Transforming Children's Behavioral Health Policy and Planning Committee.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Establishing A Youth Challenge Program.
description: To establish a National Guard Youth Challenge Program for youths from ages sixteen to twenty.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Certified Nursing Assistants And The Connecticut Retirement Security Program.
description: To help certified nursing assistants prepare for retirement by including them in the Connecticut Retirement Security Program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Independent Contractors By Art Organizations.
description: To ensure art organizations can continue to use independent contractors.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Wages Of Employees Of Cannabis Retailers.
description: To ensure that the subminimum wage statute is not applied to employees of cannabis retailers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Paid Sick Leave By Classroom Employees.
description: To accommodate local or regional boards of education by allowing them to require their classroom employees to use their paid sick leave in four-hour increments in order to account for the practice that substitutes are hired for four-hour increments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Eligibility For Unemployment Benefits.
description: To update the basis for an individual to qualify for unemployment benefits and exemptions for agricultural employers from participation in the unemployment compensation system.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Increasing The Number Of Wage And Hour Investigators At The Labor Department.
description: To increase the number of wage and hour investigators employed at the Labor Department.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Workers' Compensation Coverage For First Responders For Post-traumatic Stress Injuries.
description: To expand workers' compensation coverage for first responders experiencing post-traumatic stress injuries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Municipalities And The Paid Sick Leave Statutes.
description: To amend the paid sick leave statutes to include municipalities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Requiring Employers To Display A Poster Containing Information On Veterans' Benefits And Services.
description: To require the Labor Department to create a standardized workplace poster containing information on veterans' benefits and services for employers to display in the workplace.
last_action: File Number 185

title: An Act Expanding Compensation To Dependents For A Death Resulting From An Accident.
description: To allow surviving family members of an employee to receive compensation for a work-related death when such employee does not have dependents.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Undue Delay In Workers' Compensation Claims.
description: To limit undue delay by an employer or its insurance carrier in providing compensation for medically necessary treatment or equipment.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Paid Prenatal Leave For Pregnant Employees.
description: To ensure mothers receive prenatal care without putting their jobs at risk.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Exempting Local Or Regional Boards Of Education From The Paid Sick Leave Statutes.
description: To exempt local or regional boards of education from the provisions of the paid sick leave statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Prevailing Wage Rates On Public Works Contracts.
description: To provide predictability in the prevailing wage rates for the duration of a public works project.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Requiring Uninsured And Underinsured Motorist Coverage For Department Of Transportation Employees.
description: To require the state to provide uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage to employees of the Department of Transportation.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Minors Who Have Reached The Age Of Fifteen Working In Retail Stores.
description: To allow fifteen-year-olds to work in retail stores under the same conditions as fifteen-year-olds employed in grocery stores.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/04

title: An Act Requiring Full-time State Employees To Return To In-office Or Onsite Work At Least Five Days Per Week.
description: To require state employees to return to in-office or onsite work.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning The Minimum Wage Rate For Persons Under The Age Of Eighteen Years.
description: To reduce the minimum wage rate for persons under the age of eighteen years and eliminate the ninety-day limitation of such minimum wage rate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Increasing The Prevailing Wage Thresholds For New Construction And Renovations.
description: To reduce the costs of smaller public works projects by increasing the prevailing wage thresholds.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Requiring Disclosure Of Certain Sales Of Local News Organizations.
description: To provide that no owner of a news organization that primarily serves any community in this state shall sell such organization to any entity that is not incorporated in this state unless such owner provides at least one-hundred-twenty-days' advance notice of such sale to such organization's employees and members of such community.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/20

title: An Act Allocating Funds From The Regional Planning Incentive Account To Each Regional Council Of Governments For The Hiring Of Personnel To Facilitate The Creation Of Additional Housing.
description: To allocate funds from the regional planning incentive account to each regional council of governments to permit the hiring of personnel to facilitate the creation of additional housing.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Protested Changes To Municipal Zoning Regulations.
description: To specify that if a protest against a proposed change to zoning regulations or boundaries is filed, it shall be signed by the owners of fifty per cent or more of the area of the lots included in such proposed change or the lots within five hundred feet of the subject property and such proposed change shall not be adopted except by a majority vote of the members of the municipal zoning commission.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Permitting Municipal Publication Of Legal Notices In Certain Online News Publications.
description: To authorize municipal publication of legal notices in online news publications specializing in a municipality's region.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Geographic Information Systems Data.
description: To (1) utilize geographic information systems in identifying patterns within certain data, and (2) fund organizations that use geographic information systems to address community needs.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/19

title: An Act Concerning The Waiver Of Certain Sidewalk Construction Requirements.
description: To authorize municipalities to waive requirements concerning the construction of sidewalks in certain areas in exchange for contributions into a fund for the construction of certain pedestrian infrastructure.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning A Property Tax Abatement And Payment In Lieu Of Taxes For Shopping Malls Converted To Residential Use.
description: To (1) establish a property tax abatement for shopping malls that are converted to residential use, and (2) provide payment in lieu of taxes to reimburse municipalities for resulting lost property tax revenue.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/19

title: An Act Concerning Automatic Referral To The Municipal Finance Advisory Commission.
description: To require that any economically distressed municipality with a population less than twenty-five thousand that meets the criteria for referral to the Municipal Finance Advisory Commission be automatically referred to the commission.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Requiring A Report Concerning Health Care Plans, Retirement Plans And Other Benefits Provided By Nonstate Public Employers.
description: To require the Comptroller to analyze reports concerning health care and retirement plans and other benefits provided by nonstate public employers, and submit a report containing such analysis to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to planning and development.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Requiring As Of Right Accessory Commercial Units.
description: To require municipalities to designate areas in which accessory commercial units shall be allowed as of right.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Reducing The Interest Rate On Delinquent Property Tax Payments.
description: To reduce the interest rate on delinquent property tax payments from eighteen per cent to eight per cent.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/19

title: An Act Concerning Motor Vehicle Property Tax Assessment And Revaluation.
description: To authorize municipalities to delay implementation of new motor vehicle property tax assessment guidelines until after the completion of the next municipal property tax revaluation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning State Grants In Lieu Of Taxes For Certain Hospital Facilities.
description: To provide state grants in lieu of taxes for nonprofit inpatient hospital facilities providing mental health care.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Property Tax Abatement For Certain Landlords.
description: To establish a municipal option to abate property taxes for landlords that maintain affordable rental units for a specified period of time.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning An Increase In The Threshold For Sealed Bidding On Certain Municipal Contracts.
description: To increase the threshold for which sealed bidding shall not be required for municipal contracts or purchases from twenty-five thousand dollars to fifty thousand dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Captive Insurance.
description: To: (1) Expand the applicability of the insurance penalty provision to captive insurance companies; (2) allow any captive insurance company to convert into one or more protected cells without impacting such company's assets, rights, benefits, obligations and liabilities; (3) allow any protected cell to be sold, transferred, assigned or conveyed to a new or existing sponsored captive insurance company with all of such protected cell's assets, rights, benefits, obligations and liabilities; and (4) allow the commissioner to separate any insolvent protected cell from any sponsored captive insurance company and address the insolvency of such protected cell separate from the financial condition of such sponsored captive insurance company.
last_action: File Number 63

title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Revisions To The Insurance-related Statutes.
description: To make technical revisions to insurance-related statutes.
last_action: Senate Calendar Number 433

title: An Act Concerning The Insurance Department's Automobile Physical And Property Damage Arbitration Process.
description: To require that any insurance company involved in any automobile physical or property damage arbitration hearing reimburse the cost of such hearing if the arbitration award is in the claimant's favor, unless such claimant rejected such insurance company's prearbitration offer of compromise of equal or greater value than the arbitration award.
last_action: File Number 52

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Health Insurance Statutes.
description: To: (1) Eliminate the requirement that the Insurance Commissioner contract with certain entities that no longer exist to conduct reviews of mandated health benefits, and allow said commissioner to engage the services of organizations that may assist in the review of mandated health benefits; (2) revise annual reporting dates concerning pharmacy benefits manager rebate information; and (3) eliminate the requirement that the Insurance Commissioner adopt regulations to implement health insurance coverage requirements concerning medically necessary wheelchair repairs and replacements.
last_action: File Number 53

title: An Act Concerning Insurance Market Conduct And Licensing.
description: To: (1) Allow for service of process and notice of suspension or revocation of a license to be provided by electronic mail; (2) remove the requirement that insurers conduct at least one audit of such insurers' third-party administrator on-site; (3) require that any insurer report to the Insurance Commissioner any termination of such insurer's agent not later than thirty days after the date of such termination; and (4) eliminate the requirement that insurers provide an annual report concerning such insurers' investigations of automobile insurance fraud.
last_action: File Number 64

title: An Act Concerning Veterans' Affairs In Connecticut.
description: To make minor and technical changes in a statute related to veteran's affairs.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning A Fee Waiver At Public Institutions Of Higher Education For Certain Veterans And Members Of The National Guard.
description: To waive the payment of extension fees for certain veterans and members of the National Guard at public institutions of higher education in this state.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning The Organized Militia And The Governor's Guards.
description: To enable the Governor's Guards to transition from the organized militia to a private military force.
last_action: File Number 258

title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Veterans Affairs' Office Of Advocacy And Assistance.
description: To provide for additional staffing at the Department of Veterans Affairs' Office of Advocacy and Assistance.
last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Various Measures Recognizing And Honoring The Military Service Of Veterans And Members Of The Armed Forces In Connecticut.
description: To make minor and technical changes in a statute related to military affairs.
last_action: File Number 820

title: An Act Concerning Postsecondary Education Opportunities In The State.
description: To study postsecondary education opportunities in the state.
last_action: File Number 4

title: An Act Allowing The Constituent Units Of The State System Of Higher Education To Enter Into Energy-savings Performance Contracts.
description: To allow the constituent units of the state system of higher education to solicit and enter into an energy-savings performance contract under the energy-savings performance contract program established by the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: File Number 5

title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Office Of Higher Education.
description: To (1) define when an institution of higher education is in-state or out-of-state, (2) prohibit reauthorization of any private career school that does not enroll students during the previous two years, (3) allow an extension for private career school authorization of ninety days, instead of sixty days, and (4) require approval for change of ownership of an institution of higher education.
last_action: File Number 156

title: An Act Concerning Student Athlete Compensation Through Endorsement Contracts And Revenue Sharing Agreements.
description: To allow institutions of higher education to enter into endorsement contracts and revenue sharing agreements with student athletes and require public institutions of higher education to submit a report on the revenue shared with student athletes pursuant to a revenue sharing agreement.
last_action: File Number 6

title: An Act Limiting The Annual Rental Price Increase Of Certain Senior Living Facility Units And Requiring Sixty Days' Written Notice Of Such Increase.
description: To limit the annual rental price increase of certain senior living facility units and require an operator of such senior living facility to provide sixty days' written notice of such increase.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Aging

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Helicopter Search And Rescue Operations.
description: To provide critical funding for helicopter search and rescue.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Establishing The New Ideas For Connecticut Platform.
description: To establish the New Ideas for Connecticut platform to enable state residents to submit proposals on methods to enhance economic development, government efficiency and civic engagement in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce

title: An Act Establishing The Connecticut-taiwan Trade Commission.
description: To establish a Connecticut-Taiwan Trade Commission.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/11

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Definition Of Resident Students And The Per Pupil Amounts Paid Under The Education Cost Sharing Grant.
description: To make revisions to the education cost sharing grant formula.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning A Limitation On The Costs Charged To A School District For The Provision Of Special Education Services.
description: To cap the costs for the outplacement of students in special education programs and to require boards of education to be financially responsible for certain special education students.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Prohibiting Students Who Are Biological Males From Competing On Female-only Athletic Teams And Using Female-only Locker Rooms And Facilities.
description: To prohibit biological males from participating in girls' sports and accessing girls' locker rooms and bathrooms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Limiting The Assessment Of The Passport To The Parks Motor Vehicle Registration Fee To One Vehicle Per Household.
description: To limit the assessment of the Passport to the Parks Fee to one vehicle per household.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Authority Of The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection To Modify Or Revoke A Consent Order.
description: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to adhere to the terms of its consent orders.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/03

title: An Act Requiring The Use Of Nonplastic Recyclable Products By The State Under Certain Circumstances.
description: To require the state to utilize nonplastic recyclable products and supplies whenever practical.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Reestablishing The Job Expansion Tax Credit Program.
description: To reestablish the job expansion tax credit program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Personal Income Tax Deductions For Seniors.
description: To require that, for seniors, the qualifying income threshold for any personal income tax deduction be indexed to reflect the rate of inflation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Personal Income Tax Deduction For Stipends Paid To Volunteer Firefighters And Volunteer Ambulance Members.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction for any stipend paid to a volunteer firefighter or volunteer ambulance member by a municipality, a volunteer fire department or a volunteer ambulance association.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Interchange Fees On Electronic Payment Transactions.
description: To prohibit payment card networks from including sales and use taxes in the amount on which interchange fees are imposed.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Estate And Gift Taxes And The Qualifying Income Thresholds For Certain Personal Income Tax Deductions.
description: To eliminate (1) the estate and gift taxes, and (2) the qualifying income thresholds for the personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits and pension and annuity income.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Feasibility Of Implementing Density Requirements For Retailers That Sell Tobacco And Tobacco-related Products.
description: To establish a task force to study the feasibility of implementing density requirements for retailers that sell tobacco and tobacco-related products.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Qualifying Income Thresholds For The Personal Income Tax Deductions For Social Security Benefits.
description: To eliminate the qualifying income thresholds for the personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Personal Income Tax Deduction For The Costs Of Home Health Care.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction of not more than sixty thousand dollars for the costs of full-time home health care services and medical supplies.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Increasing The Qualifying Income Thresholds For The Personal Income Tax Deductions For Social Security Benefits.
description: To increase the qualifying income thresholds for the personal income tax deductions for Social Security benefits and adjust the applicable phase-outs accordingly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For An Advanced Manufacturing Apprenticeship And Community Robotics Center At Tunxis Community College.
description: To authorize bonds of the state for an advanced manufacturing apprenticeship and community robotics center at Tunxis Community College.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Grant-in-aid To South Central Chiefs Of Police Association, Inc. For The Purchase Of Certain Tracking Technology.
description: To provide funding to municipal police departments in the south central region of the state to pay fifty per cent of the cost of acquiring certain technology to track cars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Minor Parties And The Citizens' Election Program.
description: To provide for equal treatment of major and minor political parties under the Citizens' Election Program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Petitioning Candidates.
description: To decrease the number of signatures required for a candidate to petition onto a primary or election ballot.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Ranked-choice Voting In Municipal Elections And In Certain Party Primaries.
description: To authorize the use of ranked-choice voting in municipal elections and in certain party primaries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Universal Voting.
description: To require that each qualified elector cast a ballot at an election.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Allowing Ranked-choice Voting For Municipal Elections And Federal Primaries.
description: To allow ranked-choice voting for municipal elections and federal primaries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Allowing Incarcerated Individuals To Vote.
description: To allow incarcerated individuals to vote.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Authorizing The Implementation Of Ranked-choice Voting.
description: To authorize the use of ranked-choice voting in primaries and elections.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Evaluate And Recommend Policies To Achieve One Hundred Per Cent Voter Participation.
description: To establish a task force to evaluate and recommend policies to achieve one hundred per cent voter participation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning A Pilot Program To Expand The Citizens' Election Program To Certain Municipal Elections In Certain Municipalities.
description: To establish a pilot program to expand the Citizens' Election Program to certain municipal elections in certain municipalities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring A Plan For The Translation And Review Of All Forms And Applications Required To Access State Agency Services Or Benefits By Limited-english Proficient Individuals.
description: To require (1) the Commissioner of Administrative Services to develop a plan for the translation and review of certain forms and applications into languages spoken by limited-English proficient individuals in the state, and (2) state agencies to adopt and implement such plan and appoint a language access coordinator.
last_action: File Number 646

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Certain Software To Establish Occupancy Levels And Rental Rates For The Purpose Of Increasing Landlord And Property Manager Profits.
description: To prohibit the use of certain software that uses one or more algorithms to examine data for the purpose of increasing landlord and property manager profits by constraining housing supply and increasing rental rates.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/14

title: An Act Concerning Minors And Social Media.
description: To (1) prohibit any social media algorithm that targets any individual younger than seventeen years of age, including, but not limited to, by tracking such individual's age or telephone number, and (2) prohibit inclusion of a continuous feed in the social media account of any individual younger than seventeen years of age.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting The Connecticut Lottery Corporation From Publicly Disclosing The Identities Of Certain Connecticut Lottery Winners.
description: To provide that the Connecticut Lottery Corporation shall not publicly disclose the name of any lottery winner unless such winner has consented to such disclosure.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Use Of Flavored Tobacco Products.
description: To prohibit use of flavored tobacco products.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Liquor Sales In Retailers That Sell Food Or Candy.
description: To provide that no retailer that sells food or candy shall be permitted to sell alcoholic liquor.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Sales Of Certain Processed Food Products.
description: To provide that no retailer shall sell any processed food product in this state if retail sales of such processed food product are prohibited in Canada or the European Union.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Establishing A Single Skilled-trade Hiring Ratio.
description: To establish a single skilled-trade hiring ratio of one apprentice to one licensee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Digital Age Verification By Package Store Permittees.
description: To provide that a package store permittee shall digitally verify any identification presented by a consumer in order to ensure that such consumer is twenty-one years of age or older.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning The State Elections Enforcement Commission's Jurisdiction.
description: To grant the State Elections Enforcement Commission oversight of matters related to certain districts' elections and referenda.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Requiring The Auditors Of Public Accounts And Office Of Policy And Management To Review The Costs Of Providing Certain Public And Private Services To Individuals With Intellectual Disabilities.
description: To require the Auditors of Public Accounts and Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management to review the costs of providing public versus private services to individuals with intellectual disabilities.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Unused Veteran Tuition Waivers.
description: To allow any child of a veteran to use tuition waivers for which such veteran was eligible, but did not use.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Requiring Public Institutions Of Higher Education To Repay Student Loans For A Graduate Who Is Granted Bankruptcy Protection.
description: To require public institutions of higher education to repay student loans for any graduate who is granted bankruptcy protection not more than ten years after graduating from such institution.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Establishing A Maximum Annual Rental Price Increase For Residential Leases And Permitting Tenants To File A Complaint Alleging Violations Of Such Maximum Annual Increase.
description: To establish a maximum annual rental price increase with certain limited exceptions, permit a tenant to file a complaint with the Department of Housing alleging violations of the maximum annual rental price increase, and provide enhanced penalties for such violations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prioritizing Allocation Of Rental Assistance Program Vouchers To Individuals Who Intend To Use Such Vouchers In Municipalities Below The Threshold For The Affordable Housing Appeals Procedure Exemption.
description: To prioritize allocation of rental assistance program vouchers to individuals who intend to use such vouchers in municipalities that have not met the ten per cent threshold for the affordable housing appeals procedure exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Permitting A Municipality To Purchase Real Property That Is The Subject Of An Affordable Housing Application.
description: To allow a municipality to purchase real property from a person who submits an affordable housing application, at the original purchase price with a surcharge, to build affordable housing dwelling units.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring Owners Of Short-term Rentals To Register In A State-wide Registry And Pay A Tax On Units That Are Not Owner-occupied.
description: To require the owner of a short-term rental unit to register in a state-wide registry and pay a tax on such units that are not owner-occupied.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Housing Growth Fund.
description: To establish a Housing Growth Fund to provide grants to municipalities to incentivize the production of affordable housing.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring A Landlord To Reimburse A Tenant For Spoiled Food Or Medicine Under Certain Conditions.
description: To require a landlord to reimburse a tenant for spoiled food or medicine due to the landlord's failure to repair refrigeration equipment or electrical malfunctions under certain conditions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Concerning The Conversion Of Vacant Motels To Multifamily Housing.
description: To provide incentives for the conversion of vacant motels to multifamily housing and require municipalities to permit such conversion as of right in certain instances.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Prohibiting Residential Rental Property Owners From Using Pricing Algorithms And Competitors' Sensitive Data To Set Rental Prices.
description: To prohibit residential rental property owners from using pricing algorithms and competitors' sensitive data to set rental prices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Establishing A Medical Respite Pilot Program.
description: To establish a program to create temporary housing opportunities for people receiving medical treatment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Concerning The Annual Report Of Housing Authorities.
description: To require each housing authority to include certain additional information in its annual report and to post its annual report on its Internet web site.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Corporate Ownership Of Residential Property And Giving Certain Individuals And Entities Right Of First Refusal To Purchase Such Property.
description: To prohibit hedge funds, private equity firms and corporations from owning residential property and give certain individuals and entities the right of first refusal to purchase such residential property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Concerning Consumer Access To Pharmacies.
description: To require that any insurance company allow any covered person to have options of not less than three independent or retail pharmacies within a five-mile radius of such covered person's residence for such covered person to have any prescription filled.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Allowing An Interlocutory Appeal Of A Trial Court's Denial Of The Application Of Governmental Immunity When A Law Enforcement Officer Is Alleged To Have Deprived A Person Of Rights And Privileges Provided Under State Law.
description: To eliminate the prohibition against taking an interlocutory appeal of a trial court's denial of the application of the defense of governmental immunity.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Implementation Of Procedures To Improve The Handling Of Matters In The Family Court System.
description: To improve procedures in the family court system.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Evidence Of Contributory Negligence In Personal Injury Actions.
description: To provide that the failure to utilize a seat safety belt, protective headgear or a protective helmet shall be admissible in court as evidence of contributory negligence in a personal injury action.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Prohibiting A Motorcyclist, Bicyclist Or Skateboard Rider From Filing A Cause Of Action Related To A Brain Injury Unless Such Person Was Utilizing Protective Headgear Or A Protective Helmet At The Time Of Such Injury.
description: To prohibit a motorcyclist, bicyclist or skateboard rider from filing a cause of action related to a brain injury unless such motorcyclist, bicyclist or skateboard rider was utilizing protective headgear or a protective helmet at the time of such injury.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Protection Of Sports Officials.
description: To protect sports officials from increasing attacks and assaults and prevent further attrition from the ranks of people willing to serve in such roles.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Authority Of The Attorney General To Initiate Legal Actions In Response To Alleged Discriminatory Housing Practices.
description: To permit the Attorney General to bring legal actions in response to alleged discriminatory housing practices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Halfway Houses.
description: To require that (1) the Department of Correction provide staff in any halfway house, (2) residents in a halfway house be entitled to summary process, and (3) upon closure of a halfway house, the state have full financial responsibility for placement of residents in an alternative placement.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Juvenile Justice Policy And Oversight Committee.
description: To implement the 2025 recommendations of the Juvenile Justice Policy and Oversight Committee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Authorizing Law Enforcement Agencies To Hold Certain Undocumented Immigrants Pursuant To An Ice Detainer Request.
description: To authorize state and local law enforcement agencies to hold an undocumented immigrant pursuant to an ICE detainer request, up to forty-eight hours, and without a judicial warrant, when such person has been charged with a class A, B or C felony or crime of family violence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Unlawful Remote Tracking.
description: To prohibit the use of electronic tracking devices to track another person without such person's permission and to create lawful exceptions to such prohibition.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Victim Notification.
description: To require that when a violent sex offender or violent felony offender has legally changed his or her name, the offender's victims and their family members shall be timely notified of such name change.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Support For Victims And Families Of Violent Crimes.
description: To establish, provide and enhance services to assist victims and their families after suffering from a criminal act.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Commutations Of Sentences Of Violent Offenders.
description: To revise the policy concerning commutation of sentences of violent offenders in order to ensure victims and their families are notified and provided an opportunity to participate in the commutation process.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Establishing Safe Staffing Committees For Each Correctional Facility.
description: To establish safe staffing committees for each correctional facility within the state to develop safe officer post standards and safe staffing standards by shift for all job titles they represent to meet facility needs and promote a safe environment and positive outcomes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Funding Services Of The Victims Of Crime Act.
description: To provide funding for victim services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Disclosures Of Salary Ranges On Public And Internal Job Postings.
description: To amend current law on salary transparency by requiring employers to disclose salary ranges on public and internal job postings.
last_action: File Number 506

title: An Act Concerning Employers' Chargeability For Unemployment Benefits.
description: To make only an employee's most recent employer chargeable for unemployment benefit payments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Reducing The Employee Contribution For The Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program.
description: To reduce the percentage of an employee's subject earnings an employee must contribute to the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Trust Fund.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Dog Licenses.
description: To reduce municipal administrative burdens in the annual issuance of dog licenses.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Regulation, Operation And Taxation Of Discount Retailers.
description: To (1) define "discount retailers", (2) authorize the adoption of municipal zoning regulations concerning discount retailers, (3) establish parity between discount retailers and grocery stores, and (4) authorize municipalities to impose an excise tax on discount retailers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Phasing Out Of The Motor Vehicle Property Tax.
description: To phase out the motor vehicle property tax over a period of five years.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Prohibiting Consideration Of Certain Studies During Permitting And Approval Processes.
description: To prohibit the state or municipalities from considering any study concerning environmental, health, traffic or economic impacts produced in a permitting or project approval process, unless the party submitting such study discloses certain information.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Expiration Of Certain Land Use Permits.
description: To require that unless the holder of a land use permit seeks and is granted an extension of time, such permit shall expire five years from the date of issuance, and any associated site plan shall be deemed null and void.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Dissolving The Laura Andrews Free Library Association.
description: To dissolve the Laura Andrews Free Library Association and distribute the funds of said association to the Town of Thomaston.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Authorizing The Publication Of Legal Notices On Municipal Internet Web Sites.
description: To authorize municipalities to publish legal notices on municipal Internet web sites.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Certificates Of Correction For Tangible Personal Property Assessed In Error.
description: To authorize municipal assessors to issue certificates of correction for tangible personal property assessed in error at any time following the tax due date relative to such property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Applications For Senior, Veteran And Circuit Breaker Property Tax Relief Programs.
description: To establish a uniform deadline for the submission of applications for certain property tax relief programs, permit late applications for medical reasons or other extenuating circumstances and require municipalities to establish optional online application processes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Justices Of The Peace.
description: To authorize municipal legislative bodies to fill vacancies in unaffiliated justice of the peace positions, require the Secretary of the State to oversee training and certification of justices of the peace and establish a task force to examine issues related to justices of the peace.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Liens For Violations Of The Housing Code Or Public Place Ordinances.
description: To specify that any unpaid penalty for a housing code violation or violation of public place ordinance shall constitute a lien upon the real estate against which the penalty was imposed from the date of such penalty.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Establishing An Infrastructure Improvement District In The Town Of East Hartford.
description: To establish an infrastructure improvement district in the town of East Hartford.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Publish Legal Notice On Municipal Internet Web Sites And Online Local Newspapers.
description: To authorize municipalities to publish legal notices on municipal Internet web sites and online local newspapers in lieu of publication in a newspaper.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Fire Districts And Municipal Electric Utilities.
description: To permit political subdivisions, including fire districts, to join or establish a municipal electric utility.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Appointments To Municipal Housing Authorities.
description: To permit the governing body of a municipality to make appointments to the municipal housing authority.
last_action: File Number 704

title: An Act Increasing The Amount Of The Property Tax Exemption For Farm Machinery.
description: To increase the amount of the property tax exemption for farm machinery to three hundred thousand dollars of the assessed value.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Regional Councils Of Government And Inland Wetlands Review And Historic Property Maintenance.
description: To require that (1) for any proposed development that requires approval by municipal inland wetlands agencies in two or more municipalities that are members of the same regional council of government, each such agency shall consult with such council before approving or denying any application concerning such proposed development, and (2) each regional council of government hire building and housing code officials to inspect the conditions of historic buildings, and that such officials be empowered to utilize funds from the Community Development Block Grant Program to facilitate the maintenance or repair of historic buildings.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/19

title: An Act Modifying The Threshold For Sealed Bidding On Certain Municipal Contracts.
description: To increase the threshold for which sealed bidding shall not be required for municipal contracts or purchases from twenty-five thousand dollars to fifty thousand dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Threshold For Sealed Bidding On Certain Municipal Contracts.
description: To increase the threshold for which sealed bidding shall not be required for municipal contracts or purchases from twenty-five thousand dollars to fifty thousand dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Millstone Ridge Tax District.
description: To allow the Millstone Ridge Tax District to collect taxes on a flat rate basis.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Metropolitan District Of Hartford County.
description: To (1) require annual audits of the Metropolitan District Commission by the Auditors of Public Accounts, (2) establish a task force to examine the organization and operation of the Metropolitan District Commission, (3) require the board of commissioners of the Metropolitan District Commission to adopt, administer and enforce a model code of ethics for municipalities and special districts, and (4) permit commissioners from nonmember municipalities to vote on water rates applicable to nonmember municipalities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Certain Adjustments To Gross Assessments Of Taxable Real Property.
description: To (1) clarify the reasons for which a municipal tax assessor may increase or decrease a gross assessment established by the board of assessment appeals prior to a revaluation, and (2) require an assessor who makes such a change to submit a written explanation of such reason.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Local Control Of Zoning.
description: To grant absolute control over the regulation of zoning to municipalities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Implementing A Cap On Property Tax Increases For Senior Citizens And Individuals With Fixed Incomes.
description: To cap property tax increases for senior citizens and individuals with fixed incomes at an amount not to exceed the Social Security benefit per cent increase for the most recent benefit year.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Prohibiting The Requirement Of A Donation Of Land As A Condition Of Subdivision Approval.
description: To prohibit municipalities from requiring a donation of land from an applicant for subdivision of land as a condition of subdivision approval.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Recovery Of Attorney's Fees And Costs In Actions For Wrongful Property Tax Assessment.

title: An Act Eliminating Property Tax Exemptions For Faculty And Staff Housing At Private Secondary Educational Institutions.

description: That the cap on the amount in the Budget Reserve Fund be adjusted to fifteen per cent and the amount between fifteen per cent and eighteen per cent that would otherwise be deposited in said fund be deposited in a Municipal Infrastructure Renovation Fund, to be used for municipal capital expenditures and for certain one-time non-reoccurring expenditures.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

description: That title 38a of the general statutes be amended to (1) place limitations on pharmacy benefits manager contracts to reduce out-of-pocket expenses for consumers, and (2) improve transparency in pharmacy benefits manager practices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

description: To require that any homeowners or automobile insurance company provide written notice to any policyholder through certified mail if said insurance company intends to terminate such policyholder's homeowners or automobile insurance coverage.

description: To establish a medical loss ratio for dental insurance.

description: To ensure that family members of a person for whom a conservatorship is sought are made aware of the application for the appointment of a conservator of the person and the possible consequences of such an appointment.

description: To prohibit any member of a municipal legislative body from entering into a contract with such municipality for the provision of services related to the construction, renovation or repair of municipal property.

description: To assure pet owners are aware of allegations of animal neglect made against their pet's veterinarian.

description: To mitigate a safety risk associated with in-ground swimming pools, particularly as such risk pertains to children, by (1) requiring that owners of in-ground swimming pools that are not surrounded by a certain barrier install such a barrier, and (2) establishing that the provision of the State Building Code revised to October 1, 2022, concerning the installation of a certain powered safety cover or retractable cover as an exception to such barrier requirement shall have no effect and shall not be construed as such an exception.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Commemorative Number Plates To Honor Eagle Scouts.
description: To create a special license plate to honor the achievements and service of Eagle Scouts.

description: To protect consumers by replacing a vague dealer conveyance fee that is added to the sale price of a motor vehicle at the time of purchase with a specific dealer conveyance fee or fees based on the actual conveyance process from dealer to consumer.

description: To establish a Rural Transit Expansion Fund to provide financial assistance for the purpose of expanding public transportation services provided in rural areas in the state.

description: To require the completion of an online training program by members and staff of inland wetlands agencies.

description: To (1) provide financial incentives for municipalities that adopt certain transit-oriented development policies, (2) establish the interagency council on housing development, (3) direct the State Responsible Growth Coordinator to establish a fund for the expansion of water and sewerage infrastructure, and (4) allow certain owners of real property to construct an accessory apartment as of right.

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Prohibit The Sale Of Dogs, Cats And Rabbits In Pet Shops.
description: To authorize municipalities to adopt ordinances to prohibit the sale of dogs, cats and rabbits in pet shops.

description: To make technical revisions to statutes relating to planning and development.

description: To implement the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services' recommendations regarding various revisions to mental health and addiction services statutes.

description: To adopt the Physician Assistant Licensure Compact.

description: To implement the States Advancing All-Payer Health Equity Approaches and Development federal innovation model hospital global payment methodology.

description: To extend the authorization of shock therapy by a patient's written consent or Probate Court order to ninety days.

description: To allow persons with a substance use disorder access to treatment and rehabilitation facilities when they are not intoxicated.

description: To require the Office of Early Childhood to conduct an annual study of child care availability throughout the state and to develop a plan to address infant and toddler childcare needs for low-income families.

description: To establish a universal basic income pilot program and require the Commissioner of Social Services to convene a working group to study the state-wide implementation of a universal basic income program.

description: To clarify that persons employed at cannabis establishments are to be paid the minimum fair wage.

description: To increase the number of wage and hour investigators employed by the Labor Department.

description: To prohibit a municipal or special taxing district pension system from diminishing or eliminating rights and benefits granted to a retiree under a pension or retirement system due to such retiree receiving permanent partial disability benefits.

description: To require state agencies to evaluate what revisions or resources are necessary for state forms and applications to include a nonbinary gender option.

description: To require municipalities that do not have an adopted conflict of interest provision to adopt such a provision and all municipalities to submit a copy of such provision to the Office of State Ethics and post such provision on their Internet web site.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

description: To make minor and technical revisions to the government administration and elections statutes.

description: To amend the prohibition against disclosing the residential address of certain persons contained in personnel, medical or similar files by deleting reference to the employing public agency and expanding the prohibition to other public agency employees for which residency is not a requirement for employment.

description: To provide that purple painted property borders serve as a warning to trespassers.

description: To allow the waiver of certain criminal history records check fees for an indigent person who is seeking a pardon.

description: To include in the standardized method of recording traffic stop information whether police officers making traffic stops were alerted to the alleged traffic violation or other violation by automated means.
last_action: File Number 395

title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Consumer Protection's Recommendations Regarding Alcoholic Liquor Regulation.
description: To (1) redefine "container" for purposes of infused beverages, (2) establish a daily in-state transporter's liquor permit, a restaurant permit for a catering establishment or a qualified managed residential community and a mobile bar permit, (3) redefine "grocery store" for purposes of the grocery store beer permit and related provisions, (4) redefine "meal" for purposes of the caterer liquor permit, (5) specify that the Department of Consumer Protection shall not review an initial application for a liquor permit in the absence of certain required documents, (6) eliminate the newspaper publication requirement for liquor permit applications, (7) provide for a liquor education program, (8) authorize the Commissioner of Consumer Protection to enter into certain settlement agreements, (9) clarify the investigation and enforcement exception regarding purchases by minors, (10) specify that the default penalty for violation of the Liquor Control Act is a class A misdemeanor, and (11) eliminate the municipal recording requirement for liquor permits.
last_action: File Number 617

title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Consumer Protection's Recommendations Regarding Drug Control And Cannabis, Hemp And Infused Beverage Regulation.
description: To (1) establish additional requirements concerning manufacturer hemp products and hemp flower, (2) require certain sterile compounding pharmacies to submit inspection reports, (3) require the Department of Consumer Protection to adopt regulations, policies and procedures designating additional substances as controlled substances, (4) modify the duration of written certifications for the palliative use of marijuana and authorize certain pharmacists to (A) temporarily extend such certifications, and (B) issue temporary written certifications, (5) modify certain requirements concerning a quarterly report submitted by the department, (6) redefine "backer", (7) establish a temporary cannabis operator license, (8) expand the variety of establishments to which certain cannabis establishments may sell, transport or transfer cannabis, (9) eliminate minimum separation requirements concerning certain equity joint ventures, (10) require additional persons to obtain a key employee license, and (11) redefine "container" for purposes of infused beverages.
last_action: File Number 618

title: An Act Concerning The Attorney General's Recommendations Regarding Consumer Products, Abnormal Economic Disruptions And Precipitating Events.
description: To (1) provide that no vendor shall downsize, or reduce the quantity, amount, weight or size of, any consumer product unless such vendor (A) reduces the price charged for such product by a commensurate amount, or (B) discloses that such vendor has made such downsizing or reduction, (2) authorize the Attorney General to declare and respond to abnormal economic disruptions, (3) prohibit vendors from charging unconscionably excessive prices following precipitating events, and (4) modify the procedures applicable to persons who fail to adhere to provisions concerning precipitating events.
last_action: File Number 347

title: An Act Concerning The Attorney General's Recommendations Regarding Social Media And Minors.
description: To (1) restrict a minor's ability to access any portion of a social media platform that recommends, selects or prioritizes certain media items, (2) provide for age verification to ensure that a minor does not access certain portions of a social media platform without consent from the minor's parent or legal guardian, (3) subject to modification by a minor's parent or legal guardian, restrict (A) the hours during which (i) a social media platform may send certain notifications to a minor, and (ii) a minor may access certain portions of a social media platform, and (B) who may view or respond to content a minor posts on a social media platform, and (4) require social media platforms to publicly disclose certain information on an annual basis.
last_action: File Number 348

title: An Act Concerning The Attorney General's Recommendations Regarding Tickets, Veteran Or Military Benefit Services, The State Code Of Ethics, Umbilical Cord Blood, The Solicitation Of Charitable Funds Act And Real Estate Listing Providers.
description: To (1) prohibit certain conduct, and require certain disclosures, concerning ticket sales and resales, (2) regulate veteran or military benefit services, (3) amend the Code of Ethics for Public Officials to authorize the Office of the Attorney General to retain certain persons as expert witnesses, (4) amend the Solicitation of Charitable Funds Act by (A) redefining various terms, (B) eliminating a fund-raising counsel contract filing requirement, (C) requiring that charitable organizations retain and disclose copies of fund-raising counsel contracts, (D) increasing the fund-raising counsel bond, (E) modifying a reporting deadline for paid solicitors, (F) prohibiting certain persons from engaging in certain nonfinancial conduct, and (G) eliminating a prohibition concerning paid solicitation costs, (5) require persons that advertise or resell entertainment event tickets to make certain disclosures, (6) modify when certain disclosures regarding tickets shall be made, and (7) repeal a provision concerning umbilical cord blood collection programs.
last_action: File Number 349

title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Emergency Services And Public Protection's Recommendations Regarding Certain Evidence And Records, Firearm Information, Security Guards, Firearm Transfers And School Security Grants.
description: To implement various recommendations of the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection concerning sexual assault evidence, records of cases of juvenile matters involving delinquency proceedings, information identifying seized or recovered firearms, security guards, firearm transfers and school security grants.

description: To provide that (1) each cannabis establishment shall maintain an active social equity plan and submit an annual report regarding such plan, (2) the Social Equity Council shall (A) review social equity plans, (B) develop a strategic plan, and (C) adopt a code of ethics, (3) council members and staff shall complete an annual ethics training course, (4) a cannabis establishment licensee shall not be entitled to pay a reduced license renewal fee if (A) the license is sold, or there is a change in the ownership or control of the licensee, during the three-year period following issuance of a final license, and (B) such sale or change in ownership or control is made to anyone other than a social equity applicant, and (5) the Department of Economic and Community Development and the council shall approve or deny an application for financial assistance within one hundred twenty days.

description: To: (1) Allow insurers to post certain insurance policies and endorsements on such insurers' Internet web sites; (2) allow property and casualty insurers to provide policy nonrenewal or cancellation notices by United States Postal Service intelligent mail barcode tracking; (3) extend certain protections to a Federal Home Loan Bank for any pledge, security, credit, collateral, loan, advance, reimbursement or guarantee agreement or arrangement or any similar agreement or arrangement or other credit enhancement to which such bank is a party with an insurance company that is under conservation, rehabilitation, liquidation or administrative supervision by the Insurance Department; (4) allow any domestic insurer, health care center or fraternal benefit society to pledge, hypothecate or encumber such insurer's, center's or society's assets in connection with participation in the Federal Home Loan Bank System; and (5) exempt insurance policies that are procured through unaffiliated wholesale surplus lines insurance brokers from the requirement that insurers and surplus lines insurers sign a statement that diligent efforts were made to obtain insurance from a licensed insurer.

description: To increase cost thresholds relating to certain actions required to be undertaken consistent with the state plan of conservation and development and eliminate priority funding areas.

description: To permit the installation of certain solar power generating systems that serve single-family detached units in common interest ownership communities.

description: To clarify certain publication requirements of actions or decisions of a planning commission.

description: To make technical changes to provisions concerning interlocal agreements between municipalities.

title: An Act Concerning The Designation Of Certain Municipalities Referred To The Municipal Finance Advisory Commission As Tier I Municipalities.
description: To require the Municipal Finance Advisory Commission to designate any municipality referred to said commission that has a population of less than twenty-five thousand as a tier I municipality.

description: To provide tuition waivers for nursing home residents in the state who take online courses at regional community-technical colleges.

title: An Act Providing An Income Tax Deduction For Individuals Caring For Elderly Persons, Children Or Disabled Persons.
description: To provide financial relief for family caregivers.

title: An Act Concerning A Research And Development Expenses Tax Credit For Pass-through Entities.
description: To establish a tax credit for research and development expenses of pass-through entities.
last_action: File Number 841

title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of The Connecticut State Seal Of Civics Education And Engagement.
description: To require the State Board of Education to establish a Connecticut State Seal of Civics Education and Engagement to affix on the high school diploma of any student demonstrating a high level of proficiency in such subject matter.
last_action: File Number 317

title: An Act Concerning Paraeducators.
description: To (1) continue for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, the Comptroller's subsidy program for the health care savings account or health care coverage of paraeducators, (2) require boards of education to pay the full employee contribution to the municipal employees' retirement system for paraeducators, and (3) require the Comptroller to annually reimburse such boards fifty per cent of the amount of such payments.
last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Student State-wide Assessments.
description: To reduce the number of times students are required to take the mastery examination and to require boards of education to notify parents and guardians of their student's mastery examination scores.

description: To establish a working group to assist school districts in addressing anti-Semitism in public schools.

description: To replace the Department of Agriculture with the Department of Education as the lead agency responsible for administering the local food for schools incentive program, to expand eligibility in such program to include providers of child care services, and to provide support and funding for such program and the CT Grown for CT Kids Grant Program.
last_action: File Number 834

title: An Act Concerning Public School Libraries.
description: To require local and regional boards of education to develop a policy for the evaluation of public school library materials, to provide a reason for any removal or restriction of access to such materials and to prohibit removal or restricted access to such materials for certain reasons.
last_action: File Number 595

title: An Act Excluding Excused Absences For Student Observance Of Religious Holidays From Truancy Determinations.
description: To exclude excused absences for student observance of religious holidays from truancy determinations.

title: An Act Concerning Third-party Energy Capital Improvements And Establishing A Municipal Electric Grid Modernization Grant Program.
description: To allow third-party developers of energy capital improvements in the state and to establish a municipal electric grid modernization grant program.

title: An Act Concerning Grid-enhancing Technologies.
description: To create a task force to study transmission and grid-enhancing technologies.
