title: An Act Concerning Medicaid Rate Increases, Planning And Sustainability.
description: To phase in increased rates of reimbursement to Medicaid providers over three years in accordance with a rate study commissioned by the Department of Social Services.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Implementing Recommendations Of The Bipartisan Drug Task Force.
description: To implement recommendations of the bipartisan drug task force.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/13/25 5:00 PM

title: An Act Concerning The Board Of Pardons And Paroles.
description: To eliminate the statutorily prescribed amount for payment to part-time board members.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Self-defense.
description: To (1) clarify provisions concerning the discharge of firearms in the case of self-defense or in lawful defense of another person, including for purposes of regulations concerning hunting, and (2) allow the legal transfer of large capacity magazines possessed under a declaration of possession and assault weapons possessed under a certificate of possession between persons who are legally permitted to possess such magazine or weapon.
last_action: File Number 752

title: An Act Concerning Unemployment Benefits For Paraeducators.
description: To require the Labor Department to consider specific circumstances when determining whether an individual who performs services as a paraeducator is eligible to receive unemployment compensation.
last_action: File Number 524

title: An Act Concerning Limitations On The Use Of Noncompete Agreements.
description: To prohibit the use of noncompete agreements and exclusivity agreements unless they meet certain requirements.
last_action: File Number 367

title: An Act Requiring Paycheck Transparency.
description: To require employers to create a guide to help employees understand the pay codes used by an employer on employee records of hours worked.
last_action: File Number 525

title: An Act Requiring A Study On How To Improve The Assignment Of Conservation Officers Throughout The State.
description: To require the Commissioners of Emergency Services and Public Protection and Energy and Environmental Protection to conduct a study on how to improve the assignment of conservation officers throughout the state.
last_action: File Number 415

title: An Act Concerning Firefighter Recruitment And Retention.
description: To enhance firefighter recruitment and retention.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Bleeding Control Training And Kits.
description: To require (1) the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection to administer a bleeding control training program, (2) police officers and probationary candidates who receive certification through such program be given credit toward basic or review training, (3) firefighters who receive certification through such program be given credit toward fire service training and education program standards, (4) bleeding control kits be installed in each building owned by the state or any political subdivision thereof, and (5) amendments to the State Building Code concerning the installation of bleeding control kits.
last_action: File Number 475

title: An Act Concerning A Supplemental Paramedic.
description: To permit the Commissioner of Public Health to issue a certificate of authorization for a supplemental paramedic to the UConn emergency medical service organization.
last_action: File Number 526

title: An Act Concerning Law Enforcement Training.
description: To (1) establish a Law Enforcement Training Advisory Board, (2) establish and fund the social work and law enforcement project at Southern Connecticut State University and the police training center at Central Connecticut State University, (3) eliminate a requirement that curriculum for police officer training concerning techniques for handling incidents that involve persons with autism spectrum disorder, cognitive impairment or nonverbal learning disorder be made available at no cost, and (4) establish requirements for curriculum for police officer training concerning interactions with persons who have mental or physical disabilities.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Permitting A Certain Council To Serve As A Subcommittee Of The Commission On Fire Prevention And Control.
description: To (1) establish a State Wildfire Commission, and (2) permit a council tasked with identifying rural fire issues to serve as a subcommittee of the Commission on Fire Prevention and Control.
last_action: File Number 417

title: An Act Concerning Lights On Vehicles, Penalties For Violations Of Certain Statutes, Stops And Searches, A Phlebotomy Program Study, Inspections Of Certain Vehicles, Traffic Safety Corridors And A Pilot Program To Equip Police Vehicles With Certain Devices.
description: To (1) permit certain first responders to use steady blue or red lights and wreckers to use steady blue lights when stationary, (2) modify penalties for violations of certain statutes relating to motor vehicles, (3) eliminate certain statutory provisions relating to cannabis and stops and searches, (4) study the feasibility of a permanent law enforcement phlebotomy program, (5) require safety inspections of vehicles used by law enforcement units, (6) establish a traffic safety corridor program, (7) establish a program to equip police vehicles with a device that is capable of launching a global positioning system onto another vehicle, and (8) modify statutory provisions concerning police officer review of certain recordings by substituting references to "use of force" with "incident".
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Establishing A Pilot Program For The Public Financing Of Municipal Chief Executive Officer Campaigns In Certain Distressed Municipalities For The 2027 Municipal Election.
description: To establish a pilot program for the public financing of municipal chief executive officer campaigns in certain distressed municipalities for the 2027 municipal election.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Proceedings Of The Siting Council And Other Requirements Concerning Certain Utility Expenditures.
description: To modify provisions concerning the Connecticut Siting Council, including by establishing the Consumer Counsel as a party in proceedings, requiring disclosure of utility retention of lobbyists and excluding lobbying and certain other costs from being considered operating costs for ratemaking purposes and modifying submission and notification requirements for council applications.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning The Disclosure Of Insurer Reports Concerning Treatment Limitations On Mental Health And Substance Use Disorder And Other Benefits As A Public Record.
description: To make reports submitted by insurers to the Insurance Department concerning how the insurers assess the medical necessity of mental health and other benefits a public record for purposes of the Freedom of Information Act.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Referenda On The Sale Of Municipal Authorities, Departments, Agencies Or Assets Thereof Or The Privatization Of Municipal Services Or Functions.
description: To provide that a municipality's decision to sell an authority or other asset, or privatize a department's services or functions, shall, upon the petition of ten per cent of the electors of such municipality, be put to a referendum and voted upon by the electors of such municipality.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Legal Proceedings Involving Housing Matters And The Impermissible Use Of Pricing Algorithms And Competitors' Sensitive Data To Set Rental Prices.
description: To provide additional legal protections to persons who are negatively impacted by housing discrimination, improper denials of affordable housing applications and the use of unfair business practices when calculating rental prices for residential dwelling units.
last_action: File Number 753

title: An Act Concerning Halfway Houses And Other Residential Facilities Operated On Behalf Of The Department Of Correction, Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services Or The Board Of Pardons And Paroles.
description: To allow tenants of halfway houses to avail themselves of summary process and to provide that the state fully fund the operation of any halfway house that is in the process of closing until each tenant has an alternate residential placement.
last_action: File Number 785

title: An Act Concerning Civil Immigration Detainers For Persons Who Are Charged With The Commission Of A Class A, B Or C Felony Or A Family Violence Crime.
description: To permit law enforcement to detain for a limited period a person charged, after a finding of probable cause, with a class A, B, or C felony or a family violence crime for purposes of a civil immigration detainer.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/19

title: An Act Concerning The Trust Act And Prohibited State Contracts.
description: To limit the type of information disclosed to a federal immigration authority and to expand such limitation to all public agencies.
last_action: File Number 757

title: An Act Concerning Access To Reproductive Health Care.
description: To protect patients' access to reproductive health care.
last_action: File Number 824

title: An Act Concerning Maternal Health.
description: To (1) establish a task force to study perinatal mental health care, (2) establish a report card for birth centers and hospitals providing maternity care, and (3) require the Commissioner of Public Health to convene an advisory committee to study doula-friendly practices in hospitals.
last_action: File Number 689

title: An Act Concerning Problem Gaming.
description: To require the Commissioner of Mental Health and Addiction Services to establish a program for the treatment and rehabilitation of individuals and families affected by Internet gaming disorder.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Technical Education And Career System.
description: To (1) require the Office of Policy and Management to approve the filling of vacancies for instructional staff not later than thirty days from the receipt of such request, and (2) expand the debt-free community college program to include the Technical Education and Career System adult education programs.
last_action: File Number 861

title: An Act Concerning Various Revisions To The Education Statutes.
description: To make various revisions to the education statutes, including, but not limited to, statutes concerning board of education budgets, accounts, meetings and employment negotiations, health assessments and related forms, school resource officers, open choice, out-of-school suspensions and expulsions.
last_action: File Number 648

title: An Act Concerning Special Education.
description: To make a technical changes in the special education statutes.
last_action: File Number 706

title: An Act Protecting 504 Plan Accommodations For Students In Connecticut.
description: To codify the provisions of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and those relevant accompanying regulations.
last_action: File Number 707

title: An Act Concerning The Costs To Obtain Transcripts For Proceedings Conducted Before Public Agencies.
description: To set parameters for the costs of obtaining transcripts of public agency proceedings.
last_action: File Number 806

title: An Act Concerning Municipal Campaign Finance Filings With The State Elections Enforcement Commission.
description: To require that all municipal campaign registration and financial disclosure statements be filed with the State Elections Enforcement Commission, instead of with town clerks, and make several conforming changes.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Various Campaign Finance Reforms.
description: To (1) provide clarification to the term "solicit" by defining the term "collector", (2) redefine "organization expenditure" to include campaign events at which a candidate or candidates are present, (3) impose liability upon certain campaign-related vendors who do not provide to qualified candidate committee treasurers the information necessary for such treasurers to perform their duties under campaign finance laws, (4) move the timing of the consumer price index adjustments for individual contribution amounts and the aggregate contribution amounts candidates are required to raise, from January of the election year to (A) not later than July 3, 2025, for elections held in 2026, and (B) January of the prior year for elections held in subsequent cycles, (5) beginning with the 2030 election, allow major party candidates for Governor to apply for convention campaign grants beginning the January of the year preceding the election, (6) provide that candidates who change their party status after filing their grant applications are ineligible to receive additional grant funds, and (7) address approvals of grant applications in relation to the timing of such consumer price index adjustments.
last_action: File Number 690

title: An Act Concerning The Order Of Gubernatorial Succession Under Certain Permanent And Temporary Circumstances.
description: To expand upon the order of gubernatorial succession set forth in the state constitution under certain permanent and temporary circumstances.
last_action: File Number 634

title: An Act Expanding Liability Under The False Claims Act For Entities With An Ownership Interest And Prohibiting The Licensing Of Hospitals With Certain Lease Back Arrangements.
description: To impose liability on entities that have an ownership interest for violations of the False Claims Act and to prohibit granting a new license or certain renewal of a hospital license with a lease back arrangement for its main campus and require notification to the Attorney General of any such arrangement.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Designating The State Amphibian And The City Of New Britain As The Hot Dog Capital.
description: To designate the state amphibian, the city of New Britain as the hot dog capital and the town of Enfield as the gateway to Connecticut.
last_action: File Number 692

title: An Act Concerning Long-term Care Insurance And Eligibility For State Contracts.
description: To: (1) Require a public hearing concerning long-term care premium rate increase requests in excess of ten per cent and insurers to notify policyholders of such hearing; (2) require notice to individuals of the risk of long-term care premium rate increases prior to the purchase of any long-term care policy; (3) require insurers to certify material risk of insolvency during the premium rate filing process; and (4) prohibit any insurer that violates the provisions of this act from entering into state contracts.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Eligibility For State Contracting And Fees Charged For Health Records.
description: To limit the fees charged a patient's attorney or authorized representative to obtain health records and to make any entity that opts not to comply with such fee limitation ineligible to obtain a state contract.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Various Reforms To The Administration Of Elections In This State.
description: To (1) allow certain processing of absentee ballots prior to the day of an election, primary or referendum, (2) provide for notification of electors whose absentee ballots have been marked "Rejected" to advise of the opportunity to vote in person, (3) require that ballots be counted on the day of an election or primary beginning at eight o'clock a.m., (4) require individuals signing petitions to date their signatures thereon, (5) provide that petition forms for candidacies for municipal offices are available from the Secretary of the State instead of the registrar of voters, (6) limit the reasons after the close of the polls for which the canvass may be interrupted prior to the transmission of the preliminary results to the Secretary, (7) for discrepancy recanvasses, (A) require that all districts in a municipality be examined and not just the district in which the discrepancy was found, and (B) allow one party representative to communicate directly with the moderator, (8) require the Secretary to test the election management system, and give a demonstration thereon to local election officials, prior to each election and primary, (9) require the registrars of voters in each municipality to display a poster in each early voting location to assist electors in looking up their proper respective voting district to ensure they receive the correct early voting ballot, (10) require the Secretary to approve at least one electronic poll book for local election official use by January 1, 2027, (11) allow municipalities of a certain size to reduce their number of polling places for primaries, and (12) appropriate funds to the office of the Secretary of the State for early voting purposes.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Accessibility To Absentee Ballots For Electors In State Custody.
description: To allow for eligible electors incarcerated in Department of Correction facilities to apply for absentee ballots.
last_action: File Number 694

title: An Act Concerning Election Statutes Related To Filings With The Superior Court.
description: To (1) require that certain election-related filings be made in the superior court for the judicial district of Hartford or for the judicial district of Bridgeport, and (2) bring into compliance with federal case law certain state statutes relating to the circulation of nominating and primary petitions.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Sunday Hunting On Private Lands Of Ten Acres Or More.
description: To authorize hunting on Sundays.
last_action: File Number 724

title: An Act Concerning Efforts To Streamline State Contracting.
description: To review state contracting and payment policies to identify ways to streamline and improve these processes in order to provide timely contracts and payments to contractors for the provision of services to the state's residents.
last_action: File Number 836

title: An Act Establishing A Parkinson's Disease Research Account.
description: To establish an account to fund Parkinson's disease research.
last_action: File Number 837

title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Student Loan Repayment Programs.
description: To require a study and report on student loan repayment programs.
last_action: File Number 843

title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of Appropriated Funds Other Than The General Fund.
description: To review appropriations from funds other than the General Fund.
last_action: File Number 844

title: An Act Concerning Human Trafficking And Sexual Assault Victims.
description: To amend the membership of the trafficking in persons council, add victims of sexual assault and victims of trafficking in persons as protected classes for purposes of certain anti-discrimination statutes, create an affirmative defense for misdemeanor offenses for young victims of trafficking in persons and eliminate the requirement that training in identification and reporting of trafficking in persons be presented in a video format.
last_action: File Number 754

title: An Act Concerning A Study Of New Revenue Streams.
description: To require the chairpersons and ranking members of the legislative Finance Committee to study possible new revenue streams.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/24

description: To establish a state short-term rental registry, authorize an optional municipal supplemental tax on short-term rentals and require short-term rental return filings to include disaggregated sales tax information.
last_action: File Number 862

title: An Act Establishing A Public School District Repair And Improvement Project Program.
description: To establish a district repair and improvement project program and authorize state bonds to fund such program.
last_action: File Number 863

title: An Act Establishing A Credit Against The Personal Income Tax For Owners Of Family Child Care Homes.
description: To establish a credit against the personal income tax for owners of family child care homes.
last_action: File Number 864

title: An Act Concerning Absentee Voting For All.
description: To remove the statutory restrictions on eligibility for absentee voting.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Studying Efforts To Increase Voter Participation And Authorizing Municipal Pilot Programs To Promote Such Efforts.
description: To establish a task force to study increasing voter participation, and civic engagement generally, in this state by examining the potential implementation concerns in pursuing such goal and looking at the experiences of other jurisdictions.
last_action: File Number 636

title: An Act Concerning Requirements For Appointments Of Utility Commissioners To The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority And Substantial Conflicts Of Interest Of Such Utility Commissioners.
description: To make technical changes to statutes concerning the regulation of state ethics.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Making A Technical Change To Statutes Concerning State Contracting.
description: To make technical revisions to provisions concerning state contracting.
last_action: File Number 654

title: An Act Concerning A Deadline For The Implementation Of Automatic Voter Registration Processes At Certain State Agencies.
description: To (1) require certain state agencies to implement automatic voter registration processes by not later than March 31, 2027, and (2) impose a penalty of five thousand dollars per day for noncompliance with such requirement.
last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning Modifications To Campaign Finance Laws And State Elections Enforcement Commission Authority.
description: To make several changes concerning campaign finance laws and the State Elections Enforcement Commission, including redefining "organization expenditure", "solicit", "contribution" and "expenditure", modifying the contents of certain political advertising disclaimers, reducing the number of audits required to be conducted by said commission, restricting the timing of declaratory rulings by said commission, requiring legislative approval of commission guidance documents, amending procedures for contributions rejected as qualifying contributions for purposes of Citizens' Election Program grant applications, subjecting the commission executive director to nomination and legislative confirmation and providing that court-ordered restitution of funds to a committee are to be spent by such committee over a period of time equal to the time it took to raise such funds instead of all at once.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning Sewage Disposal Requirements And Their Impact On Housing Development, Public Health And The Environment.
description: To require an evaluation of sewage disposal requirements and their impact on housing development, public health and the environment.
last_action: File Number 708

title: An Act Concerning Well Water Quality.
description: To allow (1) the Commissioner of Public Health to implement policies and procedures necessary to administer provisions relating to cross connections between water supplies while in the process of adopting such policies and procedures as regulations, and (2) a local health authority or the Department of Public Health to disclose the results or information obtained from an investigation of the results of a water quality test on a private well serving a residential property or a semipublic well to the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: File Number 709

title: An Act Concerning Assisted Living Services Agencies.
description: To require (1) assisted living services agencies to develop protocols for the provision of certain emergency medical treatment services to residents of managed care facilities, when appropriate, to reduce unnecessary emergency department visits, and (2) rehabilitation facilities to include an individualized mobility plan in each patient's care plan to improve patient mobility.
last_action: File Number 725

title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Juvenile Justice Policy And Oversight Committee.
description: To implement the recommendations of the Juvenile Justice Policy and Oversight Committee.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning The Resolution Of Claims For Wrongful Incarceration By The Claims Commissioner And Owner Liability For Land Available For Recreational Use.
description: To permit the Attorney General and a claimant to stipulate to facts and a compensation award that may, in certain instances, be approved by the Claims Commissioner without the need for the General Assembly to approve such agreement or stipulation.
last_action: File Number 807

title: An Act Concerning Juvenile Justice Initiatives.
description: To require a report by the executive director of the Court Support Services Division of the Judicial Branch on the expansion of community support services.
last_action: File Number 845

title: An Act Concerning Limits On Special Education Expenditures.
description: To require a report on special education expenditures.
last_action: File Number 846

title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Social Services' Implementation Of Changes Resulting From The Medicaid Rate Study.
description: To require a report on the implementation of the Medicaid rate study and a review of Medicaid rates.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Concerning Judicial Branch Operations And Procedures And The Duties Of Judicial Branch Personnel.
description: To: (1) Establish the Office of Information Privacy within the Judicial Branch, (2) revise statutes addressing the sharing of information between the Department of Children and Families and the Court Support Services Division, (3) eliminate obsolete statutory references to "STA-FED, ADR, Inc.", (4) revise venue provisions for certain municipalities, (5) make statutory changes needed to conform with the passage of prior public acts, (6) require the Judicial Branch to review and report on habeas corpus proceedings in other states, and (7) make statutory changes concerning the duties of certain Judicial Branch personnel.
last_action: Tabled for the Calendar, House

title: An Act Concerning A Study Of The Civil Procedure Laws In This State.
description: To establish a working group to study the civil procedure laws in this state.
last_action: File Number 771

title: An Act Requiring An Investigation Of Any Reported Dog Bite Or Attack.
description: To study laws and procedures concerning criminal justice.
last_action: File Number 786

title: An Act Concerning A Study Concerning Driving Under The Influence Of Cannabis Or Psilocybin.
description: To develop recommendations for implementation of a per se blood level of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) for when a person is driving under the influence of cannabis, permit a stop of a motor vehicle if an officer observes cannabis consumption and detects the odor of burnt cannabis and provide that the observation by a law enforcement official of the odor of cannabis or burnt cannabis and active cannabis consumption may serve to constitute in part or in whole probable cause or reasonable suspicion in support of a stop or search of a person or motor vehicle.
last_action: File Number 756

title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Various Statutes Concerning Criminal Justice.
description: To revise provisions concerning (1) the DNA data bank, (2) sexual assault evidence collection kits, (3) juror compensation, (4) failure to appear, (5) acquittee applications for discharge, (6) credit for presentence confinement, (7) use of an electronic defense weapon by a peace officer, (8) pretrial diversionary programs for persons with an intellectual disability or autism spectrum disorder, (9) penalties for a violation of chapter 545 of the general statutes, (10) underage Internet gambling, (11) accelerated pretrial rehabilitation for gambling addiction related violations, and (12) failure to stop for or eluding a police officer.
last_action: File Number 808

title: An Act Concerning Excessive Reckless Driving.
description: To establish specific penalties for operating a motor vehicle in excess of one hundred miles per hour.
last_action: File Number 787

title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Criminal Laws Of This State.
description: To study the criminal laws of this state.
last_action: File Number 788

title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The General Fund.
description: To review appropriations from the General Fund.
last_action: File Number 838

title: An Act Concerning The Transforming Children's Behavioral Health Policy And Planning Committee.
description: To add members to the Transforming Children's Behavioral Health Policy and Planning Committee.
last_action: File Number 847

title: An Act Concerning The Development Of A Pilot Program For The Collection Of Unpaid Taxes From State Contractors And The Department Of Revenue Services' Recommendations For Revisions To The Tax And Related Statutes.
description: To (1) authorize the Commissioner of Revenue Services to enter into agreements with collection agencies and attorneys to collect unpaid taxes, (2) require departments and offices of the state to withhold amounts of unpaid taxes, penalties and interest from payments payable to persons owing such taxes, penalties and interest, (3) authorize the Commissioners of Revenue Services and Motor Vehicles to enter into an agreement to not issue or renew motor vehicle operator's licenses or motor vehicle certificates of registration for persons who owe taxes, penalties or interest to the state until such amounts are paid, and (4) implement the Department of Revenue Services' recommendations for revisions to the tax and related statutes.
last_action: File Number 865

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Examine The Implementation Of A Uniform Energy Storage Capacity Tax.
description: To establish a working group to examine the implementation of a uniform energy storage capacity tax.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Establishing A Uniform Solar Capacity Tax.
description: To establish a uniform solar capacity tax on solar photovoltaic systems.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Concerning The Fiscal Accountability Report.
description: To amend the fiscal accountability report to include estimated changes to nonfixed costs and eliminate the analysis of possible uses of surplus funds.
last_action: File Number 866

title: An Act Concerning The Jobsct Tax Rebate Program.
description: To reduce the number of new full-time equivalents required under the JobsCT tax rebate program for a qualified business with seventy-five or fewer employees.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Establishing A Personal Income Tax Deduction For A Portion Of The Rent Paid By Certain Taxpayers For A Primary Residence In The State.
description: To establish a personal income tax deduction for a portion of the rent paid for a primary residence in the state by taxpayers who meet certain income thresholds.
last_action: Public Hearing 04/14

title: An Act Concerning Requirements For Certain Tax Appeals, The Disaggregation Of Certain Tax Sourcing Information, The Amortizable Bond Premium Subtraction For Purposes Of The Personal Income Tax And The Application Of Valuation Allowance For Certain Combined Group Reporting.
description: To (1) establish requirements for filing certain tax protests, (2) require the Commissioner of Revenue Services to provide certain disaggregated tax sourcing information; (3) eliminate the requirement that the amortizable bond premium subtraction for purposes of calculating Connecticut adjustable gross income be attributable to a trade or business of the taxpayer, and (4) revise certain dates with respect to the application of the valuation allowance under section 12-218h of the general statutes.
last_action: Public Hearing 04/16

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Study Beverage Container Redemption Rates In The State And Reducing The Fee On Infused Beverage Containers.
description: To (1) establish a working group to study the redemption rates of beverage containers in the state and the effect of the increase in refund value on such rates and beverage consumption and costs to deposit initiators, and (2) reduce the fee on infused beverage containers and legacy infused beverage containers to five cents.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Concerning The Indexing Of Personal Income Tax Thresholds And Personal Exemption Amounts, The Establishment Of A Child Tax Credit And The Deduction And Withholding Of Personal Income Tax From Certain Payments And Distributions.
description: To (1) require personal income tax thresholds and personal exemption amounts to be indexed for inflation, (2) establish a child tax credit against the personal income tax, and (3) specify the rate an individual may request to be withheld from certain payments and distributions and redefine "lump sum payment" for purposes of such withholding.
last_action: Public Hearing 04/14

title: An Act Imposing A Tax On Certain Sweetened Beverages, Syrups And Powders And Dedicating The Revenue Generated To A Universal Free School Meals Program.
description: To impose a tax on certain sweetened beverages, syrups and powders and dedicate the revenue generated to a universal free school meals program to reimburse local and regional boards of education for the provision of free school breakfasts and lunches to all public school students.
last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

title: An Act Concerning The Optional Homestead Property Tax Exemption.
description: To authorize municipalities to include, for purposes of the optional property tax exemption under section 12-81oo of the general statutes, a residency requirement or an assessed value maximum, or both, in addition to the existing assessed value percentage range for the exemption.
last_action: File Number 867

title: An Act Concerning The Regulation Of Cigarettes, Tobacco Products, Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems And Vapor Products.
description: To (1) revise the definition of "cigarette", (2) extend the restrictions on shipping or transporting cigarettes to tobacco products and establish an additional penalty for violating such restrictions, (3) establish restrictions on the shipping or transport of electronic nicotine delivery systems and vapor products, and (4) require a seller or seller's agent to request age verification for the purchase of electronic nicotine delivery systems and vapor products.

title: An Act Concerning The Municipal Employees Retirement System.

title: An Act Increasing Resources For Students, Schools And Special Education.
description: To improve the quality of education for the state's children.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Artificial Intelligence.
description: To (1) establish various requirements concerning artificial intelligence systems, (2) require the Department of Economic and Community Development to (A) establish an artificial intelligence regulatory sandbox program, (B) plan to establish a technology transfer program, (C) establish a confidential computing cluster, (D) conduct a "CT AI Symposium", and (E) design an algorithmic computer model, (3) require the Board of Regents for Higher Education to establish a "Connecticut AI Academy" and require the Labor Department, and home visiting programs overseen by the Commissioner of Early Childhood, to provide information concerning said academy, (4) establish a Connecticut Technology Advisory Board, (5) modify the "computer science education and workforce development account", (6) modify the Technology Talent and Innovation Fund Advisory Committee, (7) establish an artificial intelligence systems fellowship program, (8) establish an artificial intelligence task force, (9) require state agencies to take various actions regarding generative artificial intelligence, and (10) prohibit dissemination of certain synthetic images.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Consumer Protection And Safety.
description: To (1) require fee disclosures for consumer goods and services, (2) impose various requirements concerning connected devices, (3) impose various requirements concerning repairs of electronic or appliance products, (4) require each municipality to establish and maintain a ".gov" Internet top-level domain, (5) provide that no supplier shall downsize, or reduce the quantity, amount, weight or size of, any eligible food unless such supplier (A) reduces the price charged for such eligible food by a commensurate amount, or (B) discloses that such supplier has made such downsizing or reduction, (6) authorize the Attorney General to declare and respond to abnormal economic disruptions, (7) prohibit persons from charging unconscionably excessive prices following precipitating events, and (8) modify the procedures applicable to persons who fail to adhere to provisions concerning precipitating events.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning Energy Affordability, Access And Accountability.
description: To improve service and reduce costs for electricity ratepayers in the state.
last_action: File Number 325

title: An Act Concerning Higher Education Affordability And Accountability.
description: To require (1) need-based grants under the Roberta B. Willis Scholarship program to be equal to four thousand five hundred dollars per student, and (2) the Office of Higher Education to disburse grants under the Roberta B. Willis Scholarship program not later than the academic semester preceding the academic semester in which such grants are to be awarded to eligible students.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Resources And Supports For Infants, Toddlers And Disconnected Youths.
description: To provide support for children from birth to age five and address challenges faced by disconnected youths.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning Protections For Access To Health Care And The Equitable Delivery Of Health Care Services In The State.
description: To protect continued access to health care and the equitable delivery of health care services in the state.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Protections For Workers And Enhancements To Workers' Rights.
description: To protect workers' rights.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning The Environment, Climate And Sustainable Municipal And State Planning, And The Use Of Neonicotinoids And Second-generation Anticoagulant Rodenticides.
description: To provide municipalities certain authorities concerning climate resiliency efforts and restrict the use of neonicotinoids and second-generation rodenticides.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance And Patient Protection.
description: To: (1) Establish (A) certain reporting requirements and enforcement provisions concerning compliance with mental health and substance use disorder benefit laws, and (B) the parity advancement account; (2) require health carriers to bear the burden of proving that certain health care services under adverse determination or utilization review are not medically necessary; (3) establish certain prohibitions on the use of step therapy for prescription drugs; (4) require health carriers to include certain provisions in contracts with health care providers regarding reimbursement for certain covered health benefits; (5) establish certain requirements concerning stop loss insurance policies for health care or medical benefits under any self-funded employee health benefit plan; (6) establish certain health insurance rate filing requirements and require that the Insurance Commissioner adopt regulations concerning affordability in rate filing; (7) prohibit the use of artificial intelligence to make an adverse determination based on medical necessity; and (8) prohibit any individual or group health insurance policy from imposing (A) arbitrary time limits on reimbursement for general anesthesia services, or (B) unilateral arbitrary limitations on reimbursement for medically necessary ancillary services.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Prescription Drug Access And Affordability.
description: To increase access to affordable health care.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Connecticut's Housing Needs.
description: To promote fair and equitable housing opportunities in every community in the state.

description: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to adopt regulations regarding the mitigation of future offshore wind project proposals on wildlife and fisheries.

description: To create a record of closed landfills and wells and establish a protocol for PFAS testing of wells, landfills and incinerator ash.

description: To permit Sunday hunting.

description: To require the disclosure of chemical releases by the federal government.

description: To increase patrols and enforcement performed by the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection on state-owned lands and waterways.

title: An Act Establishing A Fund For Trail Maintenance By The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To assist the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection with maintaining state trails.

title: An Act Concerning A Connecticut Dairy Farmer Tax Credit.
description: To provide for certain tax credits for dairy farmers in the state.

description: To provide for certain tax credits for farmers in the state.

title: An Act Requiring Legislative Approval Of The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection's Eviction Of Farmers Conducting Farming On State-owned Property.
description: To protect farmers who permissibly farm on state-owned land.

description: To transfer oversight of certain farming activities from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to the Department of Agriculture.

description: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to submit plans, in advance, for any significant tree removal projects to the General Assembly.

description: To study the threat to state lakes posed by hydrilla and the funding required to remediate such threat.

description: To enhance safety for residents who utilize the major lakes in the state.

description: To provide local representation on the Connecticut Siting Council.

description: To expand Sunday hunting during hunting season.

title: An Act Concerning The Burning Of Medical Waste.
description: To prohibit the burning of medical waste by facilities that do not meet EPA standards for the burning of such waste.
last_action: File Number 665

title: An Act Requiring Soil Testing For Nonresidential Solar Arrays.
description: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to test for soil contamination for nonresidential solar arrays.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Requiring Local Representation And Public Hearings For Connecticut Siting Council Proceedings.
description: To require local representation on the Connecticut Siting Council and require local public hearings if a Siting Council proposal impacts a certain number of properties in a given municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Nip Bottle Payments By Municipalities.
description: To provide that nip bottle payments to towns may be used only for litter remediation, not solid waste generation reduction.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Combined Public Benefit Charge, Amending The Definition Of Class I Renewable Energy Sources, Limiting Rates Allowed Under Certain Power Purchase Agreements And Removing The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To (1) remove the Combined Public Benefits Charge from consumer electric bills, (2) redefine "Class I renewable energy source" to include electricity generated from any hydropower or nuclear power generating facility, (3) prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection or electric distribution companies from entering into a power purchase agreement if the price for electricity under such agreement exceeds one hundred fifty per cent of the wholesale price of electricity, and (4) remove the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Amending Solicitation Requirements For Certain Power Purchase Agreements, Imposing Costs Of Certain Power Purchase Agreements On Customers Of Municipal Electric Utilities And Repealing Certain Requirements Concerning The Standard Billing Format For Residential Customers Of Electric Distribution Companies.
description: To (1) make certain agreements for the purchase of electricity from nuclear power generating facilities unenforceable unless such agreements are subject to solicitation conducted in coordination with two or more other states, (2) impose costs of electricity purchased from nuclear power generating facilities pursuant to certain power purchase agreements on users of municipal electric utilities, and (3) repeal changes to the standard billing format for customers of electric distribution companies imposed by section 14 of public act 23-102.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Income Eligibility For Medical Hardship Programs With Gas Or Electric Distribution Companies.
description: To create income eligibility criteria for any hardship program with any gas or electric distribution company based on serious illness or disability.

title: An Act Concerning Public Participation In Electric Utility Rate Cases.
description: To enhance public awareness and participation in electricity distribution rate review.

title: An Act Creating A Connecticut Energy Data Access Bill Of Rights.
description: To allow public access to data needed to set informed climate targets and accurately monitor progress against such targets.

title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Zero-carbon Power Purchase Agreements Above Wholesale Rates.
description: To prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection from entering into or approving any power purchase agreement with a zero-carbon electricity generating source if such agreement provides for the purchase of electricity at a rate that exceeds the wholesale rate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Requiring A Report From The Commissioner Of Energy And Environmental Protection Concerning Battery Storage.
description: To require a report by the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection on the effectiveness of battery storage technology and such technology's impact on ratepayer bills and the environment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Emergency Response By Telecommunications Companies After Outages.
description: To promote accountability for service outages and to protect consumers of Internet and telecommunications services.

description: To protect the economy and online learning from data breaches and to remove limits on broadband usage.

title: An Act Concerning Notice To Abutting Land Owners And The Disclosure Of Subsidiary Profit And Loss Statements In Public Utilities Regulatory Authority Rate Cases And Creating A Task Force To Study The Creation Of Municipal Electric Companies.
description: To (1) require consistency in notice to abutting land owners in matters before the Connecticut Siting Council and Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, (2) require the disclosure of profit and loss statements of any subsidiary of an entity subject to a rate case before the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, and (3) to create a task force to study the creation of municipal electric companies.

title: An Act Concerning The Independence Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
description: To separate the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.

title: An Act Concerning The Combined Public Benefits Charge.
description: To remove the Combined Public Benefits Charge from consumer electric bills.

title: An Act Concerning The Definition Of Class I Renewable Energy Sources.
description: To redefine "Class I renewable energy source" to include conventional hydropower facilities and nuclear power facilities.

title: An Act Concerning Power Purchase Agreement Rates Above Wholesale Prices.
description: To prohibit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection or electric distribution companies from entering into a power purchase agreement if the price for electricity under such agreement exceeds one hundred fifty per cent of the wholesale price of electricity.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Creating A Municipal Option To Impose A Moratorium On Commercial Solar Photovoltaic Facility Development.
description: To allow any municipality with three or more existing commercial solar photovoltaic facilities located within such municipality to impose a moratorium on the construction or installation of such facilities within such municipality.

title: An Act Concerning The Tax Credit For Machinery And Equipment.
description: To replace the current tax credit for machinery and equipment with a tax credit for fifty per cent of the amount spent by a corporation on machinery and equipment acquired for and installed in a facility in this state and including a five-year minimum use and recapture provision.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Eliminating The Highway Use Tax.
description: To eliminate the highway use tax.

description: To establish a cap on the amount of aggregate personal income tax revenue that the state may collect, with any amount collected in excess of such cap to be refunded to taxpayers on a pro rata basis.

description: To eliminate the highway use tax.

description: To expedite the application process for apprenticeship ratio relief and to require quarterly reports of denials of applications for apprenticeship ratio relief.

title: An Act Lowering The Contribution Cap Of The Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program.
description: To lower the contribution cap of the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program to four-tenths of one per cent.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Apprentice Hiring Ratios.
description: To aid in workforce development.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning State Employees' Participation In The Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program.
description: To include state employees in the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Expanding Workers' Compensation Coverage For Post-traumatic Stress Injuries.
description: To expand workers' compensation coverage for law enforcement and first responders experiencing post-traumatic stress injuries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Impose Certain Excise Taxes.
description: To authorize municipalities to impose excise taxes on occupancy, event venue rentals, and meals and beverages.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Community Investment Boards And Neighborhood Assistance.
description: To (1) require certain municipalities to establish community investment boards to identify priorities for the use of municipal revenue sharing grants and select grants for payment in lieu of taxes, (2) require the Office of Policy and Management to accept proposals for solutions to problems specific to urban areas and establish pilot programs to implement such proposals, and (3) establish a task force to study issues concerning nonprofit providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Calculation Of State Forest Land In Certain Municipalities For Purposes Of Grants In Lieu Of Taxes Payments.
description: To calculate the value of state forest land, for purposes of grants in lieu of taxes payments by the state to municipalities, as real property for any municipality in which over fifty per cent of the land within such municipality's boundaries is state forest.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Restricting Property Tax Growth And The Imposition Of New Mandates On Municipalities.
description: To establish a cap on the annual growth of property tax imposed and require a two-thirds vote of the General Assembly for the imposition of any new mandate on a municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Review Unfunded Municipal Mandates.
description: To establish a working group to identify unfunded municipal mandates that, if eliminated, would result in cost savings to taxpayers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Prohibiting The Municipal Regulation Of Firearms.
description: To prohibit any municipality from adopting any ordinance or other regulation concerning the regulation of firearms.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Prohibiting State And Municipal Use Of Eminent Domain For Commercial Purposes.
description: To prohibit the state and municipalities from exercising the use of eminent domain for commercial purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Requiring The Inclusion Of A Statement Concerning Board Of Education Expenses In Municipal Tax Bills.
description: To require that any tax assessment issued by a municipality to a taxpayer include a statement disclosing the amount of such assessment that will be used to fund the expenses of the local or regional board of education.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Electronic Book Licensing.
description: To require publishers of electronic books to license such books to public libraries on reasonable terms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For Veterans.
description: To specify that qualifying veterans receive a property tax exemption for both the real property owned by such veteran and such veteran's dwelling located upon such real property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Approval Of Zoning Regulation Changes And Plans Of Conservation And Development.
description: To (1) require that any change to any local zoning regulation be approved by the affirmative vote of the municipality's legislative body, and (2) allow a municipality to adopt an ordinance requiring the affirmative vote of the municipality's legislative body to approve the municipality's plan of conservation and development.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Creating A Municipal Right Of First Refusal For Certain Historic Properties.
description: To grant a right of first refusal to a municipality to purchase any historic property located in such municipality if such property is made available for purchase.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Certain Adjustments To The Assessed Value Of Real Property.
description: To prohibit tax assessors from increasing or decreasing the assessed value of real property between revaluation cycles.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Certificates Of Approval For Motor Vehicle Dealerships And Repair Shops.
description: To require that a certificate of approval concerning the location of a motor vehicle dealership or repair shop be issued by the zoning commission, combined planning and zoning commission or other board or authority designated by the municipality and to remove such authority from zoning boards of appeals.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Requiring The Posting Of Fair Rent Commission Bylaws.
description: To require each municipality with a fair rent commission to post such commission's bylaws on such municipality's Internet web site.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Housing

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Feasibility Of Reusing Old Schools As Regional Mental Health Clinics For Minors.
description: To reuse old schools as regional educational and mental health clinics for various levels of care for minors suffering from significant mental health conditions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning The State's Health Care System.
description: To revitalize and strengthen the state's health care system.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of The Viability Of Allowing Naturopathic Physicians To Serve As Primary Care Providers.
description: To study the viability of allowing naturopathic doctors to serve as primary care doctors to ease the shortage of primary care providers in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services To Separate Individuals Of Different Sexes At All Times While Such Individuals Are At Connecticut Valley Hospital For Psychiatric Evaluations.
description: To protect individuals visiting Connecticut Valley Hospital for psychiatric evaluations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Establishing A Policy Allowing Inmates To Be Screened For Breast Cancer At A Health Care Facility Closest To The Correctional Institution Where The Inmate Is Located.
description: To improve women's health care for inmates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Establishing A Mobile Health Clinic Program At Correctional Institutions.
description: To improve health care of inmates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Eliminating The Requirement That Schools Provide Free Menstrual Products In At Least One Men's Restroom.
description: To eliminate the requirement that schools provide free menstrual products in at least one men's restroom.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of The Feasibility Of Reimbursing Student Loan Payments By Health Care Providers Who Provide Pro Bono Services At School-based Health Clinics.
description: To require a study of the feasibility of establishing a student loan reimbursement program for health care providers who provide pro bono services at school-based health clinics.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Allowing Physician Assistants To Issue Do Not Resuscitate Orders.
description: To allow physician assistants to issue do not resuscitate orders.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Establishing A Loan Forgiveness Program For Health Care Professionals Who Work In A Rural Or Other Underserved Area Or In A Field With A Workforce Shortage.
description: To address the shortage of health care professionals in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring The Results Of Any Water Quality Test On A Private Well Serving A Residential Property Or A Semipublic Well That Are Submitted To A Local Health Authority Be Accessible By The Public.
description: To require the public disclosure of water quality tests on certain wells.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Revising Continuing Medical Education Requirements.
description: To decrease ongoing mandates on physicians.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Revising The Certificate Of Need Process For Labor And Delivery And Intensive Care Units.
description: To protect residents from living in a health care desert.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Permitting Emergency Medical Technicians To Administer Intranasal Glucagon.
description: To permit emergency medical technicians to administer intranasal glucagon.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring Providers Of Reproductive Health Care And Counseling To Be Mandatory Reporters Of Child Abuse And Neglect.
description: To protect children by expanding the types of health care providers that are mandatory reporters of child abuse and neglect.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Restoring The Religious Exemption To The Immunization Requirements For School Children.
description: To restore the religious exemption to the immunization requirements for school children.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Establishing A Loan Forgiveness Program And A Tuition Payment Program For Certain Health Care Professionals Who Work In A Rural Or Other Underserved Area Or In A Field With A Workforce Shortage.
description: To address the shortage of health care professionals in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Limiting The Ability Of Private Equity Firms To Purchase Health Care Facilities.
description: To limit the ability for private equity firms to purchase medical care facilities and further protect health care clinicians from the corporate practice of medicine.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services To Provide Data To The Department Of Public Health By Catchment Area For Health Care Professional Shortage Area Scores.
description: To require the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services to provide data to the Department of Public Health by catchment area for health care professional shortage area scores.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of The Potential Health Benefits And Risks Associated With The Use Of Kratom.
description: To require a study of the potential health benefits and risks associated with the use of kratom.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning Health Care Service Cost Estimates.
description: To require each health care provider to provide each patient a cost estimate for health care services prior to treatment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring Health Care Providers To Notify Patients Regarding Recalled Medical Devices.
description: To ensure that patients receive notification of recalled medical devices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning The Certificate Of Need Program.
description: To revise various certificate of need requirements and procedures.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Allowing Emergency Medical Services Personnel To Provide Emergency Treatment And Transportation To Injured Police Dogs.
description: To allow emergency medical services personnel to provide emergency treatment and transportation to injured police dogs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Requiring A State-wide Protocol And Procedures Regarding Suppression Of Fires In Electric Vehicles.
description: To establish a protocol to fight electric vehicle fires.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Requiring The State To Enter Reciprocity Agreements With Other States Regarding Permits To Carry A Pistol Or Revolver.
description: To provide for gun permit reciprocity.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Recognizing The Second Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States As The Authority That Determines Eligibility For Residents To Keep And Bear Arms.
description: To recognize that the Second Amendment to the Constitution of the United States is the authority that determines eligibility for residents to keep and bear arms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Study The Utilization Of Specially Equipped Crash Vehicles As Blocking Devices At Accident Scenes.
description: To establish a working group to study and provide recommendations on first responders utilizing specially equipped crash vehicles as blocking devices at accident scenes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Allowing Emergency Medical Services Personnel To Provide Emergency Treatment And Transportation To Police Animals Injured Under Certain Circumstances.
description: To allow emergency medical services personnel to provide emergency treatment and transportation to a police animal injured while in the performance of its duties.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Establishing A Cybersecurity Task Force.
description: To establish a cybersecurity task force to (1) ensure protection from cyber attacks and prevention of government, business and personal cyber attacks, and (2) submit a report on such study.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Authorizing The Use Of Steady Blue Lights On Wreckers.
description: To increase the visibility and safety of wreckers by authorizing wreckers to display steady blue lights when stationary.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

description: To require the Special Licensing and Firearms Unit of the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection to study and report on errors in the background check process and prevent issuing firearms permits in the future to individuals who have a conviction that disqualifies such person from holding such permit.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

description: To establish that certain funds shall not lapse on June 30, 2025, and shall be available to the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection to provide grants to municipalities, independent fire companies and state agencies to remove PFAS from fire apparatus or provide reimbursement for removal of PFAS from fire apparatus that occurred prior to July 1, 2023.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Increasing The Penalties For Passing A School Bus.
description: To protect children by increasing the penalties for failure to stop for a school bus.

description: To erect signs in the town of Vernon informing motorists of the location of the Miracle League of Northern Connecticut.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Ensuring The Equitable Installation Of Electric Vehicle Charging Stations.
description: To ensure an adequate number of electric vehicle charging stations are installed in rural areas.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Proof Of Ownership For The Release Of A Motor Vehicle That Has Been Towed.
description: To permit the owner of a towed vehicle to present the vehicle's certificate of title as proof of ownership in order to regain possession of such vehicle for the purpose of towing such vehicle to another location.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Naming A Portion Of Connecticut Route 61 In Honor Of Thomas March.
description: To name of a portion of Connecticut Route 61 in honor of Thomas March.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Naming A Portion Of Connecticut Route 317 In Honor Of Louis C. Deluca.
description: To name a portion of Connecticut Route 317 in honor of Louis C. Deluca.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning The Assessment Of Four Points On An Operator's License After Using A Hand-held Mobile Telephone Or Mobile Electronic Device While Operating A Motor Vehicle.
description: To increase the points assessed against a motor vehicle operator's license after violating the prohibition on using a hand-held mobile telephone or mobile electronic device while operating a motor vehicle from one point to four points.

title: An Act Requiring The Commissioner Of Transportation To Respond To Appeals Of A Construction Bid Rejection Within Fifteen Days.
description: To require the Commissioner of Transportation to respond to an appeal of a rejection of a construction bid within fifteen days of receiving such appeal.

description: To establish a "Connecticut Mental Health" commemorative number plate and raise awareness, and provide funding to municipalities, for mental health and suicide prevention services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Electric Car Batteries.
description: To increase transparency by providing an individual who purchases an electric vehicle with information concerning each battery in the electric vehicle.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Restricting The Parking Of Vehicles Containing Flammable Or Explosive Materials Or Debris.
description: To protect state highways by prohibiting the parking of any vehicle containing flammable or combustible material or debris underneath a bridge or overpass.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning A Plan To Privatize The Department Of Motor Vehicles.
description: To maximize savings at the Department of Motor Vehicles by developing a plan for privatization.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

description: To name Connecticut Route 322 in Wolcott in honor of Eugene A. Migliaro, Jr., to recognize his service as a member of the United States Marine Corps, a member of the Connecticut House of Representatives, the mayor of Wolcott and the Commissioner of Veterans Affairs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Permitting Motor Vehicle Registration Independent Of Emissions Inspection Requirements.
description: To permit the registration of a motor vehicle independent of the motor vehicle's compliance with emissions inspection requirements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Requiring The Display Of A Number Plate Only At The Rear Of A Motor Vehicle.
description: To require the display of a number plate only at the rear of a motor vehicle as a cost-saving measure.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Requiring Approval By The Municipality And Any Abutting Property Owner Prior To The Erection Of A Permanent Sign On A Municipal Highway.
description: To require the Commissioner of Transportation to obtain the approval of the municipality and any abutting property owner prior to erecting a permanent sign on a municipal highway.

description: To require the Department of Transportation to install sound barriers in the town of Fairfield to reduce the noise pollution created when the department clears trees.

description: To ensure appropriate rates and charges for nonconsensual towing that accounts for the costs and overhead expenses incurred by the towing company.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

description: To prohibit a dealer from printing the order and invoice for the purchase of a motor vehicle with negotiable fees in advance of discussions with a prospective buyer.

title: An Act Increasing The Gross Vehicle Weight Limits For Vehicles Or Combination Vehicles Hauling Recyclables.
description: To modify the gross vehicle weight limit for vehicles or combination vehicles hauling recyclables to ensure uniformity with weight limits in neighboring states.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning An Independent Assessment Of Transportation Infrastructure Projects.
description: To provide transparency in transportation projects.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

description: To provide same-day services at the Department of Motor Vehicles.

description: To include, for purposes of the property tax exemption under subdivision (83) of section 12-81 of the general statutes, the land on which a qualifying dwelling is situated.

title: An Act Concerning The Property Tax Exemption For Veterans With A Permanent And Total Disability Rating.
description: To include, for purposes of the property tax exemption under subdivision (83) of section 12-81 of the general statutes, the lot on which a qualifying dwelling is situated and to specify that a mobile manufactured home is included as a dwelling.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Exempting Veterans From The "passport To The Parks Fee" When Registering A Motor Vehicle.
description: To exempt veterans from the Passport to the Parks motor vehicle registration fee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection From Developing Policy On Initiatives Related To Carbon Taxes.
description: To prevent the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection from developing policy relating to gasoline or carbon taxes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Collection Of Combined Public Benefits Charges On Electric Bills.
description: To amend title 16 of the general statutes to prohibit any electric distribution company from collecting a combined public benefit charge from its customers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Creating A Task Force To Study Security Protocols To Protect Electricity Transmission Infrastructure.
description: To create a task force to study methods used to protect electricity infrastructure from acts of terrorism, attacks or natural disasters.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Permitting Hardship Customers To Contract With Energy Suppliers.
description: To permit hardship customers to contract with energy suppliers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Telecommunications Companies From Charging Customers To Receive Paper Bills.
description: To prohibit Internet, telephone and cable providers from charging customers to receive paper copies of their bills.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Removing Energy Procurement Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To remove energy procurement authority from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Political Activist Organizations From Receiving State Funds.
description: To prohibit political activist organizations from receiving state funds.

title: An Act Concerning The Spending Cap.
description: To redefine the state "spending cap" in order to limit growth on all state spending, including on and off-budget items, and to eliminate inflation as a factor and only tie the spending cap to growth in personal income.

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Autism Spectrum Disorder Services.
description: To increase funding for the autism spectrum disorder services waiver program and help alleviate the lengthy waiting list for services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

description: To establish a working group to make recommendations on ways to transition from municipal matching grants to per capita block grants that reflect factors including cost of labor and poverty.
last_action: Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

description: To establish a speed limit for Mashapaug Lake.

title: An Act Concerning Civil Preparedness For Climate Change Trends, The Use Of Town Aid Road Program Funds For Climate Resiliency And Revisions To The State Water Plan.
description: To better enable towns to undertake climate change-related resiliency efforts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Decoupling The State's Light Duty Motor Vehicle Emission Standards From The Standards Of California.
description: To decouple the state's light duty motor vehicle emission standards from the standards of California.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Separating The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority From The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection.
description: To restructure the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority as an independent regulatory agency.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning Return On Equity For Electric Distribution Companies.
description: To reduce electric distribution companies' return on equity to a lower rate for the purpose of reducing costs for ratepayers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology
