title: An Act Repealing The Funding Exemption To The Automatic External Defibrillators In Schools Requirement.
description: To repeal the exemption from the requirement that all schools have automatic external defibrillators.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Information Regarding Type 1 Diabetes To The Parents And Guardians Of Students.
description: To provide important and updated medical information on type 1 diabetes to parents and guardians of students through the Department of Education's "Learning and Diabetes: A Resource Guide for Schools and Families".
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring Online Posting Of School Curricula And Other Course Materials.
description: To provide transparency in the public school system.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Public Access To A School District's Curriculum And The Prohibition Of The Teaching Of Biased Political Ideology In Schools.
description: To allow parents of students to have a meaningful role in their child's education by requiring access to public school curriculum and prohibiting the teaching of biased political ideology in schools.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Recruitment And Retention Of School Bus Drivers.
description: To alleviate the school bus driver shortage by assisting municipalities and school districts in the recruitment and retention of school bus drivers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning A Review Of The Qualifications And Certification Process For Special Education Teachers.
description: To require the Department of Education to conduct a review and make recommendations regarding the qualifications and certification process for special education teachers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Education To Study Education Reform.
description: To require the Department of Education to study educational reform.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Increasing Education Cost-sharing Grants For Rural Towns.
description: To revise the education cost-sharing grant formula to better reflect the needs of rural towns.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Full Reimbursement Of A School District's Excess Cost For Special Education.
description: To make school districts whole under the special education excess cost grant.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of A Hold Harmless Provision For The Education Cost-sharing Grant Formula.
description: To hold towns harmless in the rollout of the education cost-sharing formula.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Participation On A Youth Sports Team Based On Assigned Sex At Birth.
description: To limit participation on a youth sports team for public school students based on a student's assigned sex at birth.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning High School Apprenticeship Programs.
description: To require the Department of Education to develop a model policy for high school apprenticeship programs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Fees And Charges For An Educator License.
description: To assist in the recruitment of teachers by lowering the cost of educator licensing fees and charges.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Tiered Membership To An Interscholastic Athletic Conference.
description: To allow for an associated membership to an interscholastic athletic conference to allow eligible nonmember schools to participate in state tournaments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Composition Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
description: To reduce the number of members of the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority from five to three.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Eliminating The Charge Assessed To End Use Customers Of Electric Services That Is Deposited Into The Clean Energy Fund.
description: To eliminate a surcharge assessed on electric bills that is deposited into the Clean Energy Fund.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Prohibiting Electric Distribution Companies From Collecting Fees Other Than Fees For The Purchase Or Delivery Of Electricity.
description: To prohibit electric distribution companies from collecting fees other than fees for the purchase or delivery of electricity and to establish a private cause of action under the Connecticut Unfair Trade Practices Act against electric distribution companies that charge unlawful fees.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Concerning The Effective Date Of Changing Residential Electric Suppliers.
description: To require that requested changes in residential electric suppliers be made effective within one billing cycle.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Purchase Of Automatic External Defibrillators At Schools.
description: To provide funding to schools for the purchase of automatic external defibrillators.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Improvements To The Town Hall In The Town Of Stafford.
description: To provide funding for improvements to the town hall in the town of Stafford to comply with physical accessibility guidelines under the federal Americans with Disabilities Act.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning The Personal Income Tax Marginal Rates, The Asset Expense Deduction For Corporations And The Limit Of Bond Issuances The State Bond Commission May Authorize.
description: To (1) reduce the marginal rates for the personal income tax and allow an eligible taxpayer to claim the entirety of an asset expense deduction under Section 179 of the Internal Revenue Code at once rather than incrementally, for taxable and income years commencing January 1, 2028, (2) establish a task force to develop a plan to implement the specified personal income tax rate reductions in a revenue-neutral way, and (3) limit the amount of bond issuances the State Bond Commission may authorize to not more than the amount of estimated revenue projected for the fiscal year divided by fifteen.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Distribution Of Surplus Funds From A Candidate Committee That Participated In The Citizens' Election Program.
description: To allow candidate committees that participated in the Citizens' Election Program to distribute up to five thousand dollars of surplus funds to a local charity.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/07

title: An Act Redefining "state Contractor", "prospective State Contractor" And "subcontractor" For Purposes Of The Campaign Finance Laws.
description: To redefine "state contractor", "prospective state contractor" and "subcontractor" to exclude persons who simply pay licensing fees for purposes of the campaign finance laws.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/07

title: An Act Requiring Legislative Review Of Certain Interpretations Of Election Law By The Secretary Of The State.
description: To require legislative review of certain interpretations of election law by the Secretary of the State.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring Each Minor Party To Comply With The Rules It Filed With The Secretary Of The State.
description: To require each minor party to comply with its party rules.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Increasing Legislative Oversight Over The State Contracting Standards Board.
description: To increase legislative oversight over the State Contracting Standards Board to ensure efficiency and compliance in state procurement and contracting practices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Modifying The Allowable Apprenticeship Hiring Ratios Applicable To The Skilled Trades.
description: To establish for the skilled trades an allowable hiring ratio of five apprentices to one licensee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Telecommunications Companies And Streaming Service Providers To Provide Pro Rata Rebates And Make Fee Disclosures And Prohibiting Certain Noncontractual Cancellation Fees.
description: To (1) require telecommunications companies and streaming service providers to provide (A) pro rata rebates for cancelled monthly subscriptions, and (B) advance notice disclosing certain pricing or fee changes, and (2) prohibit certain noncontractual cancellation fees.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting State-imposed Continuing Education Filing Fees And Third-party Collection Of Such Fees.
description: To provide that (1) no state agency, board, commission or office shall impose any filing fee for continuing education credits, and (2) no third party shall collect any fee that purports to be a continuing education filing fee imposed by a state agency, board, commission or office.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Establishing A Maximum Charge For Certain Occupational Licenses, Certifications, Permits And Registrations.
description: To provide that neither the Commissioner of Consumer Protection nor the Department of Consumer Protection may charge certain individuals a license, permit, certification or registration fee in an amount that is greater than one hundred dollars per license, certification, permit or registration year.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Concerning Audits By The State Elections Enforcement Commission.
description: To require that the selection process for State Elections Enforcement Commission audits be open to the public.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Concerning The State Elections Enforcement Commission And Qualifying Contributions Under The Citizens' Election Program.
description: To require the State Elections Enforcement Commission to advise of defects in contributions in applications for Citizens' Election Program grants and to afford campaign treasurers opportunities to cure such defects or return contributions to contributors.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Reestablishing The Legislative Program Review And Investigations Committee And Requiring Performance Audits By The Auditors Of Public Accounts.
description: To reinstate the Program Review and Investigations Committee and require the Auditors of Public Accounts to conduct performance audits of state agencies for efficiency, effectiveness, performance and compliance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Allowing A Landlord To Seek Reimbursement From An Evicted Tenant For The Cost To Store Such Tenant's Possessions.
description: To allow a landlord to seek reimbursement for the cost of storing an evicted tenant's personal property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring Fair Rent Commissions To Operate Under The Same Procedures As Other Administrative Agencies In The State.
description: To require a fair rent commission to operate under the same procedures as other administrative agencies in the state.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/13

title: An Act Concerning Civil Actions For Damages Resulting From An Alleged Deprivation Of Rights Committed By A Police Officer, Use Of Force, And Searches Of Motor Vehicles And Pedestrians.
description: To repeal certain provisions of public act 20-1 of the July special session concerning the conduct and actions of police and public safety.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Transfer Of Certain Juvenile Cases To Adult Court.
description: To allow for transfer of certain juvenile cases.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Increasing The Prevailing Wage For New Construction And Renovations.
description: To increase the prevailing wage thresholds for new construction and renovations on any public works project.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Making The Connecticut Retirement Security Program An Opt-in Program, Establishing The Default Contribution Rate As Zero, Requiring The Comptroller To Be A Licensed Security Broker And Prohibiting The Comptroller From Screening Or Choosing Investment Vehicles Based On Any Criteria Other Than The Net Returns To Participants.
description: To make various changes to the Connecticut Retirement Security Program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Making The Connecticut Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program An Opt-in Program.
description: To make the Connecticut Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program an opt-in program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Eliminating The Exemption Of Public Employees From Participation In The Paid Family And Medical Leave Insurance Program.
description: To remove the exemption of public employees from participation in the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program and require all public employees to pay the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program tax.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Eliminating The Requirement That Employers Provide Paid Sick Leave In The Event Of Closure By Order Of A Public Official.
description: To eliminate the requirement that employers provide paid sick leave to employees in the event of closure by order of a public official.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Limiting Collective Bargaining Agreements And Binding Arbitration To Available Funds In The State Or Municipality's Budget.
description: To limit collective bargaining agreements and binding arbitration awards to available funds.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Defining "day" For Purposes Of The Paid Sick Leave Statutes.
description: To define "day" as eight hours worked by an employee for purposes of the paid sick leave statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Municipalities And The Paid Sick Leave Statutes.
description: To exempt municipalities from the provisions of the paid sick leave statutes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Requiring That The Enactment Of New Or Enlarged Municipal Mandates Be Approved By A Vote Of Not Less Than Two-thirds Of The Members Of Each Chamber Of The General Assembly.
description: To require any bill creating or enlarging a municipal mandate to be approved by a vote of not less than two-thirds of the members of each chamber of the General Assembly.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Removing Certain Notice Provisions Concerning Repeat Blight Violations.
description: To remove certain notice and opportunity to remediate provisions concerning repeat blight violations to provide municipalities with additional anti-blight enforcement powers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Reinstating The Religious Exemption From School Vaccination Requirements.
description: To reinstate the religious exemption from school vaccination requirements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Prohibiting The Charging Of Fees For Assisting Veterans In Obtaining Veterans Benefits.
description: To prohibit the charging of fees for assisting veterans in obtaining veterans benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Concerning Members Of The Armed Forces And Certain Department Of Motor Vehicles Fines Or Late Fees.
description: To afford members of the armed forces serving outside of the state a grace period upon their return to the state for the completion of certain motor vehicle-related renewals or testing, during which period fines and late fees therefor are waived.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Concerning Driver's License And Identity Card Renewals At Veterans' Stand Down Events.
description: To require the Department of Motor Vehicles, at Veterans' Stand Down events, to renew the driver's licenses and identity cards of veterans if such licenses or cards are due to expire within the next twelve months.
last_action: Public Hearing 01/30

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Study Exempting Veterans From The Fees For State-owned Or State-controlled Bus Public Transportation Services.
description: To establish a working group to study exempting veterans from the fees for state-owned or state-controlled bus public transportation services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Concerning Funding For Vfw Post 9452 In The Town Of Preston.
description: To provide funding to the Preston VFW to repair damage caused by a fire.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Eliminating Certain Funding For The Xl Center And The City Of Hartford And Increasing Funding For School Resource Officers.
description: To provide funding for school safety programs in all towns and cities in the state by reducing certain state funding for the XL Center and the city of Hartford.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Reducing Noneducation Aid To The City Of Hartford.
description: To reverse the fiscal impact to the state of the debt service agreement between the state and the city of Hartford.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning A Public Hearing Requirement For Budget Earmarks.
description: To require public hearings for earmarks.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations

title: An Act Concerning A Study Of A Four-day School Week And School Start Times.
description: To conduct a study to explore the potential advantages of a four-day school week and determine optimal school start times.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring All Municipal Child Care Programs To Be Licensed By The Office Of Early Childhood.
description: To require all municipal child care programs to have the same licensure and oversight requirements as other non-license exempt child care programs in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Absences For Observance Of A Religious Holiday.
description: To require a student's absence for observance of a widely recognized religious holiday to be counted as an excused absence.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing A Pilot Program For A Boat Washing Station At Gardner Lake In The Town Of Salem.
description: To reduce invasive plants carried on the hull, prop and motor of boats in Gardner Lake in the town of Salem.
last_action: File Number 840

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Single-use Packaging Plastics By The Cannabis Industry.
description: To reduce plastic wastes generated by the cannabis industry.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning The Sale And Use Of Second-generation Anticoagulant Rodenticides.
description: To protect wildlife, ecosystems and the public health from the toxic effects of second-generation anticoagulant rodenticides.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Eliminating Certain Factors In Dog Licensing Fees.
description: To eliminate the higher dog licensing fee for unspayed or unneutered dogs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Providing For The Use Of Atv And Dirt Bike Registration Fees To Fund All-terrain Vehicle Trails On State-owned Property.
description: To provide for the creation of all-terrain vehicle trails on state property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Prohibit The Sale Of Plastic Nip Liquor Bottles.
description: To allow municipalities to prohibit the sale of plastic nip liquor bottles through a vote of their legislative body.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Concerning Protections For Consumer Access To Affordable Electricity.
description: To reduce energy costs and increase energy supply.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/06

title: An Act Requiring The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority To Issue Annual Reports Concerning Transmission Projects.
description: To require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to issue an annual report regarding regional and local transmission projects and the impact of each such project on consumer electricity rates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Establishment Of A Garden At York Correctional Institution.
description: To establish a garden at the York Correctional Institution to grow produce for the inmates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Exempting The Cost Of Headstones Up To A Certain Amount From The Sales And Use Taxes.
description: To exempt up to two thousand five hundred dollars of the cost of a headstone from the sales and use taxes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Exempting Overtime Income From The Personal Income Tax.
description: To exempt from the personal income tax the amount of any overtime income earned by an employee.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing An Investment Board To Manage State Investments.
description: To establish an Investment Board with the fiduciary duty of managing state investments.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Unsolicited Provision Of Absentee Ballot Applications, Audits Of Same-day Election Registration And Absentee Voting, Free-of-charge Photo Identification For Voting Purposes, Mandatory Minimums For Election Crimes And Signature Verification For Absentee Voting.
description: To implement multiple revisions to the election laws relating to absentee voting, same-day election registration, in-person voting and criminal penalties.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring The Secretary Of The State To Conduct Recanvasses For Elections Involving State Offices.
description: To require that the Secretary of the State conduct the recanvass for any election involving a state office.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Making Certain Election Results-related Information Publicly Available.
description: To require that certain supporting documentation be attached to the vote totals sent by the moderator to the Secretary of the State and that such documentation be published on the Secretary's Internet web site.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Verification Of Residential Addresses Of Electors Voting By Absentee Ballot.
description: To require registrars of voters to verify that any elector who votes by absentee ballot actually resides at the address associated with such elector's absentee ballot application and absentee ballot.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Penalties For Certain Election Crimes.
description: To impose mandatory minimum sentences for certain felony violations of election laws.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Signature Verification For Purposes Of Absentee Voting.
description: To require the Secretary of the State to develop and implement a process for verifying the signatures upon returned absentee ballots against the signatures upon the corresponding absentee ballot applications.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Studying Compensation Of Election Workers During The Early Voting Period And On Election Day.
description: To study the compensation of registrars of voters and other local election workers during the early voting period and on the day of an election.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Authorizing The Superior Court To Enjoin The Secretary Of The State's Certification Of Contested State Legislative Election Results.
description: To authorize the Superior Court to enjoin the Secretary of the State's certification of contested state legislative election results.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring The Secretary Of The State To Annually Verify The Citizenship Of Electors.
description: To require the Secretary of the State to annually verify the citizenship of electors.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring The Legislative Commissioners To Document Potential Constitutional Conflicts Of Proposed Legislation.
description: To provide legislators with information regarding the constitutionality of proposed legislation to ensure legislators honor their oath of office.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Repealing Provisions Concerning Remote Public Agency Meetings.
description: To reverse the policy enacted in sections 147 and 149 of public act 21-2 of the June special session that allows for remote meetings to replace in-person meetings in certain government settings.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Ratification Of The Governor's Emergency Declarations.
description: To restore checks and balances to the use of emergency declarations by authorizing any member of the General Assembly to call for a vote to ratify the issuance or renewal of an emergency declaration by the Governor and to require a two-thirds vote for passage of such ratification.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning The Auditing Of Signed Statements Of Electors Prior To Voting.
description: To require that statements signed by electors, in lieu of presenting certain identification at the polls, be audited for accuracy.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning The Auditing Of Same-day Election Registrations.
description: To require the audit of same-day election registrations and subsequent confirmation notices of such registrations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning The Disclosure Of Absentee Ballot Applications.
description: To provide that absentee ballot applications that have been completed and signed are public records subject to public inspection.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Concerning Skilled Trade Licensing Reciprocity In New England.
description: To provide for the adoption of a reciprocal skilled trade licensing agreement with other New England states.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Authorizing Grocery Store Beer Permittees To Sell Hard Cider.
description: To authorize grocery store beer permittees to sell hard cider for off-premises consumption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Consumer Protection To Establish A Single Uniform Business Permit And License Application.
description: To require the Department of Consumer Protection to establish a single uniform business permit and license application without modifying any fee or cost currently imposed for a business permit, license or any application required therefor.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Increasing The Minimum Average Commission Payable To Lottery Sales Agents.
description: To increase the minimum average commission payable to lottery sales agents.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning The State Elections Enforcement Commission And Campaign Finance Laws.
description: To make several changes regarding the State Elections Enforcement Commission and campaign finance laws.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Changing The Authorized Use Of Land Previously Conveyed By The State To The Town Of Newtown.
description: To permit the town of Newtown to use a parcel of land conveyed by the state and located at 6 Commerce Drive in the town of Newtown for open space and recreational purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Concerning Requiring Proof Of Citizenship Or Lawful Residency To Receive Taxpayer-funded Benefits.
description: To establish a requirement for proof of citizenship or lawful residency in order to receive from the state any taxpayer-funded benefits or social welfare services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Requiring The Commissioner Of Social Services To Meet Quarterly With Providers, Including Durable Medical Equipment Providers, To Discuss Medicaid Reimbursement Rates.
description: To establish quarterly meetings between the Commissioner of Social Services and providers, including durable medical equipment providers, to address Medicaid reimbursement rates and develop solutions to improve access to critical medical equipment and other health services for Medicaid beneficiaries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Requiring Affordable Housing Developments Be Not Greater Than Four Stories.
description: To require that each affordable housing development be not greater than four stories.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring A Notification Of Rights To Parties Before A Fair Rent Commission.
description: To require that a fair rent commission notify parties of their rights and the scope of such commission's lawful authority.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Concerning The Amount A Landlord May Require For A Security Deposit.
description: To remove provisions limiting the amount a landlord may require for a security deposit.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Permitting Tenants To Make Advance Rental Payments.
description: To allow a tenant to make advance rental payments to the tenant's landlord.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Concerning Prior Authorizations When An Insured Obtains New Health Insurance Coverage.
description: To prohibit any health insurer from requiring a prior authorization for any health care service or treatment when the insured obtained a prior authorization from such insured's previous health insurer within the same year for such health care service or treatment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Exempting Nonprofit Organizations From The Insurance And Indemnity Bond Requirements.
description: To exempt nonprofit organizations from the insurance and indemnity bond requirements applicable to certain motor vehicle owners pursuant to subsection (a) of section 14-29 of the general statutes, provided the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles finds that such nonprofit organization has maintained sufficient financial responsibility to meet legal liability for personal injury, death or damage resulting from or caused by the use or operation of a service bus owned or operated by such nonprofit organization.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Security Of Real Estate Titles.
description: To establish a task force to study the security of real estate titles to address concerns of fraud and deed theft.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Certain Surgical Procedures Performed To Treat Severe Obesity.
description: To require that individual and group health insurance policies provide coverage for certain surgical procedures performed to treat severe obesity, including, but not limited to, gastric bypass surgery, sleeve gastrectomy and duodenal switch surgery.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Repealing The Trust Act.
description: To repeal the Trust Act in order to free up resources and services to legal residents of this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Repealing Statutes Allowing Automatic Erasure Of Criminal Records.
description: To repeal the acts regarding automatic erasure of criminal records.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Permitting Individuals Who Are Lawfully Admitted For Permanent Residence, As Defined In 8 Usc 1101, To Request That They Not Be Summoned For Juror Service.
description: To permit individuals who are lawfully admitted for permanent residence, as defined in 8 USC 1101, to request that they not be summoned to perform juror service.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study Ways Of Providing Expedited Recourse To Homeowners Who Incur Property Damage Caused By Those Visiting, Or Residing In, An Abutting Group Home.
description: To establish a task force to study ways of providing expedited recourse to homeowners who incur property damage caused by those visiting, or residing in, an abutting group home.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Restoring A Term Of Imprisonment Not To Exceed Three Hundred Sixty-five Days As The Maximum Term Of Imprisonment For A Misdemeanor Offense.
description: To restore a term of imprisonment not to exceed three hundred sixty-five days as the maximum term of imprisonment for a misdemeanor offense.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Mothers Who Are Incarcerated Breastfeeding Their Infants.
description: To permit lactating mothers who are incarcerated to breastfeed their infants during visits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Providing Civil Immunity To Interscholastic Athletic Organizations And The Sanctioning Bodies Of Private Youth Organizations That Adopt Gender Identity Policies Concerning Athletic Participation And Competition.
description: To provide civil immunity for interscholastic athletic organizations and the sanctioning bodies of private youth organizations when such entities adopt policies that require an athletic participant to compete on a team that matches the gender identity on the person's birth certificate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Filing Of Discrimination And Harassment Complaints With The Superior Court.
description: To expedite access to justice for those claiming discrimination and harassment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Domestic And Intimate Partner Violence Murder.
description: To ensure domestic violence deaths are charged as murder instead of manslaughter.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Employee Contributions To The Paid Family And Medical Leave Program.
description: To reduce the Connecticut Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance tax from one-half of one per cent to four-tenths of one per cent.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Participation In The Paid Family And Medical Leave Program.
description: To allow an employee to withdraw from the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program and no longer be subject to the Paid Family and Medical Leave tax or eligible for benefits under the program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Clarifying The Prevailing Wage Statute.
description: To clarify the applicability of the prevailing wage statute.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Establishing A Municipal Grant Program To Facilitate The Expansion Of Certain Single-family Housing And Middle Housing.
description: To establish a grant program to assist municipalities in covering costs related to public infrastructure, in order to facilitate the expansion of deed-restricted single-family housing and middle housing.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Publish Legal Notices Online.
description: To permit municipalities to publish legal notices on municipal Internet web sites.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Declarations Of Personal Property And Property Tax Bills.
description: To require that municipalities (1) provide notice to any owner of income-producing property when such owner has failed to timely file a declaration of personal property concerning such property, and (2) provide a breakdown of taxes owed and penalties imposed on property tax bills.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/03

title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For Solar Projects.
description: To require that a property of five acres or more, which the owner divides into multiple lots of less than five acres for the purpose of leasing land for solar projects, shall be treated as one property for property tax purposes, and that each such lot shall be required to have separate points of ingress and egress.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For Motor Vehicles.
description: To allow a municipality to exempt motor vehicles and increase real property taxes, for a period of not more than five years, to offset any lost revenue.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Increasing The Threshold For Sealed Bidding On Certain Municipal Contracts.
description: To increase the threshold for sealed bidding on municipal contracts for the purchase of real and personal property from twenty-five thousand dollars to thirty-five thousand dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning Personal Property Tax Exemptions For Motor Vehicles Used Exclusively For Farming.
description: To exempt motor vehicles exclusively used for farming from property taxation.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Concerning The Conversion Of Commercial Real Property For Residential Use.
description: To (1) allow the conversion of any commercial building into a residential development as of right, (2) prohibit the revaluation of any commercial building subject to such conversion for not less than three years, and (3) require that municipal inspections of any commercial building subject to such conversion be completed within a reasonable time.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

title: An Act Establishing A Loan Forgiveness Program And A Tuition Payment Program For Health Care Professionals.
description: To address the shortage of health care professionals in rural and underserved areas in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Requiring Smoke Detectors In All Homes In Which A Person Is Providing Health Care Or Hospice Care Through A Home Health Care Agency, Hospice Agency Or Home Health Aide Agency.
description: To ensure a safe working environment for persons providing home health care or hospice care to patients in their homes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Prohibiting The Sale Of Kratom Products To Individuals Under Twenty-one Years Of Age.
description: To protect public health.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Prohibiting The State From Mandating Experimental Or Emergency Vaccinations, Disclosure Of Vaccination Status Or Testing For Illness.
description: To prohibit the state from mandating experimental or emergency vaccinations, disclosure of vaccination status or testing for an illness.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Allowing Out-of-state Telehealth Providers To Provide Telehealth Services To Patients In This State.
description: To establish that the requirements for licensure, certification or registration of telehealth providers include out-of-state telehealth providers who are Medicaid-enrolled providers or in-network providers for commercially, fully insured health insurance providing telehealth services to patients.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Eliminating The Certificate Of Need Program.
description: To eliminate the certificate of need program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning The Reduction Of Wait Times In Hospital Emergency Departments And Requiring A Study Of The Potential Impacts Of Increasing Medicaid Reimbursement Rates For Emergency Room Visits.
description: To reduce wait times at hospital emergency departments and require a study of the potential impacts of increasing Medicaid reimbursement rates for emergency department visits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning The Use Of A Nonbinary Marker On Birth Certificates.
description: To list the sex of the parents and child on birth certificates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning Automatic Electronic Locks In School Classrooms.
description: To protect the children and staff in a classroom in the event of a lockdown or emergency.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of The Use Of Combustible Gas Detectors.
description: To study the use of combustible gas detectors.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security

title: An Act Restoring Service On The Shore Line East Rail Line.
description: To require the Department of Transportation to fully restore service on the Shore Line East rail line.

description: To ensure a person has sufficient time to obtain such person's towed motor vehicle before the towing company sells such motor vehicle.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Requiring Expenditures From The Special Transportation Fund To Be Expended Only For Transportation Systems And Projects.
description: To ensure the resources of the Special Transportation Fund are expended on transportation.

description: To provide savings to the registrants of motor vehicles in Connecticut.

description: To prohibit the issuance of a drive-only motor vehicle operator's license to a person who cannot provide proof of legal United States residency or a Social Security number.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Certain Federal Veterans' Benefits And Income Eligibility Determinations For Certain Public Assistance Programs.
description: To disregard from income certain federal veterans' benefits when determining eligibility for certain public assistance programs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

title: An Act Designating National Women Veterans Recognition Day.
description: To designate National Women Veterans Recognition Day.

description: To exempt veterans, upon presentation of a motor vehicle operator's license or identity card indicating veteran status, from the fees for state-owned or state-controlled bus public transportation services.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Transportation

title: An Act Concerning Occupational License Interstate Reciprocity For Certain Military-related Individuals.
description: To provide for occupational license interstate reciprocity for certain military-related individuals.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

description: To encourage economic development in the town of Plainville.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce

title: An Act Concerning School Choice, Teacher Control Of Classrooms And Parental Access To School Curricula.
description: To advance school choice, empower educators, recognize parental authority, reduce unfunded state education mandates and raise academic standards state-wide.

description: To require that school start times for middle schools and high schools be no earlier than 8:30 a.m.

title: An Act Requiring Pcb Testing In Certain School Buildings And Facilities.
description: To require PCB testing in schools to promote cancer-free learning.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Establishing Excused Absences For Students Observing Cultural And Religious Holidays.
description: To require school districts to consider student absences from school for observance of a cultural or religious holiday to be excused absences.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning Child Care Regulations, Safety Standards And Oversight.
description: To increase protections, regulatory oversight and funding of early childhood care and education providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Encouraging Local School Districts To Regionalize.
description: To encourage the establishment of regional school districts.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Instruction Of English As A Second Language In Public Schools.
description: To require school districts to offer English as a second language programs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Requiring The State Water Plan To Be Amended To Address Climate Change.
description: To require the state water plan to be amended to account for climate change.

title: An Act Establishing Pfas-related Public Water Supply Testing Standards And Requirements.
description: To create a maximum contaminant level for PFAS in public drinking water supplies.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Steel Jaw Leg Hold And Body Crushing Traps.
description: To protect pets and children from accidental harm caused by steel jaw leg hold and body crushing traps.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment

title: An Act Exempting Social Security Benefits And Pension Or Annuity Income From The Personal Income Tax.
description: To exempt Social Security benefits and pension or annuity income for all taxpayers from the personal income tax.

description: To increase, for biotechnology companies, the caps on research and development credit exchanges and utilization and establish a tax credit for research and development expenses of biotechnology pass-through entities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Various Initiatives To Reduce The Cost Of Living In The State And Implement Other Reforms.
description: To reduce the cost of living in the state and implement other reforms.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Establishing A Homestead Property Tax Exemption.
description: To establish a property tax exemption of fifty thousand dollars of the assessed value of owner-occupied single-family dwellings.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

title: An Act Concerning The Distribution Of The Sales And Use Taxes Imposed On Meals Sold By An Eating Establishment, Caterer Or Grocery Store.
description: To provide that the additional one per cent sales and use taxes imposed on meals sold by an eating establishment, caterer or grocery store be distributed to the municipalities in which the revenue was generated.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

title: An Act Establishing A Refundable Child Tax Credit.
description: To establish a refundable child tax credit.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

title: An Act Concerning A State-wide Property Tax On Certain Residential Real Property.
description: To establish a state-wide property tax on residential real property with assessed values of more than three million dollars and to dedicate such revenue to fully fund the equalization aid grants under section 10-262h of the general statutes.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

description: To establish a capital gains surcharge on certain taxpayers.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/26

description: To implement several reforms relating to in-person voting, absentee voting, same-day election registration, election crimes and legislative oversight of constitutional amendments and election laws.

description: To improve state government efficiency and oversight by reestablishing the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee and Commission on Enhancing Agency Outcomes, making various revisions to provisions concerning state agency organization, hiring and audits and increasing criminal penalties for certain ethical violations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

description: To define "preglazed or preassembled" for purposes of an exemption from the flat glass occupational licensing requirement.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Cannabis, Cannabis Products And Cannabis Consumption.
description: To impose additional requirements and restrictions concerning cannabis, cannabis products and cannabis consumption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

description: To address concerns over the misuse of xylazine, particularly as an adulterant in opioid drugs and fentanyl.

description: To convey a parcel of state land to the town of Willington.

description: To permit a municipality to determine the appropriate percentage of deed-restricted affordable housing that should be constructed in such municipality to qualify for exemption from the affordable housing appeals procedure.

description: To establish a program to assist municipalities in developing preapproved building plans to expedite the permit approval process for new dwelling units.

description: To (1) require case-by-case municipal opting out of allowing accessory apartments as of right, (2) establish a program incentivizing the conversion of vacant commercial properties into residential or mixed-use developments, (3) allow tenants to petition the court to seal certain eviction records, (4) establish a Fair Housing Office to promote equitable access to housing, and (5) offer mediation services to homeowners at risk of foreclosure that prioritizes preventing foreclosure.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

description: To establish a tax credit for the construction of dwelling units above existing retail property.

last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

description: To require that any self-funded municipality in this state provide health insurance coverage for breast cancer screening services, including mammograms, tomosynthesis, magnetic resonance imaging and ultrasounds.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Pharmacy Benefits Manager Reform.
description: To reform pharmacy benefits manager practices in this state and establish a duty of care for pharmacy benefits managers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Public Safety, The Prosecution Of Criminals And The Protection Of Victims.
description: To adopt measures concerning public safety, the prosecution of criminals and the protection of victims.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Protection Of Correction Officers From Violence.
description: To protect correction officers from violence perpetrated by persons who are incarcerated.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

description: To safeguard home ownership by increasing the homestead exemption.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning A Plaintiff's Rejection Of An Offer Of Compromise.
description: To promote efficient litigation, reduce frivolous lawsuits and encourage the settlement of disputes by ensuring that cost responsibilities are clearly defined and enforceable.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

description: To permit municipalities to establish committees to oversee and regulate mobile home park rents, fees and related charges.

description: To require municipal zoning regulations to authorize a greater density of housing development within one-half mile of a public transit station than is otherwise authorized by such municipal regulations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

description: To prohibit a health care provider from requiring a patient to provide an electronic payment method to be kept on file with such provider.

description: To enhance the committee's ability to identify trends, evaluate risk factors and develop recommendations to reduce infant mortality rates in Connecticut.

description: To prevent abrupt service interruptions and ensure the continuity of health care services at hospitals and allow the state to coordinate long-term solutions when a hospital is in financial distress or experiencing an operational crisis.

description: To limit hospital administrator salaries and bonuses and reduce health care costs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Concerning References To Suicide In The General Statutes.
description: To align references to suicide in the general statutes with current best practices in mental health advocacy.

title: An Act Concerning The Prevention Of Sudden Cardiac Death In Students.
description: To prevent sudden cardiac death and promote awareness of cardiac health in students.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Evaluate The Creation Of An Oversight Framework For Services To Children With Autism Spectrum Disorder.
description: To ensure that children with autism spectrum disorder receive high-quality, safe and well-regulated services.

description: To safeguard the health and well-being of Connecticut's children while fostering transparency and accountability in the Medicaid program.

description: To exempt veterans, upon presentation of a motor vehicle operator's license or identity card indicating veteran status, from the fees for state-owned or state-controlled bus public transportation services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans' and Military Affairs

description: To study issues faced by conservators handling matters in the Probate Court system.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Permitting Retired Teachers To Be Reemployed Full-time In A Public School.

description: To provide students with opportunities for instruction in American Sign Language in public schools.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education

title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Carbohydrate Information For Menu Items In School Cafeterias.
description: To provide carbohydrate information for all school cafeteria menu items.

description: To create a phase-down mechanism for the reduction in overfunding under the education cost sharing formula for any town that ceases to be designated as an alliance district.

description: To remove any financial penalties for alliance districts.

description: To reduce vegetative waste in landfills and increase the recycling of such wastes.

description: To permit the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to designate any provider or reseller of commercial radio or cellular telephone service as an eligible telecommunications carrier for purposes of providing federal Lifeline service benefits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Construction Of The Uss Groton Sail Monument.
description: To provide funding to complete construction of the USS Groton Sail Monument.

description: To provide funding to the town of Groton to repair its sea wall, which supports vital infrastructure.

description: To establish an optional payroll expense tax.

description: To increase the dues tax exemption threshold for annual club member dues and club initiation fees from one hundred dollars to two hundred fifty dollars.

description: To provide funding to the New England Science and Sailing Foundation to ensure its facilities are compliant with physical accessibility guidelines under the federal Americans with Disabilities Act.

description: To establish and fund a program within the Department of Social Services to address food insecurity.

description: To prohibit the appearance of certain candidates or election officials in public awareness campaigns of the Secretary of the State during the ninety-day period immediately prior to a primary or election.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

description: To require certain motion picture advertisements to separately state (1) the scheduled start time for the motion picture featured in a motion picture exhibition, and (2) the scheduled start time for the advertisements and motion picture trailers that precede the motion picture featured in a motion picture exhibition.

description: To authorize a public agency to charge a redaction fee for the disclosure of a record created by police body-worn recording equipment or dashboard cameras that contains data not authorized to be disclosed under state or federal law.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Concerning Tuition Waivers For Members Of Native American Tribes In The State At Public Institutions Of Higher Education.
description: To provide tuition waivers to members of Native American tribes in the state at public institutions of higher education.

last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Increasing Asset Limits For Husky C Eligibility.
description: To expand access to Medicaid-funded care for older and disabled residents by increasing the asset limit for the HUSKY C health program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning The Expansion Of The Katie Beckett Waiver Program.
description: To expand the Katie Beckett waiver program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning A Compassionate Medicaid Waiver Program For Children With Rare, Progressive Or Neurodegenerative Disorders.
description: To address the urgent needs of the state's critically ill children with rare disorders often leading to a limited life span and ensure equitable access to life-sustaining services and support for families navigating the challenges of such diagnoses.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Expanding Access To Outpatient Substance Abuse Treatment By Reducing Regulatory Burdens On Providers.
description: To expand access to outpatient substance abuse treatment by reducing regulatory burdens on providers.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/20

title: An Act Expanding Long-term Care Options For Medicaid Beneficiaries.
description: To improve health outcomes and quality of life for Medicaid beneficiaries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

description: To improve the quality of care in nursing homes.

description: To improve public health by maximizing use of Medicaid funding for treatment of certain emergency medical conditions.
last_action: File Number 372

title: An Act Concerning The Elimination Of Asset Limits For Husky C Beneficiaries Over A Five-year Period.
description: To create greater equity in Connecticut's Medicaid programs.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning Utility Charges For Residential Dwelling Units.
description: To require that a tenant only be charged for utilities if such tenant's dwelling unit has an individual meter.

description: To (1) require certain nonresident landlords, project-based housing providers or agents in charge of rental properties to register certain personal identifying information, and (2) increase penalties for repeat violations of building and fire codes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

description: To authorize a housing authority to expand its jurisdiction to include housing in other municipalities.

description: To increase the reimbursement percentage for school building project grants for municipalities that meet certain affordable housing thresholds to encourage the creation of affordable housing.

title: An Act Prohibiting Health Insurance Companies From Imposing Unilateral Time Limits On Coverage For Anesthesia Services.
description: To prohibit health insurance companies from imposing unilateral time limits on coverage for anesthesia services.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Consumer Protections For Certain Health Insurance Plans.
description: To require that any stop-loss insurance policy used in conjunction with a self-funded employee health benefit plan: (1) Provide coverage for (A) essential health benefits as defined in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, and regulations adopted thereunder, and (B) the group state-mandated coverage requirements under chapter 700c of the general statutes; or (2) have (A) a minimum individual attachment point of not less than seventy-five thousand dollars, and (B) an aggregate attachment point of not less than two hundred fifty thousand dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Reserve Funds In Common Interest Communities.
description: To require the executive board of any common interest community to perform an annual study of the association's funds in reserve and make recommendations concerning the allocation of funds to such reserves.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Prohibiting Health Insurers From Using Software Tools To Automatically Downcode Health Insurance Claims.
description: To prohibit any health insurer from using a software tool, including, but not limited to, artificial intelligence or an algorithm, to automatically downcode or deny a health insurance claim submitted by a health care provider without detailed review by a clinical peer.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Premium Rate Filings For Individual And Group Health Insurance Policies.
description: To require the Insurance Commissioner to (1) consider affordability as a factor in reviewing individual and group health insurance policy premium rating filings, and (2) hold a public hearing in accordance with the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act, for any health insurance policy premium rate increase request greater than the rate of inflation, using the consumer price index for all urban consumers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Site-neutral Reimbursements For Certain Covered Health Insurance Benefits.
description: To require health insurers to provide site-neutral reimbursements to health care providers for covered health insurance benefits for: (1) Current procedural terminology evaluation and management (CPT E/M) codes; (2) current procedural terminology assessment and management (CPT A/M) codes; (3) telehealth codes; and (4) drug infusion codes in amounts that do not vary based on ownership of the facility where a contracting health care provider provides such benefit.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Duty Of Good Faith And Fair Dealing Owed By Pharmacy Benefits Managers.
description: To establish a pharmacy benefits manager duty of good faith and fair dealing with all parties with whom each pharmacy benefits manager interacts in the performance of such pharmacy benefits manager's management services, including, but not limited to, health carriers, health benefit plan sponsors, pharmacies and covered persons.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Pharmacy Benefits Manager Reform And Price Gouging In The Health Care Sector.
description: To reform pharmacy benefits manager practices in this state, establish a duty of care for pharmacy benefits managers and regulate health care price gouging in this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Medical Loss Ratio For Dental Insurance.
description: To establish a medical loss ratio for dental insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Limiting Recovery Of Claims For Behavioral Health Conditions.
description: To prohibit any health insurer from seeking recovery from a behavioral health provider for overpayment of a claim under a health insurance policy to treat any behavioral health condition, unless notice is provided to such behavioral health provider not later than two years after the initial claim for payment was received by such health insurer.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Behavioral Health Parity.
description: To require parity in behavioral health coverage in line with coverage for medical, surgical or other physical health conditions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

description: To give state courts the power to interpret a statute independently and without having to give deference to a state agency interpretation of a statute.

title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Immediate Mental Health Interventions In Correctional Facilities.
