title: An Act Dedicating A Portion Of The Revenue Generated From Sales And Use Taxes Imposed On Meals Sold By An Eating Establishment, Caterer Or Grocery Store To The Tourism Fund.
description: To require a percentage of the revenue generated from the additional one per cent sales and use taxes imposed on meals sold by an eating establishment, caterer or grocery store be deposited in the Tourism Fund to support the hospitality, arts, culture and tourism needs of the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Public Works Garage In The Town Of Lebanon.
description: To provide funding to the town of Lebanon for the design and construction of a public works garage.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For An Elderly Housing Facility In The Town Of Lebanon.
description: To provide funding for a sixteen-unit affordable elderly housing facility in the town of Lebanon.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Purchase Camp Laurel In The Town Of Lebanon As Open Space.
description: To provide funding to purchase Camp Laurel in the town of Lebanon as open space.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Renovations To St. Mary Of The Immaculate Conception In The Village Of Baltic.
description: To provide funding to St. Mary of the Immaculate Conception in the village of Baltic in the town of Sprague for renovations to the bell tower and other structures.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Town Green In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding to the town of Ledyard to provide accessibility for persons with disabilities and cleanup at the town green.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Expansion Of Bill Library In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding for the expansion of the Bill Library in the town of Ledyard.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Planning Grant To Expand Sewer Lines In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding for a planning grant to expand sewer lines in the town of Ledyard.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Develop A Plan And Study Regarding Parks And A Community Center In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding to the town of Ledyard to develop a plan and study regarding the town's parks and a community center.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Brownfield Remediation At A Site In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding to remediate a brownfield site in the town of Ledyard.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Expansion Of The Cafeteria At Ledyard Middle School In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding to the town of Ledyard to expand the cafeteria at Ledyard Middle School to accommodate the students at meal times.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Multimodal Track On A Portion Of Connecticut Route 117.
description: To provide funding to the town of Ledyard for a multimodal track on Connecticut Route 117 to the Groton town line.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Improvements To The Athletic Fields For Regional School District 8.
description: To provide funding to Regional School District 8 for improvements to the athletic fields.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Sewer Project In The Village Of Hanover.
description: To provide funding for the installation of a force main and sewer lines in the village of Hanover in the town of Sprague and replace existing lines that are over one hundred years old, collapsing and causing sewer backup into residential homes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Support The American Globe Center.
description: To provide funding to support the American Globe Center to create a unique cultural and tourism hub.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Improve Dams, Culverts, Bridges And Waterways In The Town Of Ledyard.
description: To provide funding to improve the dams, culverts, bridges and waterways on Long Pond, Bush Pond and other related waterways in the town of Ledyard.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Planning Grant For The Norwich Side Of The Former Norwich State Hospital Property.
description: To provide funding for a planning grant to determine the remediation needs and potential uses of the Norwich side of the former Norwich State Hospital property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Construction Of A Police Station In The City Of Norwich.
description: To provide sixty-seven per cent of the funding necessary for the construction of a police station in the city of Norwich.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Improve And Provide Equipment For Water Lines In The Town Of Hebron.
description: To provide funding for the improvement of and provision of necessary equipment for water lines in the town of Hebron.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Integrated Day Charter School In The City Of Norwich.
description: To provide funding to the Integrated Day Charter School in the city of Norwich.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

title: An Act Concerning Ranked-choice Voting.
description: To provide for the method of election known as ranked-choice voting and allow its use for presidential preference primaries and certain municipal elections.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating Parkinson's Awareness Day.
description: To designate April eleventh of each year as Parkinson's Awareness Day.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Redefining "state Contractor", "prospective State Contractor" And "subcontractor" To Exclude Statutorily Recognized Indian Tribes Of This State For Purposes Of Campaign Finance Laws.
description: To redefine "state contractor", "prospective state contractor" and "subcontractor" to exclude statutorily recognized Indian tribes of this state for purposes of campaign finance laws.
last_action: File Number 327

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of The Use Of Credit Card Verification Value Codes For Campaign Finance Purposes.
description: To require a study of the use of credit card verification value codes for campaign finance purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring State And Local Government And State Contractors To Ensure Individuals With Limited English Proficiency Are Able To Access Public Services.
description: To require the adoption of various policies concerning the offering of translation and interpretation services to ensure that individuals with limited English proficiency have meaningful access to programs and services offered by state and local government agencies, contractors and other entities that receive state funding.
last_action: Public Hearing 03/21

title: An Act Increasing Funding For The Community Investment Account.
description: To increase the recording fee that funds the Community Investment Account by six dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Prohibiting Proof Of Vaccination Requirements Or Inquiries To Gain Public Access To Commercial Establishments Or State Or Local Government Lands Or Buildings.
description: To prohibit proof of vaccination requirements or inquiring into vaccine records to gain public access to commercial establishments or state or local government lands or buildings.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating Face Equity Week.
description: To designate a week in the month of May of each year as Face Equity Week, to acknowledge those with facial differences.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating Connecticut Recipients Of The Medal Of Honor Day.
description: To designate a day in the month of July annually as Connecticut Recipients of the Medal of Honor Day to acknowledge those residents who have been recipients of the Medal of Honor.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating Epilepsy Awareness Month.
description: To designate the month of November of each year as Epilepsy Awareness Month.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Designating Connecticut Native Plant Month.
description: To designate the month of April of each year as Connecticut Native Plant Month.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections

title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Consumer Protection To Review Kentucky's Gaming Laws.
description: To require the Department of Consumer Protection to review Kentucky's gaming laws and make recommendations to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to legalized gambling to provide for safe and responsible gaming in this state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Chemical Hair Relaxer Containers To Bear Labels Disclosing Potential Health Risks.
description: To require each chemical hair relaxer container to bear a label disclosing the potential health risks posed by chemical hair relaxers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Businesses From Imposing A Surcharge On Consumers Who Request To Receive Bills In Paper Form.
description: To provide that no person doing business in this state shall require a consumer to pay a surcharge in order to receive a bill in paper form.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Required Presentation Of Printed Receipts As Proof Of Purchase Of Consumer Goods And Services.
description: To provide that no person doing business in this state shall require a consumer to present a printed receipt as proof of purchase of any consumer good or service.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Requiring Hotels And Short-term Rental Operators To Disclose The Total Cost Of Occupancy To Consumers Prior To Purchase.
description: To require hotel and short-term rental operators to disclose the total cost of occupancy, including all fees imposed for such occupancy, prior to purchase.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Grocery Store Beer Permittees.
description: To authorize additional grocery stores to sell beer.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Prohibiting Commercial Activities Involving Food Products That Contain Certain Food Additives.
description: To prohibit commercial activities involving food products that contain certain food additives.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Public Disclosure Of Certain Information Regarding Pharmaceutical Representatives.
description: To eliminate the requirement that the Department of Consumer Protection prominently post on its Internet web site a list containing certain information regarding pharmaceutical representatives.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Concerning Cannabinoids, Hemp And Hemp Products.
description: To (1) redefine "marijuana" to exclude certain products, (2) define "naturally manufactured hemp cannabinoid" and "low-THC hemp product", (3) redefine "synthetic cannabinoid", "independent testing laboratory", "manufacture" and "manufacturer hemp product", (4) authorize licensees to sell high-THC hemp products and naturally manufactured hemp cannabinoids to certain persons, (5) authorize additional persons to conduct testing of manufacturer hemp products and modify various requirements concerning testing procedures, (6) authorize unlicensed sales of certain low-THC hemp products, (7) modify various requirements concerning packaging, presenting and advertising manufacturer hemp products, and (8) modify various provisions concerning the THC content of hemp and manufacturer hemp products.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning Oversight Of Hotels, Motels And Inns For The Purpose Of Preventing And Combating Human Trafficking.
description: To require the Department of Consumer Protection to (1) oversee hotels, motels and inns for the purpose of preventing and combating human trafficking, and (2) impose a civil penalty on the owner of any hotel, motel or inn that fails to adhere to any applicable law or regulation intended to prevent or combat human trafficking in hotels, motels and inns.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/10

title: An Act Concerning Cancellation Of Telecommunications Services.
description: To provide that (1) a consumer may cancel any telecommunications service during a billing cycle, and (2) in the event of any such cancellation, the telecommunications company providing such service shall (A) not charge the consumer for any period following such cancellation, and (B) provide a pro rata rebate to the consumer for any prepaid telecommunications service.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on General Law

title: An Act Permitting Redaction Fees For The Disclosure Of Records Created By Police Body-worn Recording Equipment Or Dashboard Cameras Under The Freedom Of Information Act.
description: To authorize a public agency to charge a fee for the redaction of certain records created by police body-worn recording equipment or dashboard cameras as authorized under state or federal law prior to disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act.
last_action: File Number 77

title: An Act Requiring A Study Of State Agency Response Times To Freedom Of Information Act Requests.
description: To study state agency response times to requests under the Freedom of Information Act and submit a report concerning such study to ensure that such responses are timely.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Conveying A Parcel Of State Land In The Town Of Cheshire To The Town Of Cheshire.
description: To convey a parcel of state land located in the town of Cheshire to the town of Cheshire for purposes of parking and driveway expansion.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Oversight

title: An Act Eliminating The Board Of Regents For Higher Education.
description: To eliminate the Board of Regents for Higher Education and reinstate the Board of Trustees for Community Colleges and a Board of Trustees for State Universities.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Protecting Participants In Title Ix Proceedings At Institutions Of Higher Education.
description: To provide immunity from liability for students and employees of institutions of higher education who report or disclose being a victim of sexual assault, stalking or intimate partner violence and participate or testify in any Title IX investigation or proceedings.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Requiring Cafeterias On The Campuses Of Connecticut State Community College.
description: To require the Connecticut State Community College to maintain a functioning cafeteria on each campus.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Public Hearing 03/07

title: An Act Allowing Learning In Retirement Programs At Connecticut State Community College Campuses.
description: To require the Connecticut State Community College to allow Learning in Retirement programs to operate on the campuses of said college.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement

title: An Act Improving Safety On The Campuses Of Institutions Of Higher Education.
description: To require institutions of higher education to provide training and adopt procedures to respond to and prevent incidents of hate, harassment and racial, religious or ethnic bias.
committee: Joint Higher Education and Employment Advancement
last_action: Public Hearing 03/07

title: An Act Expanding Medicaid Eligibility For Older Persons And Persons With Disabilities.
description: To expand access to Medicaid by disregarding certain income in determining eligibility of disabled adult children.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Eliminating The Requirement That Medicaid And Husky B Cover Weight Loss Drugs And Bariatric Surgery.
description: To eliminate the requirement that prescription weight loss drugs and bariatric surgery be covered for Medicaid and HUSKY B beneficiaries.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning The Ratio Of Social Services, Mental Health And Substance Abuse Services Provided By The State And Private Nonprofit Providers.
description: To study the ratio of certain services provided by the state and nonprofit providers.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning Payment Parity For Dental Services Funded Under The Husky Health Program.
description: To achieve parity in payments for dental services under the HUSKY Health program.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Concerning Legislative Approval For Changes To The Husky Health Program Reimbursement And Care Delivery Model.
description: To require legislative approval for changes to the HUSKY Health program reimbursement and care delivery model.
last_action: File Number 165

title: An Act Concerning Expanding Access To State-funded Assisted Living Services.
description: To expand access to state-funded assisted living services to allow senior citizens to age in place and save state funds spent on skilled nursing facility care.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services

title: An Act Establishing A Tax On Certain Unoccupied Residential Property.
description: To establish a tax on certain unoccupied residential property.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Establishing Rules For No-fault Evictions.
description: To establish rules for no-fault evictions and exceptions for such evictions.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State To Fund Affordable And Workforce Housing Development In Certain Municipalities.
description: To provide funding for affordable and workforce housing development in certain municipalities that have not met the threshold for exemption from the affordable housing appeals procedure.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Establishing A Working Group To Study And Develop Best Practices To Promote Housing Growth And Protect The State's Water Supply.
description: To establish a working group to study and develop best practices to promote housing growth and protect the state's water supply and report on such working group's findings.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Establishing A Cap For Annual Rent Increases In Mobile Manufactured Home Parks.
description: To cap annual rent increases in mobile manufactured home parks.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on General Law

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study Municipal Penalties For Landlords For Health And Safety Violations.
description: To establish a task force to study municipal penalties for landlords for health and safety violations and determine other mechanisms to resolve such violations that encourage appropriate repairs and ensure tenants have habitable housing.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prohibiting A Housing Provider From Considering A Prospective Tenant's Felony Conviction Record After A Certain Time Period.
description: To prohibit a housing provider from considering a prospective tenant's felony conviction record after a certain time period.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring Bipartisan Membership Of Fair Rent Commissions.
description: To require that the membership of each municipal fair rent commission be bipartisan and consist of landlords who own property in such municipality and tenants who reside in such municipality.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prohibiting The Eviction Of A Residential Tenant For Nonpayment Of Rent If The Landlord's Online Rental Payment System Prevents Such Payment Of Rent.
description: To prohibit a landlord from evicting a tenant for nonpayment of rent if the landlord's online rental payment system prevents the tenant from paying such rent.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Prohibiting Eviction For Lapse Of Time Of Certain Tenants.
description: To prohibit an eviction for lapse of time for tenants residing in a property containing five or more dwelling units.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Housing

title: An Act Requiring That Certain Eviction Records Be Sealed.
description: To require that certain eviction records be sealed.
last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Medical Foods For Individuals Diagnosed With Phenylketonuria.
description: To require health insurance coverage for medical foods for individuals diagnosed with phenylketonuria.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Motorized Wheelchairs.
description: To: (1) Require health insurance coverage for (A) motorized wheelchairs, including, but not limited to, used motorized wheelchairs, requested by insureds, (B) motorized wheelchair repairs, and (C) motorized wheelchair battery replacements; and (2) require health insurers to establish centralized locations to collect used motorized wheelchairs.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Certain Obesity Treatments.
description: To require individual and group health insurance policies to provide coverage for certain obesity treatments, including, but not limited to, bariatric surgery.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning The Regulation Of Stop Loss Insurance.
description: To (1) increase the attachment point for stop loss insurance policies for certain self-insured small businesses, and (2) require the Insurance Commissioner to report on the feasibility of implementing a minimum loss ratio and other consumer protections for stop loss insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Medical Loss Ratio For Dental Insurance.
description: To establish the same medical loss ratio for dental insurance that exists for medical insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Establishing A Dental Loss Ratio.
description: To: (1) Establish a dental loss ratio of not less than eighty-three per cent for any dental insurance policy issued in this state; (2) require any dental insurer that fails to satisfy such dental loss ratio to issue rebates to covered persons of an amount that results in such dental insurer satisfying such dental loss ratio; and (3) establish expenditure reporting requirements for dental insurers, including an evaluation of the proportion of funds allocated to patient care versus administrative costs, marketing costs and profits.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Compliance With Mental Health Parity Laws.
description: To: (1) Require the Insurance Department to conduct regular audits of health insurance companies to ensure compliance with the Paul Wellstone and Pete Domenici Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act of 2008, P.L. 110-343, as amended from time to time, and regulations adopted thereunder, and the mental health parity laws and regulations in this state; and (2) establish a civil penalty of fifty thousand dollars per incident for any health insurance company that fails to comply with federal or state mental health parity laws and regulations.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Geographic Location As A Factor In Determining Premium Rates.
description: To prohibit any insurance company from using geographic location as a factor in determining premium rates.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring In-network Rates During Health Insurance Contract Disputes.
description: To require any health insurance contract between a health carrier and a hospital to include provisions providing for continued treatment for covered persons from in-network providers at the in-network rate, including, but not limited to, cost-sharing, during disputes between such health carrier and hospital.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Early Child Care Workers.
description: To allow any early child care worker to obtain health insurance coverage under the state employee health plan.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Nonprofits Under The State Employee Health Plan.
description: To allow any nonprofit to obtain health insurance coverage under the state employee health plan.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Prohibiting The Removal Of Participating Providers Until The End Of A Policy Period.
description: To prohibit participating providers from being removed from any covered person's network during a health insurance policy period.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning The Burden Of Proof During Adverse Determination And Utilization Review.
description: To establish a rebuttable presumption that health carriers shall bear the burden of proving that certain health care services under adverse determination or utilization review are not medically necessary.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Regulating Rebates By Pharmacy Benefits Managers.
description: To require that (1) pharmacy benefits managers' rebates are calculated at the point of sale based on the net price of the prescription drug, and (2) pharmacy benefits managers certify compliance with the Insurance Department.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Contracts Between Pharmacy Benefits Managers And Health Carriers To Provide Fee-based Compensation.
description: To require that any contract between a health carrier and a pharmacy benefits manager provide fee-based compensation that shall not be connected to the price of the prescription drug, any rebate, premiums or cost-sharing.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Closure Of A Patent Foramen Ovale.
description: To require that all individual and group health insurance policies provide health insurance coverage for the medical procedure for the closure of a patent foramen ovale.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning Investigations Of Executive Boards And Property Managers Of Common Interest Communities.
description: To (1) provide the Department of Consumer Protection and the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities with the ability to investigate any complaint that an executive board or property manager of a common interest community is violating (A) the civil rights of residents of such common interest community, or (B) conflict of interest rules, and (2) require that the conduct of any executive board of a common interest community may constitute state action for civil rights purposes.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring Health Insurance Coverage For Activity-specific Prosthetic And Orthotic Devices.
description: To require that all individual and group health insurance policies provide health insurance coverage for activity-specific prosthetic and orthotic devices.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Requiring The Insurance Department To Conduct A Study Of Certain Homeowners Insurance Practices.
description: To require that the Insurance Department (1) conduct a study of homeowners insurance practices that require policyholders to make repairs or modifications to such policyholders' residential properties as a condition of granting or maintaining coverage, and (2) submit a report by January 1, 2026, on the findings of such study and provide recommendations to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to insurance.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Insurance and Real Estate

title: An Act Concerning The Penalty For Assaulting A Coach.
description: To promote safety of coaches in youth sports, thus promoting the safety of those promoting team sports and sportsmanship.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning An Application By A Tribe To Convert A Parcel Of Fee Interest Land To Federal Trust Status.
description: To remove the mandate that the Attorney General oppose any application by a tribe to convert any parcel of fee interest land to federal trust status.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Adoption Of Frozen Embryos.
description: To authorize the adoption of frozen embryos.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Consideration Of Geographic Factors When Determining The Location For A Person's Jury Service.
description: To require that a potential juror's geographic proximity to the location of a courthouse be a factor in determining where the jury service is to occur, taking into consideration that a potential juror's place of residence may be in closer geographic proximity to a courthouse located in a different judicial district.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning Liability For Agricultural Operations Engaged In Agritourism.
description: To recognize the inherent risks in participating in agritourism activities and limit the liability of agricultural operators engaged in agritourism in the state.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Proposed Relocation Of A Probate Court.
description: To improve access to services offered by a Probate Court, especially for services needed by children, by requiring that any change of location for a Probate Court be approved by all of the municipalities comprising the probate district.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Increasing The Fees That May Be Charged By A Notary Public.
description: To increase the statutory fee for the performance of a notarial act from a fee of not exceeding five dollars to a fee of not exceeding ten dollars.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Imposing Fines Against Persons Who Participate In Marriage Fraud.
description: To prevent knowing and wilful immigration and marriage fraud.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Prohibiting Discrimination In The Provision Of Health Care Services.
description: To prevent discrimination in health care.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Concerning The Presumption Of Joint Custody And Equal Shared Parenting Time In Matters Involving The Care And Custody Of A Minor Child.
description: To create a rebuttable presumption of joint custody and equal shared parenting time in matters involving the care and custody of a minor child.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary

title: An Act Removing The Requirement That The State Oppose Applications By Federally Recognized Indian Tribes To Convert Any Parcel Of Fee Interest Land To Federal Trust Status.
description: To remove the requirement that the state oppose any application by a federally recognized Indian tribe to convert any parcel of fee interest land to federal trust status.
last_action: File Number 328

title: An Act Concerning Workers' Compensation Benefits For Certain Mental Or Emotional Impairments.
description: To allow employees to receive workers' compensation benefits for mental or emotional impairments related to an employee's employment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Workers' Compensation Benefits For Firefighters And Other Workers Impacted By Similar Conditions That Are Diagnosed With Cancer.
description: To create a presumption that a firefighter's diagnosis of cancer arose out of and in the course of employment.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Breastfeeding In The Workplace.
description: To align state and federal law regarding break periods for the purpose of breastfeeding during the work day.
last_action: File Number 278

title: An Act Establishing A Full Employment Trust Fund.
description: To create a Full Employment Trust Fund to be administered by the Labor Department.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/20

title: An Act Expanding Paid Family And Medical Leave To All Employees.
description: To expand the Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program to include all employees, including those under collective bargaining agreements.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Prohibiting The State From Inquiring About The Sincerity Of A State Employee's Religious Beliefs When Requesting A Religious Exemption To A Vaccine Mandate.
description: To prohibit the state from inquiring about the sincerity of a state employee's religious beliefs when requesting a religious exemption to a vaccine mandate.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Employee Exposure To The Risk Of Heat Illness.
description: To protect workers from exposure to the risk of heat illness.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Concerning Limitations On The Use Of Nondisclosure Agreements.
description: To limit the misuse of nondisclosure agreements by adopting similar provisions from California, New Jersey and Washington law regarding limitations on the use of nondisclosure agreements.
last_action: Immediate Transmittal

title: An Act Establishing Disclosures For Job Postings And Employees.
description: To establish disclosures similar to Colorado's equal pay law to ensure pay transparency and eliminate wage disparities.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees

title: An Act Increasing The Per Diem Rate For Members Of The State Board Of Labor Relations And Compensation For Members Of The Board Of Mediation And Arbitration.
description: To increase the per diem rate for regular and alternate members of the State Board of Labor Relations.
last_action: Reported Out of Legislative Commissioners' Office

title: An Act Prohibiting Municipalities From Imposing Restrictions On Or Taking Adverse Action Against Any Person Who Reports A Suspected Fraudulent Marriage To United States Citizenship And Immigration Services.
description: To prohibit municipalities from (1) restricting any person from reporting a suspected fraudulent marriage to United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, or (2) taking adverse action against any such person for making any such report.
last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development

description: To (1) establish minimum nursing home staffing levels, and (2) impose stricter penalties for violations.

description: To study the need to establish extended producer responsibility programs for solar panels and wind turbine blades.

description: To reduce the minimum quarantine time from six to four months for dogs, cats and other animals that have been attacked and that may have been exposed to rabies.

description: To establish an overdose prevention center pilot program.

description: To make technical revisions to the education and early childhood statutes.

description: To require notice to owners of land potentially impacted by excavation, discharge of explosives or demolition by a public utilities company.

description: To make minor and technical revisions to statutes concerning energy and technology.

description: To require (1) an owner or operator of an artificial intelligence data center to submit quarterly reports to the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection, and (2) the commissioner to adopt regulations concerning water and energy efficiency standards for such data centers.

description: To require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to conduct a study concerning the operations, reliability, rates and regulatory oversight of electric utilities in the state.

description: To provide that persons engaged in making home improvements may satisfy certain disclosure requirements by disclosing an Internet web site address.

title: An Act Concerning Social Media Platforms And Online Services, Products And Features.
description: To (1) require the owner of a social media platform to incorporate an online safety center into, and establish a cyberbullying policy for, the owner's social media platform, (2) redefine "heightened risk of harm to minors" to include processing minors' personal data in a manner that presents any reasonably foreseeable risk of harm to minors' physical or mental health, and (3) require the controller of an online service, product or feature that is offered to minors to (A) include a default setting in such service, product or feature to prevent adults from sending unsolicited communications to minors, (B) not use any system design feature to significantly increase, sustain or extend minors' use of such service, product or feature, and (C) disclose to the Attorney General a plan established and implemented to mitigate or eliminate any heightened risk of harm to minors.
last_action: File Number 576

title: An Act Concerning Statements Of Financial Interests Under The State Code Of Ethics For Public Officials.
description: To require members of boards, commissions, committees and councils within the Executive Department with contract authority to file statements of financial interests and to permit the filing of the name of certain tax-sheltered annuity retirement plans in lieu of naming specific securities within such statements.
last_action: File Number 78

title: An Act Concerning Minor Revisions To The Higher Education Statutes Concerning The Establishment Of The Connecticut State Community College And The Board Of Regents For Higher Education.
description: To update references in the general statutes to the regional community-technical colleges to Connecticut State Community College and to the Board of Trustees of the Connecticut State University System and the Board of Trustees of the Community-Technical Colleges to the Board of Regents for Higher Education.
last_action: House Calendar Number 518

title: An Act Concerning Nonemergency Medical Transportation Standards.
description: To standardize requirements for nonemergency medical transportation drivers.

title: An Act Concerning Medicaid-covered Dental Care.
description: To expand preventive adult oral health services covered under Medicaid and require that Medicaid payment be made for eligible dental services and procedures at mobile dental clinics and school-based health centers and sites without requiring such services or procedures be provided in a single visit.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

title: An Act Concerning Compensating Spouses For State-funded Home Care.
description: To compensate spouses who provide personal care assistance to persons enrolled in the state-funded portion of the Connecticut home-care program for the elderly.

description: To increase Medicaid rates for community hospitals in rural areas to equal Medicare rates for the same services.

title: An Act Prohibiting The Eviction Of A Residential Tenant For Nonpayment Of Rent If The Landlord's Online Rental Payment System Prevents Such Payment Of Rent.
description: To prohibit a landlord from evicting a tenant for nonpayment of rent if the landlord's online rental payment system prevents the tenant from paying such rent.

title: An Act Concerning Nonresident Landlord Registration And Increasing Penalties For Repeat Building And Fire Code Violations.
description: To (1) require certain nonresident landlords, project-based housing providers or agents in charge of rental properties to register certain personal identifying information, and (2) increase penalties for repeat violations of building and fire codes.

title: An Act Prohibiting A Landlord From Retaliating Against A Tenant Who Prevails In A Fair Rent Commission Proceeding.
description: To prohibit a landlord from retaliating against a tenant who prevails in a fair rent commission proceeding.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/18

title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study Municipal Penalties For Landlords For Health And Safety Violations.
description: To establish a task force to study municipal penalties for landlords for health and safety violations and determine other mechanisms to resolve such violations that encourage appropriate repairs and ensure tenants have habitable housing.
last_action: File Number 206

title: An Act Eliminating Certain Funding Provisions From The Healthy Homes Fund.
description: To remove certain funding provisions from the Healthy Homes Fund.

description: To establish a working group to study and develop best practices to promote housing growth and protect the state's water supply.

description: To establish a starter homes working group.
last_action: Public Hearing 02/18

description: To allow for the assessment of fines for certain disciplinary actions in correctional facilities that shall be deposited in the Correctional General Welfare Fund for uses that may benefit all persons who are incarcerated.
last_action: File Number 796

title: An Act Authorizing Hospitals To Install Devices On An Exterior Wall Of An Emergency Department To Facilitate The Voluntary Surrender Of Infants To Emergency Department Staff.
description: To prevent infant abandonment and provide a safe and legal option for parents in crisis to voluntarily surrender an infant to emergency department staff.

title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Department Of Children And Families.
description: To (1) require criminal history searches and records checks for relative and fictive kin caregivers upon emergency placement of children with such caregivers by the Department of Children and Families, (2) permit certain youths previously committed to the care and custody of the Commissioner of Children and Families to reenter care, (3) require disclosure of Department of Children and Families records to the Department of Developmental Services and the Office of Policy and Management for certain purposes, (4) expand the definition of "child care facility" for purposes of licensure by the Department of Children and Families to include certain congregate care settings for individuals who require special education, until the end of the school year in which such individuals turn twenty-two years of age, (5) require the Department of Children and Families to develop a Foster Parent Bill of Rights and incorporate such bill of rights into department policy, and (6) revise the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children.
last_action: File Number 89

title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Labor Department.
description: To (1) reduce the amount of time an employer can protest unemployment benefits that such employer contends to have been improperly charged, (2) change the position of the Unemployed Workers' Advocate to classified service, (3) require physicians and advanced practice registered nurses to report suspected occupational diseases to the Labor Department, and (4) make technical changes to the labor statutes.

description: To specify that any unpaid penalty for a housing code violation or violation of public place ordinance shall constitute a lien upon the real estate against which the penalty was imposed from the date of such penalty.

description: To provide that telephone and telecommunications companies providing local telephone service, providers of commercial mobile radio service and providers of voice over Internet protocol service shall assess against each subscriber a fee in an amount equal to five cents per month per access line for deposit into the firefighters cancer relief account.

title: An Act Establishing A Cybersecurity Task Force.
description: To establish a cybersecurity task force.

description: To implement the recommendations of the Department of Administrative Services regarding (1) the appointment of acting building officials, (2) width and cross hatch requirements for parking spaces designated for persons who are blind and persons with disabilities, and (3) the renewal of elevator certificates of operation.

description: To permit naturopathic physicians to prescribe and administer vitamin B12.

description: To (1) increase the average monthly fluoride content of water systems, and (2) require the Commissioner of Public Health to adopt and administer by reference the United States Food and Drug Administration's Food Code and any revision thereto issued on or before December 31, 2024.

description: To prohibit private equity companies and real estate investment trusts from acquiring or increasing (1) any direct or indirect ownership interest in a nursing home, and (2) any operational or financial control in a nursing home.

description: To establish a working group to study value-based Medicaid reimbursement to nursing homes.

description: To require the Commissioner of Education to develop a program for the expansion of school choice in the state.

last_action: Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis 05/12/25 12:00 PM

description: To require (1) each board of education to develop a cardiac emergency response plan for each school governed by such board, and (2) the Department of Education to establish a grant program to assist schools, with a priority given to priority schools, with implementing cardiac emergency response plans and a procedure for monitoring adherence to cardiac emergency response plans.

description: To (1) amend various laws concerning (A) consumer data privacy and online monitoring by (i) defining and redefining various terms, (ii) modifying the applicability threshold for controllers and processors, (iii) modifying the entity-level and data-level exemptions, and (iv) imposing additional requirements regarding disclosures and sales of personal data, sensitive data and consumer health data, (B) social media by (i) redefining "social media platform", and (ii) prohibiting a social media platform from requiring a parent to establish an account to submit certain requests concerning a minor, and (C) youth data privacy and online monitoring by (i) defining "know", (ii) eliminating a rebuttable presumption, and (iii) modifying the scope of permissible controller conduct, and (2) provide for the registration and regulation of data brokers.
last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate

description: To implement the Department of Consumer Protection's recommendations regarding (1) public accountancy and certified public accountants, (2) architects and the practice of architecture, (3) real estate licensees, (4) the skilled trades, (5) major contractors, (6) new home construction contractors and the New Home Construction Guaranty Fund, (7) community association managers, (8) closing-out sales, (9) mobile manufactured homes and mobile manufactured home parks, (10) the Commissioner of Consumer Protection's enforcement powers and the enforcement powers of various boards and commissions, (11) pure food and drugs, (12) the Connecticut Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, (13) bakeries, food manufacturing establishments and food warehouses, (14) health clubs, (15) donation bins, (16) acceptance of cash as a form of payment, (17) the Connecticut Unfair Trade Practices Act, (18) the Home Solicitation Sales Act, (19) new motor vehicle warranties, (20) automatic renewal and continuous services provisions, and (21) mechanical contractors.

description: To require legislative confirmation of the appointment of the Medicaid director for the Department of Social Services.

description: To establish a Housing Growth Fund for a municipal grant program to increase the availability of affordable housing and maximize the amount of residential, commercial and leisure space near transit facilities.

description: To: (1) Prohibit certain provisions in pharmacy services contracts between pharmacy benefits managers and health carriers; (2) establish a duty of care for pharmacy benefits managers in this state; and (3) impose additional reporting requirements on the Insurance Department concerning prescription drug rebates.

description: To (1) add a just cause standard for certain teacher contract terminations, and (2) make the decision of a neutral hearing officer in teacher contract termination hearings binding on the parties.

description: To require medical device representatives to undergo credentialing by hospitals.

description: To require the licensure of lactation consultants.
